loans.name: Mr. Reth To Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of thirteen members is located in Kouk Trab village in Kandal province, and they plan T. use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Reth T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice T. process inT. palm sugar or wine. In his business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough bamboos T. support his business. Thus, he decided T. ask for a loan T. purchase more bamboos T. tie T. the palm trees in order T. climb up T. gather juice. His wife, Mrs. Phun Sok Khan, sells palm sugar. Mr. Reth T. is 48 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another sells ice-cream and the others are enrolled in the local school.

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT loans are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. It allows them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T.. Most clients start T. make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to tie to palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice

loans.name: Nichitici

texts.en: V. is 60 years old and lives in the Calarasi district of Tibirica village. Since her childhood, she has liked to help her parents with vegetables, seeds, and cultivation. Therefore, she decided to enter the same business. At this moment, she wants to extend her business in order to gain more profit for her family. Ms. Nichitici has been in the business for more than 10 years and she likes her job. V. has 10 hectares of arable lands that bring her a very good amount of products, but now she needs to irrigate and process the land to make it more fertile. The purpose of the loan is to buy fuel and seeds. We hope the loan borrowed by MicroInvest will help V. to extend her business.

loans.use: seeds and fuel purchase

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice N. is currently in the business of selling clothes at a shop and has applied for a loan to help her expand her business.  Joice is 26 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorcycle.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Aabbass

texts.en:
Aabbass is a 41-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Aabbass has been working as a painter for seventeen years. He requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. 

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Aabbass chose his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Aabbass will use the loan to purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es socio del Banco Comunal Urubamba, Marcelo es de la comunidad de Huascahura que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Marcelo es casado, tiene 49 años y 7 hijos, Marcelo compra y vende ganado vacuno, porcino, animales que compra en la ciudad de Andahuaylas y otras ferias de la región. Además Marcelo es artesano textil, realiza trabajos como frazadas, pasadizos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad.
Marcelo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un toro.
Los sueños de Marcelo son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a member of the Banco Comunal Urubamba, and is from the community of Huascahura which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Marcel is married, 49 years old, and has seven children. Marcelo buys and sells cattle and pigs, animals which he buys in the city of Andahuaylas and other markets in the region. Furthermore, Marcel is a textile artisan creating works such as blankets and rugs which is sells in the market of the city.

Marcelo needs a loan of 1,000 PEN which he will invest in the purchase of a bull. The dream of Marcelo is that his children become professionals and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Tereza tiene 48 años de edad, nació en una pequeña comunidad de San Juan Rió Coco, casada, su esposo es conductor y en tiempo libre es albañil, actualmente reside en Managua en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa. La señora Tereza trabaja como docente en un colegio público en el cual tiene cuatro años de experiencia laboral, su trabajo lo empezó como docente comunitaria en San Juan de Rió Coco, cuenta con 17 años de experiencia,  acomunada como docente, ella imparte clases privada en sus tiempo libres, en su matrimonio procreo tres hijos, una 16 años, y un par de gemelos de 13 años, sus meta para su familia es terminar de construir su casa y heredar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. Su visión es poder seguir transmitiendo sus conocimientos y desarrollando capacidades intelectuales en alumnos preparándolos para un futuro mejor en el cual tengan mejores oportunidades y contribuyan con el desarrollo económico. Con ayuda de su marido y su trabajo ha venido construyendo su hogar poco a poco, este es su sexto crédito el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir un  cuarto de habitación y tener mayor espacio y  comodidad en su hogar. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que ha brindado a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Tereza is 48 years old. She was born in the small community of San Juan Rió Coco. She is married; her husband is a conductor and a laborer in his spare time. She lives in the Hialeah IV neighborhood of Managua and has worked for 14 years as a teacher in a public school. She began as a community teacher in San Juan de Rió Coco for 17 years. She teaches private classes in her spare time. She has three children, a 16-year-old daughter and 13-year old twins. Her goal for her family is to finish building her house and leave a good inheritance for her children. Her vision is to be able to continue imparting her knowledge and developing the intellectual capacity of students to prepare them for a better future, in which they will have better opportunities and contribute to economic development. With her husband's help and her own job she has continued building her house little by little. This is her sixth loan which she will use for construction materials to build a living room so that her home will be more spacious and comfortable. She thanks Afodenic for the support they have provided to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room for her home

loans.name: Margreth

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Margreth L. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 6 and 21. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Margreth has been running a poultry business since 2003. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Margreth works at the business for 10 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her children. She currently earns about $400 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Margreth thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Sibula. She is 35 years old. Maria is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Maria is just starting this business.

In 2008, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milient is a 26-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. She lives with her family in Likoni Mombasa. Her husband works with a filling station. She is the proprietor of two enterprises: one dealing with sale of cosmetic items, initiated in 2007, and the other being sale of clothing materials. She gets her merchandise, to sell, both within Mombasa town and, at times, travel to Kampala Uganda. She deals in fast-selling items which are well-liked by her customers. She has applied for US$ 550 to help her to get more supplies (especially clothing materials) from Kampala Uganda.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothing materials.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
R. Mahbuba was born in 1952 in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. She is a happy mother and grandmother who has, during her whole life, worked hard to ensure a good future for her children. She works in the local structure on gas delivery. Her husband works in the local hospital. Mahbuba’s eldest son intends to get married this summer. She made capital repairs to her house and now she wants to build a small summer terrace so that the whole family can sit around the big table. She is applying to KIVA with the request of a loan of 1400 TJS for building this terrace. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following steps of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” seeks a transformation into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore, in October of 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization, known as “Arvand”.
“Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To build the small summer terrace, home improvement.

loans.name: Kayo

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, ce commerce lui réussit bien car elle est la seule femme à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, elle exerce ce commerce dan sa boutique qu’elle a appelé « GOSS WAY ». Elle veut agrandir son commerce pour réaliser plus de recettes, elle demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de boutons, 6 tas  de fermeture, des fils de couture et divers articles de mercerie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman began selling sewing notions in 2008. The business is going well since she is the only person to sell these items in her neighborhood. She works out of her shop she calls « GOSS WAY ». She would like to expand her business so as to make more income. She is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 2 cartons of buttons, 6 piles of zippers, sewing thread and various other sewing necessities.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Karen Daisy

texts.es:
Karen es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Karen es conviviente tiene 29 años, no tiene hijos, estudio computación, pero no lo ejerce. 
Karen tenía un puesto de ferretería en el mercado del Callao, y ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de menú, pero tenia que cerrar su puesto. Tuvo que decidir cerrar su negocio de ferretería por que quedaba muy lejos, ella  vive en Villa el Salvador y la distancia en tiempo es de 1 hora y media; decidió poner con su esposo una tienda de lubricantes en Villa el Salvador desde hace cinco años.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser solidaria y aprendió más sobre negocio.
Karen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de aceites, cables y repuestos de carro. 
El sueño de Karen es que su negocio crezca para poder comprar el local donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Karen is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de las Mercedes”. She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and does not have any children. Karen studied computer science, but does not currently work in that field.

At first, Karen helped her mother sell prepared foods, but she eventually had to close her business. She then operated a vending post selling hardware at the market in Callao. Karen lives in Villa el Salvador, which is 1 ½ hours distance away. She elected to close her hardware business because it was too far to travel. Karen decided to go into business with her husband to open a lube shop in Villa el Salvador, which has been in business now for 5 years.

Since joining FINCA, Karen has learned more about business and how to be supportive of her other group members. She currently needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase motor oil, cables, and automobile spare parts. Karen hopes that her business will grow so that she can purchase the location on which her business is situated.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil, cables, and automobile spare parts

loans.name: Jireh Group

texts.en:
Mariledis is the leader of the group Jireh. This group of entrepreneurs is on their second loan after faithfully paying back their last loan on time. Now they are looking for a larger loan to continue growing their businesses. 

Mariledis started a business three years ago selling seafood. Last year she decided to take out a microloan of $140 to grow her business and that little bit of money went a long way. She was able to buy more inventory and increase her sales tremendously. Mariledis is looking for another loan in order to buy more fish and crab (the most popular items) in order to increase her sales even more. 

Right now she is selling these items from her house, but it is her dream to one day open up her own store downtown. She has two children, ages 16 and 15, and she would also like to grow her business enough to be able to send them to college. 

You can help Mariledis and the rest of the Jireh group achieve their dreams by supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase fish and crab

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en: M. Jackline is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a friendly and trustworthy lady with a business of selling produce, mostly matooke and Irish potatoes from the Kazo trading centre in Ibanda. She has a large banana plantation where she gets most of her produce to sell but also buys from other farmers when the season is poor, like with the Irish potatoes. She is married with 3 children and works very hard to ensure that their school fees are paid on time. She needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke to sell since the last season was not a favorable one for her. She also wants to partially pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more matooke (banana produce) to sell and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva M. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Primitiva is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Primitiva owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Primitiva has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Primitiva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Primitiva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Primitiva is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Primitiva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 60 años y 03 hijos ya independientes.Teresa de Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a arreglar pantalones, blusas y vestidos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Teresa de Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús has been working as a seamstress for many years. Little by little she was generating her own income and saving her money. She makes pants, blouses, and dresses. She tells us that it is going very well for her. She is set up in her own house where she takes care of her customers. She works by special order. She is currently in the same business and has faithful customers who go to her house every day to put in orders. She personally attends to her customers with the kindness that she is noted for. With this loan for 800 PEN she will buy meters of different types of fabrics, instruments she uses like scissors, sewing needles and machine needles, pins, and buttons. Teresa de Jesús now feels like an accomplished woman with a great desire to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping a lot of women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meters of fabric, needles, and pins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for his mini market

loans.name: Edgar Erasmo

texts.es:
El socio EDGAR pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos tres varones y una mujer. Los tres varones son profesionales y la mujer estudia contabilidad en la universidad particular “Andina del Cusco”. El es cesante jubilado.   

El socio tiene una pequeña cabina de Internet donde trabaja a medio tiempo. 

El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar la cabina de Internet y para el gasto familiar
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
EDGAR is a partner of the community bank "MINIBANK". He is from the town of Cusco. He is 63 years old, married with 3 sons and 1 daughter. The three sons ar professionals and the daughter studies accounting at the private university "Andina del Cusco. He is retired and has a small internet café where he works half-time.

The partner needs the loan to improve the internet café and to provide for his family. The partner is grateful for the opportunity and promises to repay the loan punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve an internet café.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta C. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occ. She is 52 years old. Alberta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alberta operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as bread, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Alberta is just starting this business. In 2007, Alberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from GDMPC. Alberta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Alberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Weliba

texts.en:
Weliba I. is currently in the business of selling clothes in a market and is requesting a loan to stock new materials of clothes to sell. Weliba is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock new materials of clothes to sell

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe E. F., vive junto a sus padres, dos sobrinos y un hijo de nueve años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda llamada “el rinconcito”, negocio el cual le permite darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y así mismo brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Morena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para su tienda, así mismo para surtirla con papelería, ya que se acerca la temporada de inicio de clases y ella desea poder aprovecharla al máximo, de manera de aumentar sus ventas, lo cual le permita invertir aún más en su negocio. Morena desea poder mejorar su negocio y aprovechar muy bien la excelente ubicación que posee, ya que ella espera brindarles toda la ayuda necesaria a sus padres los cuales dependen de ella y así mismo darle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo, ya que Morena es madre soltera y es la única que vela por el bienestar de él, quien es el motor que la incentiva a esforzarse más cada día.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe E. F. lives with her parents, two nephews, and a nine-year-old son who is in school. She lives in the town of Soaypango, in the San Salvador department. She owns a store called “El Rinconcito” (The Little Corner) which allows her to give her son everything he needs while also supporting her parents. Morena is requesting a loan with which to purchase more products for her store, to stock paper products since it is nearing the time when classes start and she wishes to maximize on this fact to increase her sales. This will allow her to invest even more in her business.

Morena wishes to be able to improve her business and take advantage of the excellent location that she has. She hopes to be able to support all of her parents’ needs because they depend on her. She wishes to give her young son everything he needs because Morena is a single mom and the only one with his best interests in mind. Her son is the motor which motivates her to work harder every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Paper Products

loans.name: Ramona Emperatriz

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado Central, la señora Ramona M. se dedica a la venta de enchiladas elaboradas por ella misma. A diario se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana a preparar las enchiladas y en todo el día una vez que  cae la tarde, ella va de compras para adquirir la materia prima para el día siguiente preparar dichas enchiladas.
Ella está solicitando un crédito porque requiere invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar las enchiladas, ella comprará tortillas, frijoles, aceite, leña, entre otros. Por este motivo es que anhela que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su actividad ya que ella vende ambulantemente en el mercado cargando una pana donde lleva las enchiladas para venderlas.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, specifically in the central market, Mrs. Ramona M. makes and sells enchiladas (a rolled-up tortilla with meat or cheese filling with chili). Daily she wakes up at 4 in the morning to make the enchiladas; she works all day until night falls and she goes to buy the raw material to prepare the next days’ enchiladas.

She needs the loan because she wants to buy the raw materials to prepare the enchiladas, with it she will buy tortillas, beans, oil, firewood among other things. This is why she wants this loan given to her so that she will better her work conditions since she is a street vendor and carries the enchiladas in a tray to sell them in the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make enchiladas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cereals and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Remove

texts.es: REMOVE L.
texts.en:
They are hard-working people who make garments like t-shirts and pants, among others. They have been doing this for over five years. It is the strongest source of income in the community. They all sell their products in the San Francisco El Alto municipality, which is 25 kilometers from the community. They currently need a L.. They have come to the ASDIR Association to be able to get the financing. They have grouped together so that the cost of selling their products is lower. That way they get better earnings, and at the same time they are able to increase the capital that each one of them manages.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REMOVE LOAN

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime, es cliente nuevo recomendado por su Sr. Padre, quien es cliente antiguo y responsable de Emprender, hace poco él se hizo de pareja, tiene un hijo recien nacido, la pareja se dedica a los trabajos del hogar, en cambio Jaime estudia y trabaja, proximo a egresar como técnico en máquinas, es una persona joven y muy activa, responsable y emprendedor en sus negocios, ya que el viaja por lo menos una vez al mes a conseguir su mercadería a la ciudad de Oruro y a veces hasta Iquique, ya que a la par se dedica a la venta de llantas y repuestos para automoviles.

El deseo del Sr Jaime es el de salir profesional y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Jaime is a new client recommended by his father, who is a long-standing, responsible client of Emprender. He became partnered recently and has a new-born son. His partner is a housewife while Jaime studies and works; he is near graduating as a machine technician. He is a young, very active young man who is responsible and enterprising in his businesses. He travels at least once a month to get merchandise in the city of Oruro, sometimes he goes as far as Iquique. He sells tires and automobile spare parts. Jaime's wish is to become a professional in order to improve his family's quality of life. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa D. est une ouakamoise de 53 ans qui a adhéré  depuis deux ans a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC ou elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Elle est parente bénéficiaire, mariée et mère  de 9 enfants.  Elle a pendant 5 ans  évolué  dans le commerce de couscous et de produits locaux. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but d’éviter le chômage  mais aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour acquérir une table dans le nouveau marche de Ouakam qui est en cours d’installation ce qui lui donnera l’occasion de diversifier son activité en incorporant dans son activité la vente de légumes. Son premier crédit lui a permis d’épargner de l’argent et elle a note une progression dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa D. is a 53-year old woman from Ouakam who has been a member of the U-IMCEC savings institution for the past two years and has already had one loan. She is a parent member, married and mother to nine children. For five years she has been developing a couscous and local products business. She chose this activity with the aim of escaping unemployment but also to procure an income. She is applying for a loan of 75,000 francs to acquire a table in the new market at Ouakam which is being installed; this will give her the opportunity to diversify her business by incorporating the sale of vegetables. Her first loan allowed her to save some money and she is noticing that her business is making progress.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: To earn a living in Ogbomosho, Janet sells colorful sarongs. Her customers are mostly young ladies and married women. She loves this business because of the opportunity it gives her to interact with people, and she hopes to one day have her own boutique where she will continue to sell only sarongs. She has applied for a loan for N150,000 to buy more sarongs to sell. Janet is 32 years old, married and takes great joy in her four children, all of whom are excelling in school. Her husband also works hard to support their family, and the couple extends sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old and married. She runs a pharmacy in her home town to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has one employee. She is a hardworking lady who also practices commercial farming to earn extra income.

Caroline is determined and focused to improve her living conditions now that she has joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Imani. She saves her money on a weekly basis with her group which guarantees loans to its members.

Caroline hopes to grow her pharmacy and also expand her farming business to large scale farming in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of antibiotics.

Caroline is photoed with the husband in her pharmacy.

loans.use: To add stock of antibiotics

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. H. is 43 years old.  She lives in a rural communinty in Kompong Tom province, where she works growing crops to make a living. She started her job when she was single, but is now married to Pious, a 40-year-old construction laborer. The couple has three children who are enrolled in school and dependent on their income. Seng S. H. has an old house that cracks when the rain falls, so it may need repairs. Because of that, she is applying for a loan to fix her old house.

loans.use: to fix her old house

loans.name: Ronieri

texts.en:
After gaining valuable experience working for someone else, Ronieri knew he was ready to open his own business. Based on his understanding of the retail perfume business and his talent for working with the public, he knew he could run a successful perfume store.  He even knew where he wanted to open his store - in a kiosk at a mall.  But this Brazilian native wanted to be smart about financing his business.

Ronieri could have used credit cards to finance the purchase of his new kiosk and his initial inventory, but he was well aware of the high interest rate he'd have to pay.  So he contacted a government loan program and began their loan application process.  Unfortunately, they weren't used to dealing with a smaller retail start-up business, and asked for mountains of paperwork and documentation.  Ronieri was getting frustrated by the time and effort required to borrow money.

Then he decided to contact ACCION USA.  Since he had so much of his paperwork already in order, his loan approval was quite quick.  He set-up his kiosk and has already hired part-time help.  Ronieri is hoping, one day, to expand into a storefront in the same mall.  When he does, he hopes to have another positive experience working with ACCION USA to get his financing.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: 

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. 

 

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Dilrabokhon

texts.en: H. Dilrabokhon is 38 years old and is married with three children. She sells sweets (candies), preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents in her grocery store. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Dilrabokhon is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Dilrabokhon is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 4,000 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help her reach all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S., 56, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Julieta owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 27 years. When free from farming duties, she also spends time growing pigs for breeding and hopes to acquire additional piglets.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She also plans to buy additional feed and piglets. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Julieta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dulce Maria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama DULCE MARIA, porque les gusto el nombre y por que quieren que se endulce su vida. Está ubicado en el Estado de México; en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.

Magdalena M. García es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 40 años, estudió hasta el 2° año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos, 1 mujer  y 3 varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y bordados de manteles y mandiles que inició hace 1 año la venta de ropa y 13 años los bordados. Solicita el préstamo para surtir en ropa y en hilos para sus bordados. Sus clientes se expresan bien de la señora ya que les vente la ropa en pagos y los bordados que realiza son muy creativos y bonitos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta e ilusionada ya que podrá crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.   Quiere este crédito para poder darse a conocer en otras comunidades pero necesita tener gran cantidad de surtido para poder realizar las ventas fuera de su comunidad.   También espera poder seguirle dando estudio a sus hijos ya que son los que la motivan a seguir adelante.

Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María Luz Se ve los manteles  de Magdalena además de la mandiles y ropa que vende de la cual cuenta con un amplio surtido en la foto.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
De J. Del R. Juana  Venta de Dulces
F. M. Marcela           Venta de Tortillas
H. H. Anatolia          Venta de Tortillas
H. M. Ibeth 	        Venta de Tortillas
M. G. María Luz         Venta de Ropa
R. G. Angela            Venta de Dulces
T. M. Juliana           Venta de Papelería
V. H. Cecilia           Venta de Pollos
texts.en:
This group is called DULCE MARIA (Sweet Maria), because they like the name and because they want life to become sweeter. It’s located in the state of Mexico, in Mexico. The group has 10 members. Magdalena M. García is the president of the group. She is 40 years old, studied until second grade in elementary school, is a merchant and has 4 children in total, 1 girl and 3 boys. She sells clothes and embroidered tablecloths and aprons. She started selling the clothes a year ago and the embroidery 13 years ago. She is soliciting the loan to stock up on clothes and thread for her embroidery. Her customers say good things about her, since she lets them pay for the clothes in instalments and the embroidery she does is very creative and beautiful. She feels very happy and excited requesting the loan, since she will be able to grow her business and increase her sales. She wants this loan so that she can become known in other communities; she needs a large amount of stock in order to sell outside of her community. She also hopes to keep her children in school, since they are the ones that motivate her to get ahead. This photo was taken in the house of Maria Luz. Magdalena’s table clothes are visible, as well as the aprons and clothes that she sells, of which there is an amply supply in the photo. The other members of the group are: De J. Del R. Juana Venta de Dulces F. M. Marcela Venta de Tortillas H. H. Anatolia Venta de Tortillas H. M. Ibeth Venta de Tortillas M. G. María Luz Venta de Ropa R. G. Angela Venta de Dulces T. M. Juliana Venta de Papelería V. H. Cecilia Venta de Pollos

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothes and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Lorenzo de la Ciudad de Caaguazú son 17 mujeres que se reunieron con el fin  de formar un grupo solidario en donde la responsabilidad es  conjunta. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como: vendedoras de ropas,venta de zapatos, venta de comidas, modista, tienen despensa, venta de frutas y verduras, etc. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, quien es una mujer luchadora y muy activa, trabaja mucho para mantener unido a su grupo, realizando actividades de integración y tambien para recaudar fondos.
Ella tiene un negocio en su casa donde ofrece articulos de usos del hogar, cuentan con buena cantidad de clientes. 
Su marido trabaja y tambien la ayuda en su negocio y todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de articulos varios para su negocio como azucar, harina, fideos, aceites, carbón y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the city of Caaguazú. The group consists of 17 women who gathered to form a solidarity group in which they share joint responsibility. They work independently in their own businesses selling clothing, shoes, food, handmade clothing, groceries, fruits, vegetables, and other products.

One of the members is Sra. María. She is a determined and active woman who has worked hard to maintain unity in her group by organizing teambuilding and fundraising activities. María has a business in her home where she offers household goods to her many customers. Her husband works and helps with the business while all of her children attend school. They are a united and hardworking family.

María is requesting a loan to buy various products for her business such as sugar, flour, noodles, oil, charcoal, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, noodles, oil, charcoal, and other items

loans.name: We Hope To God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “We Hope To God” group. They are small-scale businesswomen who are based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 3,700,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Aminata J.. Aminata was born in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch.  She is age thirty-two, married with two children. Her husband is a tailor and one of her children is attending primary school while the other is still suckling. 

Aminata makes a living through the selling of clothing and plastic bowls. Aminata has been selling clothes and plastic bowls for ten years now. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy more clothes and plastic bowls to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy more clothes and plastic bowls to add to her current stock

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a 42-year-old gentleman who is married and has three children. He has a printing shop on Kirinyaga road in Nairobi city center, and he normally does printing of items on bags, t-shirts, caps, pens and any other thing he is asked to print on. 

His clients vary because of the nature of the business.  He was very busy during the last few weeks because he was printing for the political people during the constitutional period in Kenya. He says that he is able to take home an income of about $500 every month which is a big plus for him.

John has been a KADET client for a while now and he is currently requesting his third loan which he will use to add more stock of the things he uses to do the printing work and also to expand his business.

He want his business to expand to other areas outside Nairobi and also to educate his children.

loans.use: To expand his printing business

loans.name: Albertina Atalia

texts.pt:
Albertina Atalia H. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, casada mãe de um 4 filhos de 6 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Sai de Maputo para o reino da Suazilândia com o seu esposo e regressaram em 1996, onde iniciaram a actividade comercial para sustentar a família. Vende frangos vivos, não possui empregados e consegue cerca de 4.000.00 por semana, onde aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa e no banco. 

Ja teve empréstimo no Novo Banco e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que trabalham juntas e que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais pintos ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo. No futuro pretende construir aviário ainda maior.
texts.en:
Albertina Atalia H. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is a married mother of four children who are between 6 and 19 years old. All of her children attend school. She only completed 7th grade herself and did not continue because of financial reasons. She lives in her own home with her family and she supports her mother by sending her some money for her household expenses.

She left Maputo for Swaziland with her husband, and returned in 1996, when she began her business to support her family. She sells live chickens, she does not have any employees, and she makes about 4000 per week, which she uses for her household expenses and invests some in her home and her bank account.

She has taken out a previous loan with Novo Banco and decided not to continue. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who work with her and who are already clients of the institution. This is her first loan for 20,000mt, with which she will purchase more chicks, feed, and vitamins to increase her stock.

She is confidant that she can repay the loan on time and hopes to seek an additional loan. In the future, she wants to build a better aviary.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Luz es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Luz tiene un puesto en el mercado central en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. Además Luz por las tardes vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Luz son tener un restaurante y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank.  She lives with her husband and two children and has a stall in the central marketplace, where she and her mother sell food.  In the evenings she also sells "salchipapas" (sausage and fried potatoes) from the front of her home.

Luz needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy rice and sugar.  She hopes to one day have her own restaurant and buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Kaberia

texts.en: Kaberia is 27 years old and single. For the past two years, he has worked in the printing business. He joined Faulu Kenya under the Visioners Group which allows him to mingle with businesspeople and gain business skills. Kaberia is employed and hopes that one day he will be able to leave his employment and open a business. In the future, he would like to open more printing outlets and employ people. He has requested 30,000 KES to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Yumema

texts.en: Yumema C.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Yumema is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up charcoal store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ablavi Kafui

texts.fr: Ablavi est mariée à un comptable et mère d’un enfant. Pour participer au menage , elle exerce le commerce de pagnes et chaussures et compte dans cette activité 4 ans d’expérience.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite nyekonakpoè.Elle achète généralement au grand marché de Lomé et revend à nyekonakpoè.  Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Ablavi has one child and is married to an accountant. Born in Lomé, she now lives in Nyekonakpoè. 

To help with the household expenses, she sells pagnes (colorful print cloth) and shoes. She has four years of experience in this activity. She usually gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé for resale in Nyekonakpoè. 

She is seeking a new loan to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy pagnes and shoes

loans.name: Gerardo Geronimo

texts.es:
Gerardo Geronimo Y. Z. tiene 42 años. Vive en Unión Libre con la compañera, vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajan para la familia y tener un hijo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gerardo Gerónimo Y. Z., 42, lives in a common law marriage with his spouse in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  He has no children.

The members of La Union communal bank, located in Aguas Frías, Ventanas canton, are farmers, especially of corn, rice and broad bean.  They have been in this occupation for a long time.

Gerardo has a farmer especially of corn, rice and broad bean for three years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to continue working for the family.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Bautista S. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en la colonia Henry Merriam de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Juan se dedica al servicio de taxi, su punto de trabajo es en el centro comercial Plaza Miraflores, Juan es propietario del vehículo y del numero, también es el Presidente de la Junta Directiva de dicho punto de taxis.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos del motor y para repuestos del sistema de frenos.
necesita reparar su automovil lo mas pronto posible para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y para tener buenas ganancias ya que en esta epoca muchas personas vienen a comprar a este centro comercial y necesitan de los servicios de taxis para regresar a sus casas despues de las compras.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista S. is 51 years old.  He lives in Henry Merriam neighborhood, in the city of Tegucigalpa.  Juan provides a taxi service.  He works at the Plaza Miraflores Shopping Mall.  Juan owns his own vehicle and number.  He is also the president of the board of directors of this taxi stand.

Juan will use his loan to buy spare parts for his engine and also for his brake system.  He needs to fix his car as soon as possible so that he can continue to provide a good service to his customers and so that he can make good profits since a lot of people come to shop at this mall at this time of year and they need a taxi service to take them back home after they've done their shopping.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his engine and brake system

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Fany; ella tiene 43 años de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de promotora de espectáculos, la socia suele traer algunos grupos musicales para algunos eventos que se realizan en el distrito de Urcos,la socia es una persona muy alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y para comprar algunos productos de primera necesidad que necesita para su hogar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Fany belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco."  This bank is located in the Urcos district, which is part of Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

Fany is 43 years old, single, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business promoting shows.  She often brings musical groups for some events that occur in the Urcos district.  She is a very cheerful person who has a strong desire to get ahead.

She requests a loan for her business, and also to buy some basic consumer products that she needs for her household.

She is happy to have the opportunity to take this loan, and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: she requests a loan for her business, and also to buy some basic necessities for her household

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su madre y un hermano, él es soltero, se dedica a destazar res y al mismo tiempo es empleado, su negocio es destazar el ganado y vender la carne en su casa, este oficio lo aprendió de su abuela, y lo está haciendo desde hace tres años, por el momento su inconveniente es comprar ganado para seguir en el negocio, ya que no cuenta con los fondos para comprar y comercializar la carne, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión en reces, con esta ayuda estará aumentando su potencial como destazador y seguirá produciendo para su familia ingresos que cubran aquellas necesidades que a diario se presentan en el hogar.
Su objetivo en mantener el negocio y hacerlo crecer para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in El Transito, San Miguel department with his mother and a brother.  He’s single and butchers beef; he is also employed.  

His business is butchering cattle to sell the meat from home.  He learned this occupation from his grandmother and he’s been doing it for the last three years.  Currently he faces the inconvenience of not having funds to buy cattle to stay in business selling beef.  This is why he’s asking for a loan to invest in steers.  The help will make it possible for him to increase his potential as a butcher and he will continue to produce income for his family to cover daily household needs.

His goal is to keep the business and make it grow in order to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: To buy cattle to butcher.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca C. G. es una mujer muy emprendedora, desde hace 10 años hace se dedica a la costura en el cual ya tiene mucha experiencia. Los trabajos que realiza los hace sobre pedido y talla; como los son vestidos, disfraces, pantalones, vastillas y mas. La señora en este momento requiere un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y agujas para ofrecer a sus clientes diversidad de colores.
texts.en:
Francisca C. G. is a very hard-working woman.  She has been a seamstress for 10 years and has gained much expertise.  She takes orders for dresses, costumes, pants and alterations.

Francisca plans to use the loan to buy fabric, thread and needles so she can offer her customers a wide range of colors.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Efua Nomaba Doma

texts.en:
Efua Nomaba Doma M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past eight years, Efua has been selling banku (a staple made from fermented cassava and maize dough) and waakye (a traditional rice dish cooked with beans, usually accompanied by pepper or tomato-based sauce and fish) at Dompoase near Elmina. She uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills.

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase more maize, rice and beans to cook and sell. She plans to reinvest her profits into her business so that it can expand.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice and beans

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru: Одинаева Курбонгул жительница Яванского района. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже год. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kurbongul O. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 39 years old, married and has 5 children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  Kurbongul is involved in agriculture.  She has a land plot by her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She has been involved in this business for one year.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca Orvelina

texts.es: Francisca Orvelina tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de molino. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad por esfuerzos propios, fue así logro conseguir con mucho esfuerzo una cierta cantidad de dinero para la compra poco a poco la maquinaria. Posteriormente compra el molino y obtuvo algo de ganancias, por lo que le gusto mucho trabajar en este tipo de negocio ya que por medio de esto logro proporcionarle la manutención necesaria a ella y sus hijos. Ahora está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar repuestos y proporcionarle mantenimiento al molino.
texts.en:
Francisca Orvelina is 46 years old.  Her business is providing milling services.  She has been in this line of work for more than 14 years and started the business through her own effort.

With a lot of hard work, Francisca managed to put together a certain quantity of money that she used to gradually buy machinery.  She bought her mill and made some profits.  She really enjoys working in this type of business as it allows her to support herself and her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and to have maintenance work done on her mill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with one child who attends school. His wife is a primary school teacher and she contributes to the family's basic needs. For the past two years, Suleiman has operated a garage business.  He operates from his shop, whereby his potential customers are motor vehicle operators. 

Suleiman not only depends on his garage business but he also operates a car wash business which contributes to his other source of livelihood and he is able to meet his family needs. He dreams of expanding the vehicle repair business and start a distributing company in the future.

With the Kshs 70,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase vehicles spare parts and lubricants. He decided to work with Yehu because of availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase vehicles spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su hija de tres años en el sector Corazón de Jesús del distrito de Chiclayo, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a unos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de comida al paso. Ella tiene su negocio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, vende huevos sancochados y los ofrece a  las personas que trabajan en el mercado y a los clientes que apetecen su producto, esta actividad la realiza hace dos años. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra productos en cantidad para minimizar sus costos, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en su casa. Por su negocio ha aumentado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 3-year-old daughter in the Corazón de Jesús sector in the district of Chiclayo, a region of humble settlers who work principally in agriculture. It is situated a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria's work is selling fast food. Her business is in the Mercado Modelo (model market) in the City of Chiclayo. She sells boiled eggs and offers them to people who work in the market and to customers who have a craving for her product. She has had this business for two years. The business is a great help to her family, since through it she takes charge of helping to sustain their daily economic needs.

Maria wants to expand her business by buying products in quantity to minimize her costs. At the same time, she wants to complete some improvements in her house. Because her business has grown, she believed it would be a good idea to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 500 PEN, which she can use to think about achieving her objective.

loans.use: Buy products for her business.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly S. is from the village of Tagodalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Kimberly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as milk, sugar, behon (rice sticks), noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Kimberly is just starting this business.

In 2011, Kimberly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods and soft drinks to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Ann

texts.en:
Marjorie Ann is 38 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marjorie Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marjorie Ann has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling other livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 32-year-old widow with 2 children.  With her 2 children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.   She runs a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, softdrinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.   She has been in this business for 7 years.  

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. Alexander has a shop that sells gasoline per liter. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional gallons of gasoline. Alexander has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alexander hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 3º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2010.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ana María, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella por las mañanas trabaja de empleada doméstica y por las tardes y los fines de semana se dedica a la fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza.
La Sra. Ana dice que con el credito  que recibira lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de los elementos de limpieza, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, almacén , venta de tortas y panificados , venta de comestibles como empanadas, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed as a result of promotional activities carried out in their area.  The group is currently in its third loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2010.

One of the members of this group is Ana María who has two young children.  In the mornings, she works as a cleaner and, in the afternoons and on the weekends, she makes and sells cleaning products.

Ana tells us that she will use her loan to buy supplies for making cleaning products.  She is very grateful since, thanks to the loan that she is receiving, she is able to improve her income.

All the ladies in this group carry out business activities such as: selling clothes, running a store, selling cakes and baked products, and selling food such as empanadas, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cleaning products

loans.name: Marivick

texts.en:
Marivick is now 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells dry goods such as different kinds of clothing. Marivick has been in this business for almost 13 years. 

Marivick is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional clothes to sell. Each month, Marivick earns about PHP 8,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Marivick hopes to improve this business in order to help her husband in gaining income to support their family needs, especially for the education of their children. She believes that she can be able to improve her business through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 70 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia es docente de profesión,  la socia  trabaja como profesora de secundaria en el colegio de varones ciencias, la socia requiere solo este año para completar su tiempo de servicio, para pasar a jubilarse, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda y mejorar su casita, la socia repintara sus paredes para ello requiere comprar pinturas, brochas y contratar a dos pintores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 70 years old, single and has two children.  She is a Teacher.  She teaches Science at a boy’s secondary school.  She only has this year left to complete her term of service and retire.  She needs the loan to invest in home improvements; she will repaint the walls and needs to buy paint, brushes and hire two painters.  She is asking for the loan to invest in her house.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Alexina

texts.en:
Alexina, aged 49, is married to Robert and they are blessed with three children aged 28, 26 and 24. She runs a restaurant that has been in operation for ten years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.110,000.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

Alexina hopes to run a modern hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and married with 1 child.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Variety Store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Milagros aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her child to college and buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more variety store items to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Yucay, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Carmen; tiene 56 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 6 hijos D. 21, 20, 23, 14 años D. edad; y otros dos hijos D. la socia que son independientes; la socia trabaja como comerciante minorista, en las épocas D. febrero, marzo, abril la socia se dedica  a la venta D. choclo, también lleva a Arequipa, Juliaca, la socia en esta época se dedica  al compra y venta D. verduras, ella venD. zapallo, cebollas, tomate y otros; La socia también tiene su terreno y ahora ella desea invertir en la compra D. semillas para sembrar maíz blanco para cosechar choclos, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. semillas D. maíz para la nueva época D. siembra.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "Virgen Natividad".  The banks is located in the district of Yucay, in the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Carmen, she is 56 years old.  The member is married, and has six children, four of whom are aged 21, 20, 23, and 14 years old.  The member's other two children are financially independent.  

The member works in sales.  During February, March and April, the member sells corn, which she also takes to Arequipa and Juliaca.  In this current time of year, the member buys and sells vegetables.  She sells pumpkins, onions, tomatoes and other things.  

The member also has a field, and now she wants to invest in purchasing seeds to plant white corn plants so as to harvest corn.  The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds for the new planting season.

loans.use: to invest in buying corn seed for the new planting season.

loans.name: Decsi Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Decsi, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tiene 6 hijos, dos mayores de edad y los cuatro menores que  estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres junto con su esposo, él vende puerta a puerta pues recorre en un triciclo por toda la ciudad, mientras ella vende las legumbres en un local que tiene en su casa. Es un negocio pequeño pero esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Ella trabaja todos los días desde las 4h00 horas hasta las 18h00  y su esposo hace sus recorridos hasta el medio día y luego llega a casa y le ayuda en su local. Llevan más de 15 años con su negocio el mismo que es sacrificado pero les ha dado para vivir honestamente.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras para vender tanto ella como su esposo. Está en el banco hace 12 ciclos y le gusta porque la ayuda que le da el banco es muy importante para su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
The “3 de Mayo” (May 3rd) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  The place is known for being a commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional celebrations, and for the happiness of its people.

This is where we meet Decsi, age 44.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has six children.  Two of them are adults, and the four younger children go to school.  All of her children still live at home.  Her husband devotes himself to commerce.

Our friend and her husband sell fruits and vegetables.  He sells door to door.  He travels all over the city with his tricycle.
