Meanwhile, she sells vegetables from a place that she has in her house.  Her business is small, but it allows her to help her husband with the family expenses.  She works every day from 4:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had her business for over 15 years.  It is very hard work, but it has given them the means to live honestly.

She will use this new loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her to sell as well as for her husband to sell.  She has been in the bank for 12 cycles.  She likes it for the help the bank gives her.  It is very important for her business.

Her dreams are for her children to become professionals and for them to be good people.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Salomon De Jesus

texts.es:
Salomón, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 6, 7 y 9 años se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz, frijoles, este trabajo lo heredo de su padre y trabaja todo los días de 6 am a 3 pm de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono y fertilizantes para que sean mejores cosechas para venderla y dejar una parte  para su familia.
El sueño de salomón es que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir, y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de éxito.
texts.en:
Salomón lives with his wife and three children aged 6, 7, and 9.  They work growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  He took over this work from his father, and works every day, Monday through Sunday, from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.

This loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizers so that his harvests will be better and he can sell them and still leave a part for his family.

Salomón's dream is for his family to have life's necessities, and that his children attend school so they can become successful people.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kweselala A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khweselala Group in Western Kenya!  Bilia is the facilitator of the Khweselala A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bilia takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Bilia had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bilia was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bilia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Bilia will feed her family throughout the year, and invest in other assets such as cows and goats.

In 2012, the members of Khwesalala A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Nare

texts.en:
Nare is now a widow because her husband just passed away due to a traffic accident. She has five sons: three attend school, one is a garment factory worker and one is still young. The family lives about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Nare is a garment worker. She is applying for another loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. She will also use a part of the loan to put an additional on her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Catalina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can rent a space in the public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 24 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a business selling various goods such as: soap, fruits, lotions, etc. She has had this business for two years and works from 7:30 a.m. until 8:30 p.m. every day. She currently employs two people to help her. 

Patricie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, fruits, lotions, etc. to sell. With any profits she makes, she will save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: soap, fruits, lotions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 25 year old woman married with 2 children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. Her major goal is to provide better education to her children and to construct a permanent house for her family. She has been operating a retail shop for two years. She has problems such as limited capital, high transport costs due to persistent inflation in the country. Mary needs money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Inés; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y el negocio de verduras lo realiza llevando a lugares como Machupicchu por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos, lechugas y tomates.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

This is Mrs. Inés. She is 52, widowed, and has three children. She divides her time between her housework and her vegetable business. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens. To sell vegetables, she travels to places such as Machu Picchu. This is how she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve both of her businesses. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and also for buying vegetables such as onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce, and tomatoes.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay the quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and chickens, as well as vegetables such as onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and tomatoes.

loans.name: Nosaibah

texts.en:
Nosaibah is a 32-year-old married woman from Madaba, Amman in Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Nosaibah is trading in clothes. She is requesting a loan of 1,300 JOD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Nosaibah is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 45-year-old married woman with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been farming for commercial purposes. She faces the challenges of seasonal changes, price fluctuations and inadequate capital. Her personal goals are educating her children and self-education. Her business goal is to hire more employees to help expand her business and produce better products. Christine needs the loan to buy agro-inputs and fertilizers for her gardens.

loans.use: to buy agro- inputs and fertilizers for her gardens

loans.name: Ahomadou

texts.fr:
Ahomadou est un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.
Ahomadou travaille comme dactylographe et informaticien depuis 2001. Il produit des documents scolaires pour le corps enseignant et les étudiants dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque de fourniture.
Ahomadou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du papier et du stencil. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ahomadou voudrait agrandir l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ahomadou is a  47-year old man, who is married to a retailer. He has four children who all attend school. The eldest is 20 year old while the youngest is 13. Ahomadou works as a typist and a computer specialist. He produces educational documents for teachers and students in his shop. He buys his products in Lomé and he works alone.

Ahomadou's main problem at the moment is his lack of materials, and he has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy paper and stencils. He would like to reinvest in his business and in the coming years he would like to expand it. He says that he plans to provide for his family's basic needs with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and educational documents

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María Norma tiene 33 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo   y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar una desgranadora.

Le gusta lavar la ropa de su esposo y de los hijos.
texts.en:
María Norma is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in the los Ríos province.

The Vencedores Unidos communal bank is located Anchoveta, on the road to the community of La Templanza in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. María Norma is a farmer who has grown corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market here and also in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. 

The requested loan is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer for sewing the corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to be able to invest. Her dream is to have enough money to buy a husking machine.  

She enjoys washing her husband's and children’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate wants to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Aklakou where she still lives, Pélagie G. is a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband, a mason, does not have enough income to meet the household expenses. Pélagie quickly understood this and thus threw herself into the sale of staple goods such as sugar, milk, generic medications etc. She now has 15 years of experience in this business and has never gone bankrupt.

Her goal now is to expand her display in order to meet demand. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $950 to place a large order. The realization of this project will help Pélagie G. improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Aklakou où elle vit jusqu’alors, Madame Pélagie G. est une femme mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari, maçon de profession ne dispose pas beaucoup de revenus pour supporter les charges du ménage. Madame Pélagie l’a vite compris s’est alors lancée dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité tels que le sucre, le lait, les médicaments générique etc. Elle est dotée aujourd’hui d’une expérience de 15 ans dans cette activité. et n’a jamais fait faillite.

Son ambition est d’agrandir son étalage aujourd’hui pour être à la hauteur de la demande. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite ce crédit de $950 pour passer une grande commande. La réalisation de ce projet permettra à Madame G. Pélagie d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Trois Cocotiers association, led by Fatou S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The group Trois Cocotiers of Ndiaye Ndiaye is a group of women who are motivated by the same will and who work to advance the power of women to make their own decisions, in their natural environment. Our objectives are to provide a source of independence for women, to combat the migration of women from rural villages, and to improve the living conditions of our members.

Business activities: The group plans one principal business activity which will consist of purchasing and reselling seafood products. We will purchase the seafood products that are in high demand in our local market, and resell them for a fair price to the surrounding populations.”

Original French business description:

«Le GIE Trois cocotiers de Ndiaye Ndiaye est un groupement e femmes animer d’une même volonté et qui oeuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leurs milieu naturel.

Objectif :

Donner une autonomie aux femmes

Lutter contre l’exode des femmes

Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres

Activités :

Le groupement se propose une activité principale qui consiste à l’achat et vente de produits halieutique. Il s’agit d’acheter les produits halieutiques très sollicités dans le marché local et les revendre à bon prix aux populations locales.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood products (oysters, dried fish, shellfish, etc.) from local fishermen; storage and transport to market for retail sale

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Señora Mariette dedicates her self to selling food at night. She has an employee who works for her during the day. Her work site and her home are next to each other in the town of San Antonio within the city of La Paz. Mariette has three children. Two of them are in school, and the other child is just three years old. This is the fourth time that Mariette has requested a loan with IMPRO. Her history with our organization qualifies her as a top client. The amount requested will be used to purchase rice, vermicelli, vegetables, and furniture so that she can make her business more stable and open up a pension (a pension is the name of an agreement where the client pays monthly for their daily lunches). Her prior credit and work should allow her to attain this loan, because she has experience in her business, which will now be managed even more securely, and the increased income will allow her to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mariette se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches; tiene una empleada a quien le cancela por día trabajado. Su puesto y domicilio se encuentran ubicados en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. Martiette tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y uno es de tres años. Es la Cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de arroz, fideo, verduras, y muebles para poder continuar con su negocio en forma mas estable y abrir una pensión (pensión es el nombre que se da a lugares de comida donde la gente – los clientes – tienen un almuerzo diario seguro por un monto pagado mensualmente). Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual será manejado más establemente y le dará más ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy rice, pasta, vegetables, and furniture for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of clothing for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth A. buys snails, fruits and foodstuff and sells it to people in the City. She started this business in 2001. This was a business she learned from her mother. She is 30 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. According to her if the loan of $425 is given to her, it will enable her to buy snails, fruit and foodstuff to sell.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy more snails, fruits & foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns a small stall by the ocean. She carries mostly foods used for typical Ghanaian dishes such as tomato paste, oil, and fermented corn doe (used to make a kenke). She also sells basic home necessities such as mosquito coils (malaria is the number one cause for hospitalization in Ghana), soap, and candles (the power crises causes frequent brown-outs in the country and many are not connected to electricity in the first place).

With the loan, Mary will expand her store by purchasing more stock. The profits that she makes will partially go to her youngest child’s education fees. She has six children, ages 19 to 34. The 19-year-old is currently in junior high. None of her other children completed junior high school due to financial shortages.

Mary is a member of the lending group, Kamfo Ewurade group. This group of twenty-three guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase corn doe, soda, tomato cans, oil, and other products for her stand.

loans.name: María Antonieta De L

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta is mother of 3 little ones; an 8-year-old, a 4-year-old, and a 3-year-old. Her husband works as welder's aide, and the money he makes is enough to cover the expenses of their three children. In December of 2006, Maria Antonieta started selling natural products, because one of her sisters recommended the products because she had tried them herself and lost a lot of weight, and from that, she became a distributor and later convinced Maria so she would also sell the products. Maria started making a demonstration in her home and little by little acquired more customers. Nowadays she is recognized because of the products she sells.

However, currently, her existing customers have increased their orders, and because of this Maria Antonieta is requesting a loan for US$375, which she will pay in 4 months. With this money Maria Antonieta will be able to buy more products to offer to her customers. With your help, Maria Antonieta will be able to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonieta es madre de 3 pequeños, uno de 8 otro de 4 y de 3 años, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de soldador y con el dinero que gana el no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos. María Antonieta En Diciembre del 2006, comenzó a vender productos Naturistas puesto que una hermana le recomendó los productos ya que ella los había tomado y bajó bastante de peso y a raíz de eso se convirtió en distribuidora de dichos productos, y fue ella la que convenció a María para que ella también se dedicara a venderlos y fue así como empezó, haciendo una demostración en su casa y así adquirió clientes poco a poco. Actualmente ya es reconocida por los productos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente los clientes que tiene le van pidiendo más y más productos es por eso que María Antonieta, está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María Antonieta podrá comprar más productos para poder tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María Antonieta podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying products (Comprar productos)

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana realized a long time ago that the money her husband made was not enough to sustain their three children (8 years old, 2 years and a 9 month baby). Her friend turned her onto selling cosmetics. Mariana currently has her own client base.

She has various orders from her clients but she can´t purchase the goods. Mariana is requesting a US $925 microloan which she intends to return in six months. The money will be used to purchase merchandise for her clients. With your help Mariana will be able to raise her children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Rodriguez has worked selling flowers in order to maintain her home and support herself for 6 years. She doesn't have a husband and her son is grown now and supports himself. Since she was offered the opportunity to sell flowers wholesale Sara has continued to worked in that business. Little by little she has grown her business and she currently has a number of clients who look specifically for her when buying flowers.

After the Valentine's Day season, Sara would like to restock her inventory in order to offer a wider variety of products. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $475 which she commits to repaying in 6 months. With this capital Sara will be able to buy merchandise with which to restock her business. With your help Sara will be able to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Sara R., tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de flores para poder mantener su casa y los gastos de ella, puesto que no tiene esposo y su hijo ya es mayor y se mantiene solo. Desde que le ofrecieron la venta de flores al mayoreo es que Sara se dedica a esto y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que siempre la buscan.

Sin embargo después de la temporada del san Valentín, Sara desea resurtir su mercancía para así tener mayor repertorio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Sara podrá comprar mercancía para resurtir su negocio. Con tu ayuda Sara podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Afusatu

texts.en: Afusatu R. hails from  Lagos State Nigeria, She is a goldsmith, hence (i.e she repairs and sells articles made of gold) e.g necklace, engagement and marriage rings and bangles. Se also sells sachet water. At 41 years old, with 4 children Afusatu still has the mind to improve her business. She trained in her skill for 5 years and has been in business since 2005. Afusatu is requesting a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more articles made of gold and sachet water. This she said will help her serve her customer better.

loans.use: To buy materials for Gold production (Jewelry).

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: I have lived all my life in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six: one girl and five boys. Three of my children attend school and two work with their father. My husband is a butcher and operates a meat shop. We need to buy a few more animals for which we require a loan of $475. Our business generates decent profits and by expanding our business further we will be able to improve our profits.

loans.use: Expand a butcher shop

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. sells plastic bowls, chairs, pans, and much more. She is married and has four children.

Ama is working very hard to help pay for the family's expenses and would like a loan to increase her inventory, thus increasing sales.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of plastic housewares for resale

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn O., 26, works with her husband, Chhorn Sarat, in the Prey Veng province where they live with their two young children. She and her husband purchase stone from workers on the mountain and resell the stone in the local market.

Together, they typically make $5 (US dollars) per day. The people who purchase the stone turn it into a grinding mill.

They believe that their business can be expanded to reach more customers, but they lack the necessary capital to purchase additional stone for this expansion. Porn O. is asking for a loan of $600 (US dollars) to purchase more stone to sell in the market. She believes this investment will be a great opportunity for the family to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase stone for resale

loans.name: Thi Xuyen's Group

texts.vi:
Bùi Thị Xuyên, born on 10/07/1956 (Ms 23070030 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into chicken breeding. All her children are grown up and have founded their own family. Her husband stays at home breeding, whiL. she works regularly as a mat maker. The average income of the coupL. is about 2.000.000 vnđ / month. Although she goes to work every day, she still breeds with her husband and is a trustworthy group leader. The other members of the borrowing group are: Nguyễn Thị Đông, born in 1975 (Ms 23070025 ), would like to borrow 4.028.000 vnđ to invest into retailing. Nguyễn Thị Mừng, born in 1956 (Ms 23070029 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into breeding. Lê Thị Tuyên, born in 1960 (Ms 23070027), would like to borrow 4.028.000 vnđ to invest into breeding. Ngô Thị Thanh Hường, born in 1950 ( Ms 23070024 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into breeding.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Bùi Thị Xuyên, sinh ngày 10/07/1956 (Ms 23070030 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Các con cô đã lớn và lập gia đình, chồng cô ở nhà chăn nuôi, bản thân cô đi làm thuê có thu nhậ ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của hai vợ chồng cô khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Mặc dù đi làm nhưng hàng ngày cô vẫn cùng chồng chăn nuôi và là một nhóm trưởng đáng tin cậy. Nhóm vay vốn của cô còn có: Nguyễn Thị Đông, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 23070025 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Nguyễn Thị Mừng, sinh năm 1956 (Ms 23070029 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Lê Thị Tuyên, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 23070027), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi. Ngô Thị Thanh Hường, sinh năm 1950 ( Ms 23070024 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, es una señora casada y madre de tres hijos. Ella se dedica exclusivamente a su despensa donde vende fideo, azúcar, arroz, yerba, bebidas entre otras cosas.

María, empieza a dedicarse a este rubro desde el año pasado con la ayuda de su esposo y con algunos ahorros con que contaba la misma, su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa.

María, con sus ganancias aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su esposo que trabaja en el aeropuerto de la ciudad de minga guazú, hacen frente a los gastos de su familia.

María, comenta que desde la apertura de su negocio a registrado nivel de ventas interesante. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a married woman and is the mother of three children. She owns a store, where she sells noodles, sugar, rice, herbs, and drinks, among other things. With the help of her husband and with some savings that were available to her, María has been working in this line of business since last year. Her business is located in her home. With her earnings, María contributes to the household income, and she and her husband, who works in the Minga Guazú airport, manage the family’s expenses. María says that since the opening of her business, she has achieved an interesting level of sales. Because of this, she wants to acquire more merchandise. In this way, she will be able to supply her clients’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like noodles, sugar, oil, herbs, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 47 años, está casado con Rita hace 21 años y juntos han criado a 2 hijos que hoy día tienen 8 y 10 años respectivamente. Ambos niños aún van a la escuela.

Vivió 12 años en la Argentina en donde trabajó como constructor, ahorrando de esa manera el dinero suficiente para volver a su querido Paraguay a fin de montar su propio negocio.

Fue así que volvió a su país e instaló una pequeña despensa en su hogar y más tarde habilitó su carnicería.

Faena un promedio de 3 animales por semana, ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada que le compra la carne todos los días.

También cuenta con vacas lecheras que ordeña para luego vender la leche.

En esta oportunidad necesita del préstamo para la compra de animales para engorde con el fin de faenarlos más adelante.
texts.en:
Enrique is 47 years old, married for 21 years to Rita and together they have raised 2 children who are today ages 8 and 10. Both children go to school. He lived 12 years in Argentina where he worked in construction, saving enough money to return to his beloved Paraguay to finally open his own business. When he returned to his country, he opened a small store in his home and later a butcher shop. He butchers on average 3 animals per week, and he has a good customer base who buy meat from him every day. He also has milking cows and he sells milk. He needs the loan in order to buy animals to raise and fatten with the goal of butchering them in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to butcher for butcher shop

loans.name: Tuot

texts.en: Mrs. Tuot S. is a 32-year-old widow with a 4-year-old child. She is a villager in Chineang  Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a famer and she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to cultivate her crops. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds to plant.

loans.name: Graciela Fortunata

texts.en: Graciela is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Graciela is 52 years old and married with four children. She travels to regional fairs three times per week to sell dry goods and clothing. At the fairs, she buys grains, animals, cheese and eggs to resell in the Nery Garcia Market.  Graciela needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy skirts, sweaters and blouses.  Graciela’s dreams are to buy a stand in one of Ayacucho’s markets and for her children to finish school.

loans.use: Buy skirts, sweaters and blouses

loans.name: Koumandji Kanley

texts.fr:
Cette dame de 31 ans d’âge a pour activité la vente de céréales qu’elle fait depuis 2004 au marché d’Agoè Anomé, elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’Anié, Notsè et Bassar. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au près de WAGES. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock avec 06 sacs de maïs, 01 sacs de soja, et 02 sacs d’haricots.
Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè Anomé avec ses trois enfants. Elle est mariée avec son mari NEKERE Aminou. Elle compte avec ce crédit agrandir son commerce et soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
This 31 year old lady's activity is the sale of cereals, she has been doing this since 2004 at the Agoè Anomé market. She stocks up at the local market of Anié, Notsé and Bassar. She has never received a loan from WAGES. She is requesting this first loan to increase her stock with 6 bags of corn, 1 bag of soy bean, and 2 bags of beans. She lives with her three children in the neighborhood of Agoè Anomé. She is married to Aminou NEKERE. With this loan she hopes to expand her business and provide for her family.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: 12- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 12 consists of 6 poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward of Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Lan is the lead borrower of the group. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children: a 25 year old son who drives vehicles for a private company, a daughter who is studying foreign languages at Hanoi University and a 17 year old daughter at high school.

This is Mrs. Lan's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she will use it to buy supplies for her restaurant business.  The restaurant previously only catered to the breakfast crowd and she will use the funds to expand her lunch and dinner business.  She currently serves about 100 breakfasts, 40 lunches and 10 dinners.  With the profits from her loan, Mrs. Lan will pay for her children's education.  Her goal is to see her children in stable employment.

The loan will be split equally between all 6 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:
* Mrs. Sau is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong to buy  material that she will use to make and sell women's clothes.
* Chau will use her loan to buy pork and rice to make Bún Chả (a popular dish made of bacon and rice) for resale.
* Mrs. Ha will use her loan to buy pork, shrimp, chicken and rice to cook lunch and dinner and resell from her house.
* Phuong and Mrs. Dung are borrowing money to buy screws, aluminium pots, etc. to resell in Dong Thanh market.

loans.use: To buy pork, shrimp, rice, etc and assorted hardware articles

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Jiguitougou est composé de quatre femmes mariées et deux célibataires. Les membres ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage. Elles exercent  presque la même activité de vente de bois de chauffe et  la fabrication artisanale de savons qu’elles ont appris à bas âge auprès de leur maman qui pratiquait  ce métier. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Danaya a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des chargements de camions en bois de chauffe, des barriques de déchets d’huile de coton et une grande quantité de soude caustique (pour la fabrication du savon). Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe dans les villages de  Welinguena et Belesso. Quant aux ingrédients du savon, ils sont achetés au marché de koutiala. Le bois de chauffe est vendu à la maison, le savon  est vendu en détail au marché  de Koutiala et à la  maison. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen 70 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 NB : Fatou Fané est absente de la photo, elle vient d’accoucher.
texts.en:
This Danaya group belonging to the Jiguitougou association is composed of four married women and two who are still single. The members have an average age of 27 and on average, 3 children and they live in big traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other because of living in the same area. They mostly have the same business: selling firewood and making homemade soap whose fabrication they learned when they were quite young from their mothers who had mastered this trade.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Danaya group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy some truckloads of firewood, some barrels of cotton oil waste, and a big quantity of caustic soda (used in soap-making). They buy their firewood in the villages of Welinguena et Belesso. As for the ingredients for soap-making, they buy those at the Koutiala market. The firewood is sold out of their homes; the soap is sold retail in the market of Koutiala and from their homes.

They each hope to make an average profit of 70,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle; this money will be used to make repayments on the loan and support their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Note: Fatou Fané is absent from the photo because she had just given birth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and fabrication of soap for re-sale

loans.name: Fisoye

texts.en: Fisoye O. is 28 years old and he is single. He sells fish. He is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more fish to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old married man and lives in A. Ouzai in the Beirut suburbs. He is a car mechanic, and he opened his shop in 1991. To further improve his services, Hussein is asking for $1,000 to buy new tools and machinery.

loans.use: Buy new tools and machinery

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia M. is a 66-year-old member of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) in the northern part of the province, Culasi, Antique where the highest peak of Panay Island is located. Prudencia is raising pigs to support the needs of her two children. She is a widow and the sole provider.

She applied for this loan to use as a down payment on a motorcycle she wants to buy from a motorcycle shop. She wants to build a tricycle for hire (tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar). She will try her best to manage this business to assist in her children's education. She is grateful for the trust of the lenders, who are making this loan possible. She hopes that her membership in ASHI will help her achieve her greatest dreams in life.

loans.use: Finance the down payment of a motorcycle

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es:
Su actividad D. la Sra. Elena es la venta D. desayunos, almuerzos  D. lunes a sábado su actividad diaria empieza a las 6:00 D. la mañana que va hacer compras del mercado espacialmente la carne que tiene que ser fresca así como la verdura, para tener satisfechos a sus clientes; atienD. a empresas que se encuentran ubicados en la zona ya que es céntrica y donD. hay varias empresas. El esposo tiene un ingreso fijo mensual el cual le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ya que cuentan con 5 hijos tres D. los cuales ya se encuentran en la universidad pero al mismo tiempo le ayudan a la mama en el snack atendiendo a sus clientes, uno esta en edad escolar y el último tiene 1 año.
Es una familia muy unida todos trabajan aportando en la familia.
texts.en:
Elena sells breakfasts and lunches Monday-Saturday. Her day starts at 6 a.m. when she goes to the market to make her purchases, particularly the meat that needs to be as fresh as the vegetables to satisfy her customers. She serves to businesses located in her area, which is central and populated with various companies. Her husband earns a fixed monthly income to help her with family expenses. They have five children, three of whom are attending the local university but also help her mother with her stand, tending to customers. Another child is in school, and the youngest is 1 year old. This is a very tightly knit family where everyone supports everyone else.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken fryer and a hot food stand

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Since 2007, Francisca D. has worked as a trader selling goods such as flour, rice, sugar, margarine and oil at Yamoransa. She is single with no children and has received no formal education. She is responsible for supporting herself financially, paying for such things as food and clothing. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food supplies for resale and she hopes to use her newly gained profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food supplies for resale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Aurelia M., 69 years old, is married and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has one child who is married already. She spend her life with her husband. She is a member of PAGLAUM since last February 2006 and now she is applying for a loan of 5,000.00 pesos to buy additional stock, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items for her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Mrs. M. is able to manage this business successfully; in fact, it covers her daily consumption needs and she is able to save money for the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D.  Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 3 hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa y vive en el Barrio San Martín.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 años, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio y así poder comprar frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, mandarina, manzanas y otras.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas que se dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda belongs to the Semillas del Futuro ["Seeds of the Future"] community bank in the Peruvian "departmento" of Puno. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished elementary school and lives in the San Martin neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years, starting with a S/.300 [300 new soles] loan for her business buying and selling fruit. She is now applying for a S/.500 loan to invest in the same business so that she can buy fruits such as platanos, oranges, tangerines, apples, etc. Hilda's greatest hopes are to go on working and to give her children good educations. She likes the community bank meetings and discussing bank matters with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.en: Ogechi O. is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells clothes. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to  sell.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. is married and has one child. Her husband is a fisherman. Dzifa has received primary-level schooling and, since 2003, has been making a living selling processed fish at Denu. She uses her income to pay bills. 
At present, Dzifa needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for resale. She plans to use the additional profits to re-invest in her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene un pequeño taller de servicio de frenos y cambio de balatas de movilidades y por las noches trabaja como transportista, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de tres hijos y esposa; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Ventilla de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de maquinaria (calibradores de frenos) y repuestos para el taller y de esa forma podrá facilitar su trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Herminio has a small shop that services brakes and changes brake linings. In the evenings he works as a driver. It is the main source of income to support his three children and his wife. He has his own house, which is located in the Ventilla zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy machinery (brake calibrators) and replacement parts for his shop. This will facilitate his work, and he will give his customers better service. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brake calibrators and replacement parts for his brake and brake lining repair shop

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
La Sra. Rossana Báez  de  32 años de edad, esta casada con el sr  Cristhian Palacios hace  4 años tienen un hijo de 1 año y 4 meses.
Cuenta  que antes de tener su negocio, ella trabajaba  con su padre quien tenia una escuela de conducción, se desempeñaba allí como secretaria e instructora de la escuela, Más adelante recibió una propuesta de trabajo al exterior y decidió viajar con su esposo en busca de mejoras económicas. 
Mas adelante  decidieron volver a nuestro país y en vista de tener un hijo chico optaron por abrir  una Despensa con venta de comestibles, al cual le anexaron una cancha de fútbol 5 (soccer 5), y también juegos electrónicos, que es atendido por su esposo. 
Piensa que con la ayuda del crédito seguirá creciendo, porque le permitirá acceder a mejores precios en la compra de sus mercaderías que le ayudará a tener mejores precios también.
texts.en:
Sra. Rossana Báez is 32 years old and has been married to Sr. Cristhian Palacios for 4 years. They have a young son who is 16 months old.

Prior to having her own business, Sra. Rossana worked for her father who operated a driving school. There she worked as a secretary and also as a driving instructor. Later she was given the chance to work abroad and decided to travel with her husband in search of better financial opportunites.

When they returned to their own country, and in light of having a baby boy, Sra. Rossana chose to open a grocery store. She added on a miniature soccer field (fútbol 5) and electronic games, which are managed by her husband.

She believes that her business will continue to grow with the help of her loan. She will be able to buy goods at a lower cost and then charge lower prices to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumer goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 40 years old and married with 8 children. She has been in business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N60000 to purchase drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Josa

texts.en:
Josa R. is from the village of San Roque. She is 29 years old. Josa is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Josa owns and operates a hog raising business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Josa has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Josa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Josa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi

texts.fr: O. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est née le 08/10/1971 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est mariée à AMBALIOU Razack. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi et Razack ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend les produits cosmétiques (parfum, crème, lait corporel, déodorant, défrisant, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend ses produits dans son quartier à Pk10 et s'approvisionne en ces différents produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi a eu deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité à la grande satisfaction de sa clientèle Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi O. was born on 8 October 1971 in Sakété in the Department of Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is married to Razack Ambaliou. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi and Razack have three children, all of whom are in school and still in the care of their parents. The family lives in Pk10 area in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells cosmetics (perfume, cream, body milk, deodorant, hair straightener, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells her products in her locality in Pk10 and supplies herself with these goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi has already obtained two loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid these loans properly. In order to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her customers, Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mar está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Dina Guadalupe P. O. de 37 años quien tiene una modesta venta desde hace seis años y su sueño es mejorar su casa que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y en un futuro tener una carro. 

Martha Lizbeth A. S. de 28 años comenzó una pequeña verdulería y con forme le dieron los créditos en adim incluyo la venta de carne y hueso. Margelia del Socorro B. N. comenzó con una venta y con las ganancias y los prestamos se dedico a lo que más  puso la costura. Ella puso su propio taller de costura y empezó a vender también productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group Mar is made up of three enterprising women. One of them is Dina Guadalupe P. O. who is 37 years old and has a sales shop since 6 years ago and her dream is to better her home because it is in very bad condition and in the future to own a car.

Martha Lizbeth A. S. is 28 years old and has a small vegetable store and got a loan through ADIM (Kiva’s field partner) and in her sales included the sale of meat and bones. Margelia del Socorro B. N. began her sales and with the profits and loans began sewing. She set up her own sewing shop and sells Avon products as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy key grains and products for home consumption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia B. is from the village of Dimaluna in Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old and married. She has two school-aged children and six adult children. Venancia sells dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for almost a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Venancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. This will be Venancia's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Vilma ha logrado tener su propio negocio y se siente sastifecha por ser una mujer independiente, procreo dos hijos los cuales están cursando los estudios para un porvenir mejor. Su esposo es abogado y han venido haciendo mejoras a su casa, ella vende comida, refresco desde hace varios años, con ayuda de su esposo y préstamos ha logrado crecer en las ventas, la venta de comida se requiere de mucho capital para hacer un menú variado y captar clientes, así como comprar mesas, asientos, utensilios entre otros. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, pollo, frutas, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros productos para preparar los ricos platillos y seguir fortaleciendo su pequeño comedor para un futuro mejor de la familia todo esto lográndolo por los financiamiento que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses, tenemos la oportunidad de crecer como mujeres responsables, trabajadora de nuestra familia.
texts.en:
Vilma has managed to have her own business and feels satisfied in that she is able to be an independent woman. She has 2 children who are in school in order to have a better future. Her husband is a lawyer and they have been making improvements to their house. She has had a business selling food and drinks for a number of years. With the help of her husband and loans she has managed to make her sales grow. The sale of food requires a lot of capital in order to make a varied menu and gain clients, as well as to buy tables, chairs, utensils, etc. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit, candies, and soft drinks among other products, to prepare the rich dishes and to continue to strengthen her small eatery for a better future for her family. This financing allows Vilma and many other Nicaraguans to have the opportunity to grow as responsible women working for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit and candies to prepare the meals

loans.name: Katey

texts.en:
Katey is one of FATEN’s first clients. She took several loans from FATEN within its group guarantee program, and the last three loans as individual loans. She started with a 150 USD loan and gradually increased her loan size, but the loan was always very small so that it met her ability for repayment and her business size.

Katey is married with three children. She and her husband have owned and managed an olive-wood workshop for twenty years. They buy the olive wood and make crosses, statues, Christ caves and many other Christian religious handcrafts. They sell them to souvenir shops in Bethlehem as well as to wholesalers who export them to the USA and Europe.

 In the Palestinian territories there is no national currency and there are three main currencies used: US dollars, Israeli Shekels and the Jordanian Dinar. Katey has requested a loan of 405 Jordanian Dinars (1 USD=0.71 JOD).

Katey appears in the photo at her workshop. Last August, Katey’s photo taken at her workshop was used for a FATEN billboard media campaign throughout the West Bank. She was very proud that she was selected by FATEN to represent FATEN's clients.

loans.use: To purchase more olive wood

loans.name: Harvin Jose

texts.es: Harvin trabaja desde hace un año como tecnico de La Alcaldia del Municipio el Coral,  el vive con sus ancianos padres el cual ayuda  a su familia con los gastos  basicos del hogar. Con este crèdito pretende comprar materiales de construcciòn para repellar dos paredes ya que no ajusta comprarlo con el salario ya es muy poco, es por esta razon es que esta solicitando este crèdito a la Instituciòn de AFODENIC, su mayor sueño es seguir estudiando, tener un trabajo digno que alcance para sobrevivir y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Harvin has worked for a year as a technician at City Hall for the City of El Coral. He lives with his elderly parents and helps them with basic household expenses. This loan will be used to buy building materials so that he can apply stucco to two walls. Harvin is not able to purchase these items because he earns very little money. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from AFODENIC.

His greatest dream is to continue his education so that he can have a decent job, earn enough money to survive, and gradually make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to stucco two walls

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is fifty five years old. She is a divorcee with six children. She is really dedicated to her work and very supportive to all her children. Through her hard work, Comfort has supported her five of her children to complete school and has one still in school. She owns and operates clothing shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more clothing materials to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothing.

loans.name: Grace Santa

texts.es:
Grace R. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja en otro País, pero tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella.

Grace empezó hace 5 años atrás vendiendo cuadernos y plumas a sus vecinos. Cuando ahorro dinero suficiente construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para su papelería.

Ahora ella trabaja todo los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h00 todos los días vendiendo cuadernos, juguetes, plumas, laminas, cartulinas, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son las lluvias que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, juguetes y libros para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su papelería.
texts.en:
Grace R. is 43 years old. She lives in a suburban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement but she has only light as a basic service. Her husband works in another country but she has four children who live with her. Grace began five years ago selling notebooks and pens to her neighbors. When she saved enough money, she built a small paper shop in the area behind her house. Now she works every day from 6:30AM until 9PM selling notebooks, games, pens, sheets, cardstock, etc. One of the inconveniences that she faces is the rains that occur in her area. With the loan, she wishes to buy notebooks, pens, games and books for he business. In the future, she wants to have branches of her paper shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pens and games.

loans.name: Javier Oswaldo

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Razuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a trabajar en una empresa procesadora de pescado, Puerto Malabrigo es conocido en la zona por poseer varias plantas de procesamiento de este producto hidrobiológico para su conversión en harina de pescado. La mayoría de los pobladores encuentran en estas fabricas una fuente de trabajo e ingreso económico para sacar a su familia adelante.

Tal es el caso de Javier, que se apoya en este trabajo para mantener a su familia, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le han permitido mantenerlos sin problema, pero hace unas semanas las lluvias que azotaron las ciudades del norte del país, hicieron algunos daños en la estructura de su vivienda. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de materiales para hacer mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda.

Javier es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es instalar una bodega en su vivienda con la cual la economía de su familia goce de un ingreso extra y de mayor estabilidad. El es conocido y respetado por sus vecinos quienes lo consideran un hombre honorable y que siempre ayuda a los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Javier, 39, lives with his wife and children in Puerto Malabrigo, Razuri district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. For the last 8 years he has worked for a fish processing plant. Puerto Malabrigo is well known in the area for having several fish processing plants specializing in turning fish into fish meal. Most of the area residents find employment and income to support their families in these plants. Such is Javier’s case. He relies on this job to support his family. Income from this work has made it possible for him to support them problem-free. However, a few weeks ago heavy rains pelted the cities in the north of the country causing structural damage to his house. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy building materials to repair his house. Javier is an honest, very hard-working person. His greatest wish is to set up a store in his home so that the family’s economy can enjoy an extra source of income and more stability. He is known and respected by his neighbors who consider him to be an honorable man who always helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la de la comarca pueblo redondo, es madre  soltera, trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas, se desempeña en el cargo como docente, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hija.
texts.en:
This client is from Pueblo Redondo. She is a single mother. She is a teacher at the Señor de Esquipulas Institute. Her daughter contributes to her support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for home improvement labor costs.

loans.name: Tunde

texts.en: Tunde is a hard working and honest man. He has a fish pond where he raises fish to sell. He loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with his customers. He works for long hours to be able to support his home. He is married, has 4 children and he is 40 years old. His wife also works to support their home. Tunde is requesting for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more fingerlings to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia J. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to stock pairs of trousers and sandals to sell.  Fozia is 22 years old and is divorced.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a supermarket.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock pairs of trousers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia Y. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 57 years old. Cecelia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling coconut wine known as "tuba" in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo de Jesús de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios se dan por que su familia anteriormente alquilaba un taxi y Guillermo se dedicaba era quien lo manejaba. El ha se sacrificado mucho por comprar su propio carro ahora que lo obtiene está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de reparaciones que son necesarias. Sus deseos son obtener una nueva unidad de taxi.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 40 years old. He is a hard worker and loves his job. He provides taxi services and has been doing so for more than ten years. He used to rent his taxi, but he has worked hard to be able to buy his own vehicle. He is asking for this loan in order to buy some needed spare parts. He would like to buy a new taxi one day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en: S. Jamoliddin was born in 1979 and is married with three children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International four years ago, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, Jamoliddin saw a new business opportunity: rearing calves, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, he will purchase calves and feed for them to expand his business. Jamoliddin plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Lamulatu

texts.en:
N. Lamulatu is 21 years-old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Lamulatu has a business managing a retail store, which sells various small goods, in Kyotera.  Lamulatu has had her retail business for approximately one-and-a-half years.

To expand her business, Lamulatu is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy goods to resell and obtain more inventory for her retail shop.  Lamulatu hopes to expand her business and gain more clients in order to generate profits for her family.  

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. First, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer youth a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and to target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado del distrito para adquirirlos. Nieves se encarga de que sus clientes encuentren  los productos que necesitan en su establecimiento, por ello trata de ofrecerles productos de buena calidad, esto y el trato amable con el que los atiende han hecho que actualmente cuente con un grupo de clientes fieles que mantienen una preferencia por su negocio.
Su esposo trabaja como transportista en una mototaxi (motocicleta con una cabina anexada que sirve para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros), con los ingresos que ambos perciben sacan adelante a su hogar.
Nieves desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes, por ello ha solcicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su meta.
Nieves es una mujer tranquila y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nieves is a 47 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the Chepén district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial trafic, in the province of the same name. The area is in the La Libertad region, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is in business selling groceries and household necessities, from a store in her home. She provides her customers with all sorts of everyday products, which they used to have to go all the way to the district market to buy. Nieves likes to make sure her customers always find the quality goods they want in her shop. Together with her friendly manner, this has meant she now has a group of loyal customers who choose to make their purchases in her shop. Her husband works driving a mototaxi (which is a motorcyle with a cab on the back that is used for transporting goods or passengers). With the two incomes they share in the running of their home. Nieves wants to grow her business by purchasing additional stock to offer her customers, so she has requested a loan of 2000 soles from [field partner] Edpyme Alternativa that will help her realize her aims. Nieves is a calm and responsible woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbours consider her a reliable person. She has already been working with this organisation and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with regard to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for the store she runs in her home

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina tiene 39 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 10 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado, Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención de Rosa es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz, refrescos, bolsas, platos y cubiertos. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Argentina is 39 years old; she is a married woman and has 2 children under her care. She sells and makes food as a source of income and has had the business for over 10 years. Her business is located in the market. In the beginning, she had very little capital but had the will to get ahead since she had to pay the household expenses and give her children a good education and food. Little by little she increased her inventory with very little earnings but her customers kept coming back since Rosa’s attention to her customers is very good and she always greets them with a smile on her lips. The loan is for work capital to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn, refreshments, bags, plates and utensils. Her biggest dream is that each of her children will be able to finish their studies and that they will continue with their respective jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
“CONSENTIDAS” es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal que se organizò para su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, como todas las asociaciones está guiada por una mesa directiva, compuesta por una presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La tesorera,  doña L. se dedica a la venta de carne, aprendió este negocio de sus padres pues antes trabajaba con su familia.    Actualmente le colabora su pareja, compran carne por mayor del matadero y la venden por menor todos los días.  Es parte de la asociación desde el primer ciclo, la primera vez fue invitada por sus compañeras.


La asociación comunal esta integrado por siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de carne, venta de comida, recicladora de chatarra, venta artesanía, venta de salchipapa, venta de productos de salud.
texts.en:
“Consentidas” (Easy-Going Women) is the name of the communal bank that was organized for its second loan cycle at the Villa Exaltación Service Point. Like all the communal banks, it is guided by a board of directors, consisting of a president, treasurer and secretary. The treasurer, L., sells meat. She learned this business from her parents because she used to work with her family. Now she works with her husband; they buy meat wholesale from the slaughterhouse and sell it retail everyday. She has been part of the bank since the first loan cycle. The first time, she was invited by her friends. The communal bank is made up of seven women and one man. They have different businesses, such as: meat sales, food sales, scrap iron recycling, handcraft sales, sales of salchipapa [a Bolivian fast food], and sales of health care products.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: meat

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is happily married to a businessman. She has four children, one in secondary school, two in primary school and one infant. She has been selling clothes in a shop for the past 10 years.
