Lucy also gets income from mobile phone charging from her house which has an electricity connection. With the kshs. 40000 loan, Lucy wants to buy bales of clothes. She experiences the challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell clothes wholesale in future. She owns her home which has both electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: Buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Janyl

texts.en:
Janyl S. is young farmer, who lives in Ak-Jar village, in the north –west of Kyrgyzstan. She is 28, married and has three children. Janyl graduated from medical college and works as a nurse at the local ambulance room. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her children, Janyl decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. Using her initial capital of 3,500 KGS, she bought only one calf. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts and today she has two milk cows, two calves, and three horses. Also, Janyl started to engage in bee-farming, which became her favorite activity. At present days, she has 12 bee-families and earns about 8,000 KGS monthly from selling the products of bee keeping. 

Now Janyl applies for  loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more milk cows that will allow her to increase milk sales and enlarge the number of customers. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Los Solidarios De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS DE SAN ISIDRO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Chicón, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es él Sr.Eliseo él tiene 51años de edad, él tiene 3 hijos y es casado; el socio se dedica a la agrisultura , él tiene terrenos para cultivar maíz y papa. El socio es agricultor desde hace 10 años, el socio es natural de Quillabamba ubicado a 8 horas de Cusco, el radica en el poblado de Chicón desde hace 11 años y es feñiz allá, el socio solicita el préstamo para esta temporada que iniciarán las siembras de los diferentes productos agrícolas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos, preparar la tierra.

Los otros socios son  agricultores otras se dedican a la crianza de animales, otras socias venden comida, otros son albañiles y artesanos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Here is a member of the community bank "Los Solidariso de San Isidro". The community bank is located in the district of Chicon in the province and region of Cusco.One of the members is Eliseo, he is 51 years old, he has 3 children and he is married. He is an agriculturist and he has his fields where to cultivate corn and potatoes. He has been an agriculturist for the past 10 years. He is originally from Quillabamba, a city located 8 hours from Cusco but he has lived in the city of Chicon for the past 11 years and he is happy there. He requests a loan for this season when the fields are seeded of various produce. He requests a lon to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to ready the fields. The other members are agriculturists and livestock farmers, some sell foods, others are construction workers, and artisans. She is very grateful and she values the loan granted to her through this organization and she is committed with the payment obligations of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Luis Alberto; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de imprenta, el tiene una pequeña tienda de imprenta  que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  papeles y materiales para la imprenta.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Machupicchu".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Luis Alberto, 45 years old, married with two children.  The associate has a printing business.  He has a small printing shop that he runs from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and through this business he takes care of his children.  He wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan to buy paper and other printing materials.

He gives thanks to all that are participating making his dream come true and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: The associate is seeking a loan to purchase paper and printing materials.

loans.name: Dannys Geovanni

texts.es:
Dannys de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, reside en el Puerto El Triunfo, departamento de Usulután ,  vive con su madre y su hermano , es soltero y no tiene hijos, el negocio lo inicio trabajando con su padre luego quiso ser independiente para lo cual inicio este negocio, su única dificultad  es que tienen mucha demanda de producto y no cuentan con un vehículo para entregar la mercadería a domicilio por lo que se ven en la necesidad de alquilar un carro para realizar las ventas generando un mayor gasto para ellos .
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas producto y dar abasto a toda la demanda, logrando obtener mayores ingresos viendo de esta manera más cerca el sueño de comprar su propio vehículo, esto le ayudara a progresar como persona y como  comerciante; sus sueños son crecer en el negocio, poseer su carro, tener un buen inventario  de producto, cancelar a tiempo  este préstamo  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dannys is 19 years old and sells shellfish. He lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulután. He lives with his mother and his brother. He is single and doesn't have any children. He started out working with his father, then he wanted to be independent, so he began this business. His only difficulty is that there is a lot of demand for his product and he doesn't have a vehicle to deliver his merchandise to homes, so it is necessary to rent a car to complete his sales, and this generates a considerable expense.

He is applying for the loan so that he can buy more product and meet the demand, and also obtain greater income, thus coming closer to his dream of buying his own vehicle. This will help him progress as a person and as a businessman. His dreams are to expand his business, have a car, have a good inventory of product, pay back this loan on time, and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: Buy shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 28 years old. She is married and has three children who are between nine months and eight years old. Two of her children go to school. Her husband works at a government institution. Clarisse owns a butchery selling meat, and she has been in this business for a period of four years. 

She would like to get this loan to buy more meat to sell.  With the profit from this business, she expects to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.   In the future, she plans to expand her business and would like to see it prosper.

loans.use: To buy more meat to resell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas, es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Felicitas es feriante, viaja a Cangallo, donde vende frutas surtidas, verduras surtidas, pan y en Cangallo compra: maíz, trigo, cebada y lo vende los días domingos en la feria de las Américas.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería (frutas, pan, verduras, queso)
Lo que le gusta de Finca es que puede acceder al crédito y puede ahorrar. Su sueño es poder construir sus casa.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Dignidad Microfinance Group. She is a 42-year-old married mother with 5 children.

She is a stallholder at Cangallo, where she sells assorted fruits, vegetables, and breads. At Cangallo, she purchases corn, wheat and barley, which she sells on Sundays at the Feria de las Americas Market.

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in restocking her stand with goods (fruits, bread, vegetables, cheese). What she likes about Finca is that she can obtain a loan and save money. Her dream is to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: Purchase local fruits, vegetables, and breads

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela tienen 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años compra y vende alfalfa al por mayor, negocio que le proporciona ganancias y le demanda mucho trabajo, ya que tiene clientes que viven en su zona, lugar que queda muy lejos y les es difícil llegar a la ciudad para adquirir éste producto. Ante esto decidió vender este producto, hoy son muchos los que le solicitan alfalfa, ya que les sirve como forraje para sus animales. Sus hijos, son quienes le ayudan en el negocio, durante toda la semana, repartiendo a los clientes. En adelante anhela aumentar su capital de trabajo y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito podrá invertir en la compra de más alfalfa.
texts.en: Maricela is 33 years old; she lives with her three children in her own home. For more than two years she has bought and sold alfalfa wholesale, a business that gives her revenue and demands a lot of work because she has customers who live in her area, a place that is very far and hard to reach from the city where they could buy this product. She decided to sell this product, and now there are many people who request alfalfa because they use it to feed their animals. Her children, who are helping her with the business, make deliveries to customers all week. She wants to increase her working capital very soon so she can keep up with customer demands. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is very happy to know that she has some financial support. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and loyal. She is grateful to all the people who will be lenders on this loan because it will be very useful in moving her business forward. With this loan she will be able to purchase more alfalfa.

loans.use: Buy more alfalfa

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 49 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que disponía en su casa. Desde entonces brinda una atención cálida y amable a sus clientes que consumen los productos que ella vende. Todos los días los dedica a su negocio y hasta los fines de semana, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Hoy espera aumentar sus ganancias, debido a que se encuentra en temporada navideña por lo que habrá más afluencia de gente que irá a su establecimiento, por tanto espera comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Es el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo utilizará en la compra de más productos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old. She lives with her two children in a home that she owns. Five years ago, she decided to start her own business, and using some available space she had in the house, she set up a shop to sell basic staple products. Since then she has been bringing warm and friendly customer service to clients who purchase from her. She works in her shop every day, including weekends; sometimes her children help her out as well. Currently, Elizabeth is hoping to increase her earnings because of the upcoming Christmas season, when she'll have a larger influx of customers; therefore, she would like to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her store. This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, Elizabeth likes being a part of her communal bank because all of its members are people that she knows - people who are responsible and committed to the group. Elizabeth is grateful to all the individuals who will make this loan possible since it will be very helpful to her in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to supply her store

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 6, 4, 3 y 1 año de edad, él tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, desde hace seis años, este negocio lo aprendió de su padre ya que al igual que él se dedica a la venta de productos derivados de la leche, su trabajo es de lunes a sábado y es la única fuente de ingreso con la cuenta para sostener su hogar.
Por el momento Isaías quiere adquirir más productos para comercializar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita adquirir dichos productos, con la idea de mantener siempre una buena cantidad para atender la demanda de los clientes, su compra será en queso, crema, queso fresco y quesillo, con esta inversión su negocio será fortalecido y mejorara sus ingresos familiares ya que tendrá la posibilidad de vender más manteniendo estable el comercio.
Su sueño es atender a nuevas zonas de mercado, ampliándose y obteniendo el reconocimiento de muchos clientes, también de su negocio espera mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isaías, residing in Jucuapa department of Usulután, lives with his wife and four children ages 6, 4, 3 and 1 years.  He is 28 years of age. He has been dedicated to the sale of dairy products for six years. He learned this business from his father, since he was also dedicated to selling products derived from milk.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  This is the only source of income for his household. 
At the moment, Isaías would like to acquire more products to sell.  He has requested a loan which will permit him to buy said products, with the idea of always maintaining a good quantity to meet the demands of his clients. His purchases will be cheese, cream, cheese curds and string cheese.  With this investment his business will be fortified and his family income will improve, now that he will have the possibility to sell more and maintain a steady commerce.   
His dream is to expand into new markets, growing and obtaining more clients.  With his business he hopes to improve the living conditions for his family and give an education to his children.

loans.use: To buy cheese, cream, cheese curds and string cheese.

loans.name: Mercedes Obdulia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es Abogado. Ella estudio y obtuvo el título de Ing. Comercial.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos industriales como por ejemplo purificadores de agua, tiene un local en donde funciona su negocio. Hace algún tiempo atrás tenía unas cabinas telefónicas pero tuvo que cerrar por motivos de viaje pero que con este nuevo crédito espera poder volver a abrir, también espera vender teléfonos, accesorios de teléfonos, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas.

Este crédito es para comprar tarjetas, recargas telefónicas, en si para adecuar sus cabinas. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y mejorando dia a dia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Bosques in the beautiful city of Portoviejo--known for its green mountains and charming landscapes, and at one time called The City of the Valley--we find the place where, every 15 days, the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques communal bank meet. 

Mercedes is a founding member of this communal bank. She likes it for the benefits it provides and because it facilitates loans. She's 54-years-old, married, and has three children who are grown; two of them still live at home. Her husband is a lawyer. She studied and earned a degree in commercial administration/management.

She works as a merchant, selling industrial products such as water purifiers. She has her own shop where she runs her business. A while ago she had some telephone booths but she had to close them for travel. With this loan she hopes to open them again and she also hopes to start selling telephones and telephone accessories, such as phone cards and phone credit. 

This loan is to buy phone cards and phone credit for her phone booths. Her goal is to continue working and improve everyday.

loans.use: Purchase of phone cards and phone accessories for her phone booths

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es:
Genaro casado, comerciante y agricultor el negocio es familiar ya que sus hijos le apoyan trabajan en el cultivo. Inicio con esfuerzo propio poco a poco mejorando su finca, tiene la necesidad de comprar de una yunta de bueyes para arrear la tierra y trasportar la producción siendo esto unos de sus planes para beneficio en mejorar su nivel de vida. 
El préstamo que solicitad será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes para obtener mejores productos y venderlo a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Genaro is married and works as a merchant and farmer in the family business. His children help by working in the fields. Genaro started through his own efforts and gradually made improvements to his farm. He needs to buy a yoke of oxen so that he can plow his land and transport his harvest. These are some of his plans so that he can improve his standard of living.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers so that he can obtain better quality crops that he can sell at a higher price.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia R. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Letecia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business which provides pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase items like nail polish & nail cutters needed to provide service This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items like nail polish & nail cutters needed to provide service

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ana posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 7 años que inicio este medio de vida, ella vende sus productos de contado y al crédito, algunos camiones llegan a dejarle sus productos hasta su hogar, pero algunas veces ella tiene que ir hasta el mercado para buscar lo que sus clientes solicitan. es madre de dos hijos las cuales están a su cargo, todas ellas asisten al colegio gracias al apoyo incondicional de la mama , la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que sus clientes  están demandando diversidad de productos. A pesar de las circunstancias es una persona que quiere salir adelante con su negocio que es el único medio de ingresos que tiene.
texts.en: Ana has a local store located in her house which she opened seven years ago.  She accepts cash for her products, but also sells on credit.  Trucks arrive to leave her products at her house, but she sometimes has to go to the market to look for what her customers request.  She is the mother of two children who are under her care and they all go to school thanks to her unconditional support.  Ana is requesting a new loan to invest in her business because her customers are demanding a variety of products.  Despite the circumstances, she is a person that wants to move forward with her business, which is her only form of income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old and married, with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn sells green bananas and coconuts for making copra, or dried coconut meat. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Primero de Mayo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Desde hace 5 años tiene instalado en el exterior del mercado de abastos Atusarías se dedica a la venta de frutas. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad frutas. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio de Víctor siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

El desea adquirir más mercadería, por ello há creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.  De esta manera ella podrá adquirir la fruta a menor precio y por consiguiente ayudara a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor, 58, is married living with his wife and two children in the Primero de Mayo sector of José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of Lambayeque Region’s most crowded districts, known primarily for its high rate of poverty since the people generally live in marginal urban zones that lack basic utilities.

For the last five years he’s had a fruit stand located outside the Atusarías Foodstuffs Market.  He offers a variety of fruit daily to his customers.  This business is an important source of help for his family.  Víctor’s business always has customers because they prefer him because of his good treatment and kindness.

He wants to acquire more merchandise so he thought it would be a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan so that he can get the fruit at a lower price and thus have higher income.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol S., 58, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

S. is a farmer and a grocery seller, earning an income of $7 US per day. Two of her children are employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase groceries to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic loads of several networks like GLOBE & SMART and digital video discs in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic loads of GLOBE & SMART. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads of GLOBE & SMART.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 59 years old and married with six children.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonieta has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children.

Anita has a general store selling shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. to earn a living. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase more variety of products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste for her general store.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more variety products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for her store

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, fue a iniciativa de la Sra. Celsa, quién vive en  la zona de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
Las mismas ya formaron parte del Comité Emprendedora de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La Directora General del Comité que se denomina “Mujeres Activas”, es la Sra. Celsa. Ella es una señora luchadora, responsable y muy activa junto con sus compañeras que conforman el grupo. El comité se encuentra en el   Segundo   Ciclo con 25 integrantes, quienes desarrollan diversas actividades, todas en busca de generar mayor ingreso en sus hogares y tratar de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar. Anhelan poder brindarles todo a lo que ellas no pudieron acceder.
Son muy unidas, responsables, trabajadoras y solidarias.
Solicitan el credito para la compra de mercaderias para la venta, las mismas consitirían en: comestibles de primera necesidad: verduras, frutas, arroz, harina, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Ceslsa is the general director of the communal bank, which is called “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women).  She is a tenacious and responsible woman.  She is very active together with her colleagues in the communal bank.  The communal bank is in its second cycle, and it is comprised of 25 women who carry out diverse business activities.  

All of them look to generate greater income for their households, and they try to give their children a better education and well-being.  They strive to be able to give them everything that they were not able to have.  They are very united, responsible, hard-working, and supportive.

They are requesting the loan to buy basic needs food, which includes vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic needs food like vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, pictured here, is a construction worker and his wife is a farmer. The couple has been married since 2009 and has a young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sothea is requesting a loan to buy a cow to raise and sell when it grows big enough.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise and sell

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
44-year-old Yayah is married and has two children aged nineteen and sixteen. His dependent father also lives with him.

In 2001, Yayah began selling garri (cassava flakes) because he needed to alleviate his domestic difficulties. His business is the only source of livelihood for him and his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 7,600,000 SLL every month. The rising cost of transportation is his major challenge, though, and competition is extremely high.

Yayah would like a loan of 3,000 SLL in order to buy more garri to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly income by approximately 751,000 SLL.

In the future, Yayah plans to purchase and install a garri processing machine in his village and to give his children a quality education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garri to sell.

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda, aged 40, is married to Kanini; they are blessed with four children between the ages of six and fifteen. He has a farm producing mainly maize, beans, and millet, and has been doing this for ten years. The business earns him a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is his second loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor. 

He intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor

loans.name: Charley

texts.en:
" To be successful in life" is the main goal of Charley, a 55 year-old mother of five. To attain her goal, she engages in selling frozen foods to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost 9 years and usually earns P6,000 a month. Her income was used for their food and for necessities for their children.

She aims to improve the business to make it more profitable. She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham and hotdogs to sell in their village. She believes that hard work and strong determination are the keys to gain success.

loans.use: to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham, and hot dogs to sell in the village

loans.name: Todos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Todos Juntos”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, ventas de carbón, tejidos, venta de ropa, pintores, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Yeisi integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo y solo se puede apreciar su rostro sonriente, usa un corte de cabello hacia el lado. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano desde hace dos años, sin embargo en la actualidad y desde hace dos meses está incursionando con la venta de ropa nueva.
Comenta que ha alcanzado tener un gran número de clientes, debido a sus trabajos anteriores de manera dependiente. Su horario de trabajo es flexible, lo que le permite coordinar su día de manera organizada.
Su mercadería la encarga a la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente en el barrio Meiggs, sector que surte de productos a comerciantes con un bajo costo.
Con el crédito invertirá en su negocio y comprará ropa nueva.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, ya que esto le permitiría abastecer con novedosos diseños su negocio. 
Yeisi vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijas de 10 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños  a nivel personal son proporcionarles a sus hijas una educación de calidad y que puedan ser profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza. Comenta que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal y reuniones impartidas en éstas.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Todos Juntos.  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different sectors, including coal sales, textiles, clothing sales, painting, and others.  All of the members live in the city of Valdivia.

Yeisi is a member of the community bank.  In the photo, she is in the back, and you can only see her smiling face.  She has a hairstyle to the side.  She works selling clothing.  She started selling second-hand clothes two years ago, however two months ago, she began selling new clothing.  She already has a large number of customers thanks to her past jobs.  Her schedule is flexible, which allows her to organize her own day.  

Her merchandise is made in the city of Santiago, specifically in the Meiggs neighborhood, an area that provides products to merchants at a low cost.  With this loan, she will invest in her business and purchase new clothing.  Her goal is to have an established store for her business so that she can stock up on new designs.  

Yeisi lives with her mother and her two daughters, who are 3 and 10 years old.  Her dream on a personal level is to provide her daughters with a quality education so that they can be professionals.  

She is very happy and thankful for the loans and services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She comments that she feels very comfortable with the members of the community bank and the meetings given by them.  

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Rios region.  It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle.  Valdivia's main economic activities are shipbuilding, lumber, paper, cellulose (Celco), brewing, and milling.  Tourism also plays an important role, as does university educational services, headed by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mrs. Penh, 31, lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own farmland. She has been running this business for many years, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. They are blessed with two children, both of whom are single and living under their care. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In order to create more income, Penh would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva toward purchasing additional firewood for her husband to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos no tiene hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, el negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de un amigo quien le ayudo, y ahora ya tiene mucha experiencia, no tiene horario establecido, todos los días sale a vender el producto.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mercadería(vitaminas, antibioticos, en presentacion de pastillas, jarabes e inyecciones) y aumentar más su negocio y un estante el cual le ayudara para tener una mejor presentación en su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes.
El sueño de Tomas es tener un negocio grande, y de esa forma mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his parents and two siblings.  He doesn't have any children and sells natural medicines for a living.  He started his business with the help of a friend and now he has a lot of experience.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule and goes out every day to sell his products. 

He will use the loan to buy merchandise (vitamins and antibiotics in the form of pills, syrups and injections) and shelving to improve the presentation of his products.  This will help him to increase his business and better serve his customers.  

Tomas's dream is to have a large business so that he can support his family.

loans.use: buy vitamins and antibiotics in the form of pills, syrups and injections.

loans.name: Chamnap

texts.en:
Chamnap (pictured above) is a weaver. She also buys finished silk products from other weavers in her village to resell in Phnom Penh market. 

She has been married since 2001 and has two sons - one who is in school and the other who is too young for school. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband has full-time employment at a company in Phnom Penh.

Chamnap is in the process of building her new house, but she lacks the money to finish it. Hence, she has decided to ask for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to finish building her house.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Anecita has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices. Anecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Rosemarie has a retail shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Rosemarie is a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 35-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with her parents. She has owned a female beauty salon since 2009. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. In addition, Rana has three children and contributes in paying their educational fees even if she is not staying with them.  Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new cosmetics products which will allow her better serve her customers. She is very positive and has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe KOSSOMINE sont toute des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  5 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KOROTOUMOU, au milieu fait la transformation et vente de Sounbala dans ce groupe de femmes KOSSOMINE. Expérimentée à la matière elle beaucoup sollicitée par des clients venant de Sikasso et d’ailleurs. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 kilogrammes de graines de néré, dans les villages avoisinants. Elle les transforme avant de les vendre au  grand marché de Sikasso  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.50FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Kossomine group are all married women, who average 40 years of age with an average of five children each; they live in polygamous families in Koboïla, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their third loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Korotoumou, who is in the middle of the photo, makes and sells sounbala (a spice made up from "néré" seeds) within the Kossomine women's group. As a result of her experience in this domain, she is in great demand from her customers who come from Sikasso and elsewhere. With her loan she is planning to buy 150 kg of "néré" grains in the neighboring villages. She transforms the "néré" seeds into sounbala before selling them at Sikasso's Grand Market to order and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy customer demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "néré" grains

loans.name: Bokk Diom 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Bokk Diom regroupe quatre femmes et un homme qui s’activent dans la vente de paniers, fruits, bancs.
La présidente, une dame de 40 ans  est veuve et mère de famille. Elle vend  des balaies, des oranges, des paniers. Le prêt lui servira  à renforcer son activité.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité Ndew arrive à gérer sa famille au quotidien.
texts.en:
Bokk Diom Group is made up of four women and one man who sell baskets, fruits, and benches. 

The group's president is a 40-year-old woman, who is a widow and the mother of a family. She sells brooms, oranges, and baskets. She will use her loan to bolster her business.

With her profit, Ndew manages to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and crafts (baskets, benches, …)

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married and is a loving father of three children. He is an industrious and determined man. He has been growing agricultural crops for more than ten years. He grows rice as a primary source of income. He wants to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing.  He is asking for a loan of P13,000 for this purpose. He hopes it will bestow plentiful profits for the assurance of their future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Aridza

texts.fr:
Aridza est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un tapissier. Elle a quatre enfants, dont trois à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 1 an.
Aridza travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle vend des produits de mercerie et du déguè pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Aridza a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie, du sucre, du petit mil, du lait et du couscous. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Aridza voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Aridza is a 31 year old woman. She is married to an upholsterer. She has four children, three of whom are at school. The oldest is 15 and the youngest 1 year old. Aridza has been working as a retailer since 1995. She sells haberdashery products and 'déguè' (a food product) for all her customers in her shop. She buys her stock in Lomé. She works alone. Currently, her main problem is the slump. Aridza is seeking her third loan with WAGES in order to buy haberdashery products, sugar, millet, milk and couscous. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Aridza would like to grow her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure the family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery products, milk, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una persona emprendedora, dinámica y objetiva,  ella decidió  estudiar enfermería porque  hace 5 años tuvo un accidente el cual casi le cuesta la vida, pero tuvo el apoyo de la familia, quien estuvo pendiente y la ayudo a salir adelante  y se dio cuenta que siempre necesita de alguien que  cuide y este pendiente de los medicamentos  y además ella  siempre ha sido la persona que cuida en la casa de los enfermos, hace años ella fue la que estuvo cuidando del abuelo, un señor de 94 años, cuando estuvo enfermo se encargó de darle los medicamentos, de estar pendiente y de ponerle  oxígeno. 
Además fue  la persona que se encargó de cambiarle las vendas  y aplicarle las gotas a  el primo cuando le hicieron una cirugía en un ojo, por eso decidió estudiar enfermería.
Ella quiere en un futuro poder entrar en una empresa que le pueda dar una estabilidad laboral, no ha podido cumplir los sueños de ser enfermera por problemas económicos, pero quiere poder tener este beneficio que le brinda KIVA para poder estudiar.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
For more than 10 years now, Julia sold fish near the main streets of her town, serving locals and passers by.
She resides in the town of Lila.  She is 51- year and has twelve grown children. On the other hand, her husband earns a living by being a driver.

Julia  joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She  is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP  to purchase variety of fish, foam(fish storage) and weighing scale.
These are vital to her day to day living. Thus, she could able to do bulk purchases and able to cope with demands.

For the future, she is determined that she could able to expand her business and continue to invest other sources of income to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fish, foam(fish storage) and weighing scale

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy owns a small store in her neighborhood where she sells foods such as rice, sugar and oil. Her neighbor gave her moral support to open this store because she realized there was not much competition in her sector of the community. Before opening the store she worked in a plastic factory but had to leave her children unattended at home. 5 years ago she decided to start this microenterprise because it would give her the flexibility to be with her family and would also provide for them. She is separated from her husband and is therefore a single mother of 3. She will use the loan to diversify and increase her product offerings.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of items to sell and purchase at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mworia

texts.en: J. Mworia 35 year-old community health nurse who runs a clinic in Meru, Eastern Province, Kenya. He wore a smile on his face when he heard the news that he can access a loan to improve the quality of services at his clinic. He runs a rural clinic that serves also as a point of referral for other clinics. So many clients now come to Mworia’s clinic that two other clinics that used to operate within the same area have had to relocate to different sites, due to their reduced number of clients. He intends to use the loan to establish a fully equipped minor surgery theatre, renovate, and create more space.

loans.use: Expand and improve health services

loans.name: Abdurrahman

texts.en: Abdurrahman lives in Kongowe area in Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He owns a shop selling soft drinks in retail and wholesale. He has another business of selling fruits and vegetables of which his wife is in charge. Soft drinks business has higher turnover in his shop, mainly caused by hot weather of Dar es Salaam. Demand for soft drinks is high. Abdurrahman cannot meet this demand. He is in need of $1200 as a working capital to meet the demand for cold drinks. The more sales he makes will enable him get extra income for paying school fees for his children and improve his income level.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. V., despite her young age, has become an expert in the manufacture of rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries popular in Nicaragua). She is originally from Somoto, a village to the north of Managua, famous for making the best rosquillas in the country. She would use the loan to buy raw materials (flour, corn, sugar, and so on). She hopes that the loan will help her improve her economic outlook and better her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. V. es una empresaria jóven que a su corta edad es ya toda una especialista en elaborar rosquillas, es originaria de somoto, un pueblo al norte de managua que se ha caracterizado por ser la ciudad donde se elaboran las mejores rosquillas del país. Esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en materiales que necesita para elaborar sus productos (harina, maíz, azúcar, etc.). Espera que el crédito la ayude a mejorar su condición económica y a sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her pastries

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh (40) and his wife Huyen (28) are originally from a town near Hanoi in the north of Vietnam. They moved to Tanh Linh in hopes of being able to make a better living for themselves. Finding work was initially very difficult, so they asked for a loan in order to get started. The lender they received the loan from charged an exorbitant interest rate, which left them stuck in poverty.

Huyen runs a small grocery store in the front of their home and Thanh works as a day laborer. Huyen is able to earn between 10-15,000 VND (US$ 0.62-$ 0.94) per day. Thanh earns about 30,000 VND per day (about $1.85 US), but he is not always able to find work. With the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, they can save more of their money and not spend it paying interest on a loan. They are trying to raise 2 children, H. Thi Tuyet Loan (8) and H. Minh Cong (4).

loans.use: to expand their little grocery store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort I.  said that she will be happy if you can loan her the amount of $400 because it will enable her to improve her business by buying more yams for sale. She is 58 years old and a widow with four children.  She started this business in 2002 and she learned it for three months before beginning. She has been a LAPO member for three years.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Thi Nhuan

texts.en: Ms Nhuận is 49 years old. She lives in Phú Mẫn hamlet, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She used to buy waste material like copper, brass, and metal and resell it to recycling companies. Today she raises chickens. She has a peep of more than 100 egg-laying chickens. She sells the eggs, and this is the main revenue for her family. She wishes to have the money to buy more chicken feed. She has applied to binhminh cdc (SEDA) for a loan, and she plans to pay the loan back in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase feed for chicken.

loans.name: Wahid Allah

texts.en:
Wahid Allah lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated and lives with his own family. He is a property dealer who rents and sells houses and land. He has good experience and has worked in this business for over 8 years.

Wahid has the responsibility for supporting his family and he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary materials so that he can launch his business to make good income for his family.

loans.use: To complete necessary materials

loans.name: Lenin Augusto

texts.es:
Lenin is 23 years old and is married with two sons ages four and one. He works as a team supervisor at an electrical company. His house is constructed out of two different materials: half concrete, half lumber. In his desire to advance, he has decided to seek financing to rebuild his home. With the loan, he will build the walls of his living room out of concrete. His wish is to provide his small children with a more decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lenin L. tiene 23 años de edad, casada, y con 2 hijos varones de 4 años y un año respectivamente. Trabaja como Supervisor de Brigada de una empresa de electricidad. Su casa de habitación es minifalda, mitad de concreto y mitad de tabla. En su afan por buscar la prosperidad, decidió buscar financiamiento pra empezar la reconstrucción de su casa, con el crédito va a construir los muros de la sala de habitación de concreto. Quiere darle una vida más digna a sus pequeños niños.

loans.use: Build concrete walls for living room.

loans.name: Khikoyat

texts.en: O. Khikoyat is 51 years old, married and has seven children. She works as a vendor, selling children's clothing from a rented storefront every day of the week except Friday, when she rises at 5 a.m. to go to a neighboring city to sell her goods in its local market. After years of hard work, O. has managed to make her business stable and generate significant income for her family. O. would like to buy more clothing to sell, and has come to us for a loan of $1,000 to make that possible. She is a repeat client of IMON, has a positive credit history, promises to repay the loan in a timely manner and wants to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in additional merchandise.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one infant child.  Leah also cares for five dependents, who live with her because they are relatives.  In 2005, Leah established her stationary business. She now requires a  loan of $975 in order to buy additional stocks of stationary equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of stationary equipment.

loans.name: Guadalupe Argelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe started her business because she has always liked retail. Before getting married, her parents owned a general store in which she always liked to work. Furthermore, this business allows her to receive extra income so that she can give her children everything they need for school. With this income, at the very least she helps out with her children’s educational expenses; her son attends college while her daughter attends middle school.

Six years ago, she started selling only bread rolls, candy, pork rinds, tostadas, and drinks, but she now has a well-stocked store.

She currently needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to restock her store with groceries. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe inició el negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y en su casa antes D. casarse sus papas tenian una tienda D. abarrotes y a elL. le gustaba estar en el negocio, ademas D. tener un ingreso extra y asi poder darle a sus hijos lo necesario para L. escueL. con esto minimo le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos diarios D. las tareas D. su hijo D. L. universidad y L. otra D. L. secundaria.

Comenzó hace aproximadamente hace 6 años inicio vendiendo solo bollos dulces chicharrones tostadas y refrescos y hoy en dia cuenta con una tienda bien surtida.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para surtir abarrotes en general. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo R. is 29 years old. He is married with four children. Ziyodullo is a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Ziyodullo is a farmer, and he has been in this business for four years. He grows agricultural crops such as tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, potatoes, and wheat. His brothers help him with the business. Each year Ziyodullo grows a sufficient amount of crops for his family's consumption and to sell the rest of his yield for a profit. By generating a stable income, Ziyodullo is able to support his large family; however, sometimes his income is not enough to provide for the most elemental needs of the family because he supports not only his wife and children but also his brother and sister.

So, he wants to increase productivity on his plot, which requires an infusion of capital in order to produce a larger crop yield. Specifically, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 over a 10-month term, and the loan proceeds will be used to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the loan, Ziyodullo believes he will be able to improve the family's home and standard of living in a short period of time. He thanks you for your support because your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema E. is 20 years old. She is a married a woman with 3 children. She became a milk and maize seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6.30pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time for Mrs. Phann S. to ask for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a fruit seller and farmer in Kork Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  On her plantation, Mrs. Phann S. now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Phann S. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is a fruit seller. Previously, Mrs. Phann S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
chị Hoàng thị Hường Ms 09010010 năm nay 32 tuổi, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động chăn nuôi tạo thu nhập như : chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng, vịt đẻ, ngan thịt, chăn nuôi lợn nái, lợn thịt, bán vật liệu xây dựng... Ngoài việc chăn nuôi ra, hàng ngày chồng chị còn là một chủ thầu xây dựng. Nên thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 250.000 vnđ đến 300.000 vnđ / ngày,chị đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, đồng thời chị rất thích hình thức vay, trả này. Vì nó rất phù hợp với mục đích cũng như thu nhập của gia đình chị. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà, vịt. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • anh Lê đắc Chỉnh Ms 09010007 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi.
  • anh Lê đắc Tuyên Ms 09010016 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám gà đẻ.
  • chị Lê thị Hằng Ms 09010012 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
  • chị Nguyễn thị Toán Ms 09010018 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ mua sắt vụn.( trả trong 25 tuần )
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hiền Ms 09010017 vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung mua cám lợn.( Trả trong 25 tuần )

loans.use: vốn vay chăn nuôi

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 48, is a rice farmer who lives with four children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been growing rice to earn a living and is able to make less than one dollar per day. Normally, her farm provides just enough for the family and she does not usually sell rice for extra profit as annual output is low. Farmers almost totally depend on the sky to farm, as in most of the provinces, there are no irrigation systems yet. Currently, the weather conditions are getting better, but still in some places there is only light rain. Her husband, Mao Hun, 25, works planting vegetables at home and sells at the market to earn approximately US$3 in profits per day. Besides farming, they also raise pigs. Chea S. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to purchase feed for their pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es: Doña Ruth tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos de 15,18 y 22 años de edad, dos estudian el mayor trabaja, la Sra. Ruth vende variados platillos de comida, y fritanga desde hade seis años en su casa, su mayor dificultad es en el invierno ya que donde vende la comida no hay techo y las lluvias hace que sus ventas bajen, inicio con financiamiento en afodenic  ya es su séptima solicitud y ha sido de gran beneficio para su familia ya que gracias a la oportunidad que le dio con el préstamo de invertir ha podido ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y subsistir ya que con su esposo se separo y todos los gastos lo ha tenido que cubrir ella, con esta solicitud quiere hacer unas mejoras en el techo ya que su casa es bien baja y quiere levantar el techo, va a comprar perlines entre otros materiales, y reparar una puerta para tener mejor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ruth is 46 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua, with three children who are 15,18, and 22 years old. Two of her children study and the oldest works. Señora Ruth has sold various types of food and fried snacks from her house for six years. Her major difficulty is in the winter since where she sells the food there is no ceiling and the rains cause sales to drop. She began with a loan from Afodenic and this is her seventh loan request. It has already greatly helped her family. Thanks to the opportunity she has with the loan to invest, she has been able to help her children stay in school and survive, since she and her husband have separated and all of the expenses have had to be covered by her. With this request, she wants to make improvements to the roof, since her house is very short and she wants to raise the roof. She is going to buy timber for rafters amongst other materials, and repair a door in order to have better security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro García, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en municipio de monimbo ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo Y  hijos, su esposo  trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar; ya que con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado mantener la venta de verduras desde hace seis años pero la mayor dificultad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento. Los sueños de doña Maria es darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, y mejorar el negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancia y a la vez invertir  en la compra de mas productos con esta solicitud de préstamo en Afodenic, lo cual espera sea de mucho beneficios,   para incrementen sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro García is 36 years old, and lives in the Monimbo municipality located in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to help meet the household expenses. Through her own efforts, she has managed to maintain the sale of vegetables for six years now. Her biggest difficulty has been a lack of financing. Maria’s dreams are to provide better living conditions for her children, and to improve her business to generate greater earnings. At the same time, she would like to invest in the purchase of more products. With the request for this loan in Afodenic, which she hopes is very beneficial, she will increase the quantity of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Mrs. Horm K. is a villager in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Hong Suor, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, they get little revenue to earn their living. Thus, Mrs. Horm K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a farmer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel A. is a 40-year-old married father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in a community school. Gabriel and his family live in a farming community called Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour is a forest reserve area where most popular occupation is farming. There is a very high rate of illiteracy among adults in this community, and most families are only able to provide their children with a junior high school level education; this minimal education contributes to the high unemployment rate in Ghana, which is becoming a challenge for the government.

Gabriel is a seasoned farmer, having been farming cocoa and cereals such as maize for over five years. Through this he has managed to build a two-bedroom house in the village. In addition to operating his farm, Gabriel sells grocery products in a kiosk in the community in order to generate additional income to support his business.

However, he has been having difficulties with his farm because there is a disease attacking his cocoa crops. Therefore he is applying for loan assistance to buy implements such as fertilizers, agro-chemicals and spraying machines. This will allow him to harvest more this year and in the years ahead, thereby increasing his profits so he can better support his family and his children's education.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment and chemicals

loans.name: Nakate Alisha Group

texts.en:
Alisha is 37 years of age and married with four children. She rents a one-room house in which six people live. She does care for additional family as well. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is that of feeding her family.

She sells used shoes in the market and she works six days in a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day. She has been doing this particular type of business for eight years now. The challenge she faces is that her customers are seasonal. She mainly makes big sales during festive seasons.

She has been a member of MCDT for over five years now and chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join. Most of all she wanted some capital to increase her stock and that is how she will use this loan. She also wants to construct rental apartments to improve on her income and wellbeing.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Viviana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Viviana vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Elena, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo. Además Viviana vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de otro triciclo.
Los sueños de Viviana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 30 years old and has 4 children. Viviana has a mobile stand selling ceviche in the Santa Elena market, for which she uses a three-wheeled bike. She also sells cosmetics via mail-order. Viviana needs a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of another tricycle. Viviana's dreams are to build a house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a three-wheeled bike for her business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy K., 31, is married with two young children. She lives with her husband in Sa Anng district, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$2.5 of profit every day. They grow vegetables like radishes, beans, and corn. Two of their children are students. Mrs. Thy K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can transport her vegetables to the market to sell them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get her vegetables to market

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó mediante otro comité de la misma Zona a la cual pertenece este, San Lorenzo. Todas son vendedoras de las ollas Essen que la estan vendiendo desde hace ya 3 años. 

Por mas que vendan el mismo producto todas poseen clientela formada y cada una tiene una zona especifica que explotar. Poseen buen relacionamiento entre todas.  

En la foto falta una integrante la cual se retiro antes por motivo que debia retirar las ollas para hacer entrega a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee grew from another committee in the same Zone, San Lorenzo, to which this one belongs. They are all sales women of Essen pots, which they have been selling for the last 3 years. Even though they sell the same product, the each have an established customer base and have a specific area that they cover. There is a good relationship among them all. The picture is missing a member because she had to leave to deliver pots to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans have been used to increase their capital and purchase of the products that they sell.

loans.name: Bembeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bembeya est composé de 3 monogames et d’une polygame avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier.  
Elles  font l’achat et la vente de  poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de  leur clientèle elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir bien remboursés les trois prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 171kg de poisson frais dont une partie est vendue fraîche en ambulant dans les quartiers de Kirango tandis que l’autre moitié est d’abord séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel avant d’être vendue. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson frais uniquement sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec leurs maris qui sont des  pêcheurs connus dans les zones de pêche de Kirango. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Dougabougou et Siribala à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’épargne et l’augmentation de leur fonds de commerce.
Elles ont pour ambition d’entreprendre le petit élevage et acheter un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver  plus longtemps le poisson frais et vendre  également de la glace.
texts.en:
The group Bembeya is composed of three monogamous women and one polygamous woman who average 32 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in the Djaka Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community and membership in the same traditional women's association in the area. The group members buy and sell fish in all forms (fresh, fried, smoked, and dried). Concerned about satisfying their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. After having repaid the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth solidarity loan. This new loan will be used to buy 171 kg of fresh fish, a portion of which is sold fresh door-to-door in the Kirango area, while the the other portion is first dried in a corner of the house using a traditional dryer and then sold. Supplies of fresh fish are gotten only on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango from their husbands who are recognized fishermen in fishing zones of Kirango. The fish thus obtained is resold, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Dougabougou, and Siribala, to customers composed mostly of women. The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to augment their working capital. Their ambition is to embark on small-scale livestock farming, to buy a freezer in order to preserve fresh fish for longer, and also to sell ice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati U. sells provisions such as Milo, sugar, canned fish, and other good provisions in Abura. Fati has a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver whose income is too low to support the family. Fati has been selling provisions for four years. She is responsible for feeding the children and clothing the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty years old and the married mother of three children – all sons. She says they are all in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Mavis is a hardworking woman. She works to support her husband financially. Her husband is a farmer while she trades.

Mavis sells drinks made form Milo (a milk beverage) and other provisions. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell the iced cocoa drinks with bread in her community and also treks to other markets to sell. Mavis buys groceries such as Milo, sugar, milk, etc. to make the beverage.

Mavis has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong R. (pictured with his wife) is 26 years old and owns a trailer-motorbike. He uses it to run a taxi. He normally picks up passers-by, tourists, and merchandise for a profit. 

His wife has had a job as a poultry seller. They have been married for years but have no children. 

Kong R.'s existing taxi is a small width so he can transport a few people only. He hopes to replace this taxi by using a Kiva loan to purchase a new one. This will help him to increase his income and better meet his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To replace his existing taxi.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une infirmière, afin d’aider les personnes disposant de peu de moyens à pouvoir se soigner en ayant accès aux médicaments, elle a entamé la vente de produits génériques. Elle arrive ainsi à aider beaucoup de monde. Le stock de produits génériques dont elle dispose étant en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de produits comprimés, des produits sirops, des  injectables et divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
This woman is a nurse. She started selling generic drugs in order to help people with little means look after themselves by having access to medication. She thus manages to help a lot of people. Since her stock is low, she is requesting a loan through WAGES to purchase four boxes of tablets, syrups, injectables and various generic pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Esna Nicida

texts.en:
