Nicida is 42 years old and is married with two children. She has a business selling vegetables and other grocery items at the Bellavista Market, a massive, chaotic marketplace near the center of the city of Pucallpa, where she and her family live. Nicida also sells french fries, hot dogs and fried chicken from a cart in front of her home in the evenings.  Nicida’s husband is an entrepreneur with an independent business.

Nicida has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  She plans to invest this loan of 3,000 soles in purchasing vegetables, olives, oil, pasta and other products for sale.  

Nicida’s goal is to have a good amount of capital in order to expand her evening food sales business.

loans.use: To purchase food products to sell at the market

loans.name: Jany

texts.es:
Jany  es una mujer extrovertida y muy colaboradora, ella tiene 23 años de edad,es soltera, estudia educación para nivel inicial; también se dedica a la costura, trabaja junto a  su tía en la confección de hamacas, hace flores y bisutería. Ella vive con sus padres  y les ayuda en los gastos familiares. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas”, donde forma parte hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo utilizó para solventar gastos del hogar, sus estudios y en la compra de materiales para confeccionar hamacas. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500, comprará telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas. La meta  de Jany tener sus propias máquinas para poder confeccionar las hamacas y poder exportar y también tener un local propio.

loans.use: Invertirá en telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra es una mujer jovial y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 22 años y es madre de una pequeña de un añito, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, paralelamente vende ropa de segundo uso, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocarro(propio). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas, ahora necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado para invertir en golosinas. La meta de Mayra es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Mayra is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the province of Coronel Portillo. She is 22 years old and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. She has a business selling snacks, and she also sells used clothing. She enjoys full support from her husband, who works as a driver with his own car. She has been a member of the "Jesus of Nazareth" Communal Bank for four years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested it in soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be invested in snacks for her business. Mayra's goal for the future is to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in snacks for her business

loans.name: Chakiratou-Laï

texts.fr: A. Chakiratou-Laï est née le 07 août 1982 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Célibataire avec deux enfants dont un à sa charge,  Chakiratou-Laï vit seule avec eux au quartier Midombo, à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Chakiratou-Laï a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire et tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Chakiratou-Laï est spécialisée dans la vente de cartes de recharges téléphonique de tous les réseaux du Bénin depuis près de quatre ans. Chakiratou-Laï achète ces recharges auprès des distributeurs et les vend à Midombo et à Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Pendant la période de la rentrée, Chakiratou-Laï vend également des fournitures scolaires qu’elle achète chez les papeteries modernes. Chakiratou-Laï a obtenu déjà cinq crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Dans l’optique de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse de la clientèle en cette période de rentrée des classes et accroître ses parts de marché, Chakiratou-Laï sollicite un sixième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Chakiratou-Laï A. was born on 7 August 1982 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Unmarried with two children in her care, Chakiratou-Laï lives alone with her children in the Midombo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chakiratou-Laï attended school up to the secondary level, and all of her children are in school. For about four years, Chakiratou-Laï has specialized in the sale of rechargeable phone cards for all of Benin's telephone networks. Chakiratou-Laï buys these cards from distributors and sells them in Midombo and Sainte Rita in Cotonou. During the time when the school year restarts, Chakiratou-Laï also sells school supplies, which she buys from modern stationery stores. Chakiratou-Laï has already obtained five loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which she repaid properly. With the goal of better satisfying the numerous demands of her customers during the start of the school year and increasing her market share, Chakiratou-Laï is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell school supplies

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is a taxi driver. He earns about 50 – 60 soles each day. He owns his own car and will use this loan to repair his vehicle.

Abelardo is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two children. He is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. He is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Abelardo appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his car

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven Brenda Elizabeth V. C. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive con su madre y estudia enfermeria los fines de semana.
Es comerciante individual, vende ropa de cama, ropa para damas y caballeros y sandalias, necesita un prestamo para la compra de ropa y sandalias para tener suficiente producto en navidad.
con las genancias que ella saca son para ayudarle a su mama en el hogar con alimentos y pagos de servcios publicos, tambien ocupa el dinero para sus estudios.
su meta es poder graduarse y ser una enfermera profesional.
texts.en:
Brenda Elizabeth V. C., 23, is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and is studying nursing on weekends. She is an independent merchant; she sells bed linens, ladies' and mens' clothing, and sandals. She needs financing to buy clothing and sandals to have enough stock available for the Christmas season. The profits she makes are used to help her mother with household expenses, like food and utilities, and she also needs the money to pay for her schooling. Her goal is to graduate and become a professional nurse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens, dress shirts, blouses, underwear, shoes.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie S. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merlie owns and operates a business making and selling food, making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre emprendedor de 35 años, vive con su esposa (Jenny), que tiene 28 años, y con su pequeño e inquieto niño, Josué de 6 años, en su amplia casa que es propia y que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.

En su juventud estudió agropecuaria, ya que siempre vivió rodeado de plantaciones en la selva, eso lo inspiró desde muy pequeño y así escogió estudiar esa profesión. Después de terminar su carrera volvió a su tierra a practicar todo lo aprendido; desde entonces han pasado varios años y ahora se dedica a brindar asesoramiento técnico en el campo a diferentes agricultores.
A su vez, también siembra café, plátanos y maíz en sus propias tierras, para estas labores cuenta con la ayuda del personal que contrata, además le gusta el trabajo de asesor, ya que puede ejercer su profesión en la zona donde nació y creció. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, además de las ganancias que le brinda la producción en su chacra, para el futuro tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos para sembrar y para revenderlos a mejor precio después de darles mantenimiento.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que será puntual con cada pago porque quiere seguir progresando y sabe que esto sólo lo alcanzará con honestidad. Ya tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en abono para sus tierras y también para el pago del personal que contrata para el mantenimiento de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising 35-year-old man. He lives with his wife (Jenny), who is 28 years old, and with their small and restless child, Josué, who is 6. They live in a large house, which they own and and were able to build with a great deal of effort.

He studied farming in his youth, since he was always surrounded by plantations in the jungle. This inspired him at a very young age and that is how he chose to study that profession. After finishing his studies, he returned to his land to practice everything that he had learned. Since then, several years have passed and he now provides technical advice to different farmers in the countryside. At the same time, he also plants coffee, bananas and corn on his own lands so he also has the help of the workers that he hires. In addition, he likes working as a consultant so that he can practice his profession in the area where he was born and raised. This work is very profitable, in addition to the earnings from his small farm. In future, he plans to acquire more lands to cultivate and to resell them at a better price after doing maintenance.

This is Rodrigo's first loan with MFP and he is certain that he will be punctual with each payment because he wants to continue making process and he knows that he can only achieve this with honesty. He already plans to invest the money from the loan in fertilizer for his lands, and also for the payment of the staff that he hires to maintain his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh D. lives with his wife and two daughters in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His two daughters, aged 17 and 19, live and study in university in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He operates a photo studio called "Mongol Photo." In his studio, customers have the chance to dress up in Mongolian traditional clothes while having their photos taken. He started his business in 2008 with a loan of 3,700,000 tugrugs (~2,595 USD) from XacBank, a Field Partner of Kiva, and has worked hard to build a stable operation. Gansuh has used his earnings to support his family and afford his two daughters' education. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Leonor del Carmen López Hernández, Labora como Supervisora Técnica de Computación en el Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua, ella tiene un  hijos a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  ella es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para reparar parte del techo de su casa de habitación por lo que el anterior se encontraba en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Leonor dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leonor del Carmen López Hernández works as a Technical Supervisor of Computing at the Manuel Olivares Institute in Managua. She has school-age children and is married. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for the past year and in this time period she has invested the loans in improving her housing, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. She is an excellent client. The loan she is requesting is to invest in buying construction materials such as zinc and metallic pieces to repair part of the roof of her house, which has been in bad condition. This will provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. Leonor said thank you for the financing from CEPRODEL which has enabled her to improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her housing and addition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell spare parts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven entusiasta y muy trabajador de 30 años, vive con su pareja, Flor de 27 años, y sus 2 hijos: Leonel de 4 y Nahomi de 1 año. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el pueblo de Huaylahuichan en la ciudad de Tarma.

Desde hace 15 años, junto a su esposa, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja, con sus ganancias lograron compraron terrenos donde sembraron gran cantidad de maíz como vemos en la foto. Además están ahorrando para que no les falte nada a sus hijos en el futuro ni ahora. Mientras su esposa se encarga de contratar operarios para que limpien y cuiden sus sembríos, él y su hermano, viajan a vender choclo en un mercado de la ciudad de Lima. 
Dentro de sus actividades agrícolas lo que a veces lo desalienta es que los productos, por temporadas, pierden su valor y cuestan menos, sin embargo asegura que no pierde, pues siempre le quedan ganancias.
Para su futuro anhela tener su propio vehículo para trasladar sus productos a la capital y dejar de pagar el transporte; también quiere trabajar independientemente de su hermano para obtener mayores utilidades.

Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y considera que desde que accedió a los créditos y es parte de un banco comunal está progresando mucho, por lo que ya no quiere parar su ritmo de labor diaria. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de choclos.
texts.en:
Juan is an enthusiastic and hardworking young man; he is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Flor (27) and their two children: Leonel (4) and Nahomi (1). His house is located in the town of Huaylahuichan, in the city of Tarma. For the last 15 years, along with his wife, Leonel has been planting potatoes, corn, and peas. With their earnings, Leonel and Flor have been able to buy two pieces of land where they have planted lots of corn (as we see in the picture). In addition, they are saving so that their kids will want for nothing, neither now, nor in the future. While his wife is in charge of hiring farm hands who clean and take care of their crops, Leonel and his brother travel to sell the corn at a market in Lima. In his activities, Leonel is disappointed that sometimes, products lose some of their value according to the season; however, he assures us he doesn't lose anything, as he always makes a profit. In the future, Leonel would like to have his own vehicle to transport his products to the capital city and in that way, stop paying for transportation. He'd also like to work independently of his brother in order to increase his earnings. This is the 8th loan Leonel is receiving from Kiva partner MFP and he believes that since requesting credit and becoming a part of a communal bank, he has gotten ahead quite a bit and does not want to stop his daily work rhythm. He will use the loan proceeds to invest in his corn business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his corn business

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores G. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Francisco goteras, ubicado en el departamento Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y una nieta de 8 años de edad, la cual está a cargo por completo de María. Ella posee una venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, así mismo vende zapatos. Ella comercializa sus productos desde su casa y así mismo los vende de forma ambulante entre sus vecinos, y personas de otras colonias. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa en diferentes estilos y colores, de manera que pueda obtener mayor clientela, así mismo comprar más zapatos. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de ver prosperar su negocio y así mismo su economía familiar, ya que su esposo es empleado de una empresa privada pero a pesar de esto sus ganancias en muchas ocasiones no dan abasto con todo los gastos, razón por la que María ha decidido solicitar el préstamo a Integral, con la esperanza de poder mejorar su negocio y solventar todo lo que a su esposo se le dificulta. A pesar que María cuenta con una familia pequeña, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza día con día por tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores Garcia, 47 years old, lives in the outskirts of the town of San Francisco, which is located in the Morazán area. She lives with her husband and 8-year-old granddaughter, for whom Maria is completely responsible. She sells clothing for children, women, and men and also sells shoes. She sells her products from her house and also sells them as walking vendor among her neighbors and people from other towns. She is seeking a loan through which she can buy more clothing in different styles and colors; in this way she can acquire a bigger clientele, and she will also buy more shoes. She does all this with the desire to see her business and also her family economy prosper, since her husband is an employee of a private business, but in spite of this, his earnings often aren't enough to cover all the expenses. For this reason, Maria has decided to apply for a loan at Integral, with the hope of being able to improve her business and pay for everything that is difficult for her husband. In spite of the fact that Maria has a small family, she is a very hardworking woman who tries hard every day to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Helping Hands Group

texts.en:
Wilson K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Helping Hands. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 4, 8, 10 and 14. In addition to his wife and children, Wilson cares for one sibling.
For two years, Wilson has been selling charcoal at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, near Monrovia. He says he sells coal that is dried and ready for burning, which keeps customers returning. Wilson plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal. His goal is to expand his business to other areas of Paynesville.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Wilson is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Action Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Action Group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesspeople who have applied for a loan of 500,000 leones each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can buy more goods to add to their businesses and make more sales and profit. Consequently, these entrepreneurs will be able to improve their living conditions including paying school fees for their children and feeding and clothing them.

The leader of the group is Alie K.. Alie is 50 years old. He was born in Kambia, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are attending secondary school and two are in primary school. Alie is a welder. He has been in this profession for many years now. He will use his share of the loan to buy working materials like rods, etc.

loans.use: Buy working materials like rods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to the stock of cereals in his wife's business

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay R. is a 47-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. She has five children, four of whom live with her. The other one is now married and lives away from the family home. To help feed the family, three of her children are employed at different jobs. She grows rice and some vegetables to earn a living. Svay R. will use her loan to better supply her farm by buying more fertilizer and seeds for her growing facilities.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. She trades in soft drinks at Abura and assists her husband in taking care of her children. She has not received any form of education. Her husband works in forestry at Kakum Forest.

Ama is asking for the loan to buy more soft drinks in greater variety to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks in greater variety to sell

loans.name: Soulayman

texts.en:
Soulayman is a 33 year old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and their child. He has owned a restaurant in his town since 1998. He serves all types of sandwiches. Soulayman is well known in his region for his delicious food. He opened his restaurant because he wanted to have independent work and because he had experience in this domain.  Soulayman is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase merchandise to improve his restaurant. He wants to offer  narguileh (also known as “shisha” in Egypt, or Hubble bubble). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. A narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries. Soulayman also wants to purchase new chairs so that his clients can feel more comfortable, as well as do some maintenance work in his restaurant.
Soulayman's clients are his friends and neighbors. He says that he is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is very welcoming. This is the first time Soulayman has requested a loan. He hopes to improve his business by attracting more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to improve his restaurant.

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid A. is a 40-year-old merchant who sells different kinds of food products in the small village of Saatli. Javid is married and has 2 daughters. He sells candies, cookies, tea, chicken, and juices. Javid applied for a 900 AZN loan to purchase more products to sell to increase his income from 150 AZN to 400 AZN. He believes one day he could have his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase childrens' clothing and other childrens' items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan B. de 68 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Catalina Tapari de 53 años de edad, tienen varios hijos, todos son ya mayores de edad.
   Don Juan comenzó con este rubro aproximadamente en el año 1.993; con el capital que  recibieron por la venta de un terreno, con el cual abrieron las puertas de su despensa y copetín para la comunidad, en la actualidad en su negocio ya tiene  su clientela formada.
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (Fideos, arroz, gaseosas, vinos, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.) para tener más variedades de cosas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan B., age 68, is married to 53 year old Catalina Tapari. They have several children, and all of them are adults. Juan started his business in approximately 1993. He used the money he received from selling a piece of land, and he opened the doors of his general store and snack bar to the community. He now has a regular customer base. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, wine, sugar, oil, and milk, etc.). He will do this to have a greater variety of things and to satisfy his customers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, wine, sugar, oil, and milk, etc.)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de 2 de sus 3 hijos, porque el mayor trabaja en la ciudad, y juntos habitan en un tranquilo paraje de la sierra peruana. Desde que era muy joven observaba a los miembros de su comunidad como trabajaban en la tierra, y así aprendió a cultivar. En la actualidad siembra arvejas, maíz y papa, para realizar esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, que trabajan esforzadamente la tierra cuando no estudian. Dice que el trabajo de campo es algo tedioso, y que los resultados se aprecian cuando empieza la temporada de cosecha, pero que las ganancias son regulares ya que toda su producción la vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que saben de la calidad de sus productos naturales, y llegan a comprarle toda su producción. Además le gusta mucho vigilar y cuidar bien sus campos para obtener una fructífera cosecha; y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad , sobretodo papa y arveja, para obtener mayores ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con cada una de sus cuotas, además dice que le gusta el trabajo organizado de su grupo comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y semilla de arveja para mejorar la calidad de su producción y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Juana, age 54, lives in her own house with two of her three children. Her oldest child lives in the city. They live together in a peaceful spot on the Peruvian mountain range. When she was very young she observed how the members of the community worked on the land. That was how she learned to work the land for growing crops. She currently plants peas, corn, and potatoes. Her children help her with this work. They put great effort into their work when they are not studying. She says that the fieldwork is somewhat tedious. But, she appreciates it when the harvest season starts. She has a steady income because she sells all of her production to the wholesale merchants. They know the quality of her natural products, and they come to buy all of her production. Also, she really likes keeping an eye on her crops and taking care of them in order to get a fruitful harvest. As a very enterprising woman, she plans to plant in greater quantity in the future. She will plant potatoes and peas most of all in order to get greater earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She pledges to make each one of her payments on time. Also, she says that she likes the organized work of her communal bank. All of the members are very responsible. Juana plans to use the requested loan to buy fertilizer and pea seeds to improve the quality of her production. That way she hopes to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pea seeds

loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar A. 42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey,doch kotoroy 18 let ona v etom qodu postupila v universitet i takje ona lubit zanimatsya tancami, sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole  i zanimayetsya sportom.
Azar i eqo semya jivut v qorode Baku. 

Azar uje 7 let zanimayetsya biznessom taxi. Etomu biznessu eqo nauchil dedushka kotoriy bil toje taxistom. Seychas Azar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  zapchasti dlya svoyeqo taxi.
texts.en:
Azar A. is forty-two years old, married and lives in the city of Baku. He has a son and a daughter. His daughter is eighteen, likes to dance and has just started going to college this year. His son, who is fifteen, is still attending school and enjoys playing sports. Azar has been a taxi driver for seven years, a trade which he learned from his grandfather. Azar is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy some spare parts for his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for taxi

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mr. Pon P. is 29 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  Pon is away from home often to work from building site to building site around the city.  By doing this, he is able to make $4 a day to help with his family's financial crisis.  In additional to his construction job, Pon owns a cart that he uses to sell sugar cane juice. He has a wife who sews clothes in a garment factory.  Pon has been constructing his own house for a long time, but the building process is never completed due to the lack of funds. Because of this, Pon is applying for a loan in order to continue building his house.

loans.use: To continue building his house

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Rosita del Ocho porque en donD. habitan lo nombran como barrio ocho y lo D. rositas porque dicen es la planta que más le gusta a las mujeres, en este caso a cada una del grupo. Está ubicado Ixtlahuaca D. Rayón México, es un lugar donD. las personas buscan alcanzar sus objetivos aprovechando las oportunidades que les ofrecen.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

 Una D. las integrantes del grupo se llama Epifanía S. Domínguez. Tiene 48 años solo estudió la primaria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la baja economía que tenían sus padres en ese tiempo y tenían que ver por toda la familia causa que no le permitió seguir sus estudios, se dedica a la cría y engorda D. puercos, es casada y tiene 1 hijo D. 20 años que sigue estudiando, día a día busca la manera D. ayudar a su esposo y así cubrir  cada una D. sus necesidades. Epifanía comercializa su ganado en Ixtlahuaca, inició desD. hace 7 años el negocio buscando que fuera una fuente D. ingreso que ayudara a su economía familiar, le ha gustado criar a sus animales y más a un le da un gran gusto porque sabe que con ello ayudará a que los estudios D. su hijo se realicen. 

Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta porque tiene la oportunidad D. comprar alimento para seguir engordando sus puercos y así poder venderlos en una cantidad más alta. También espera que con el préstamo empiece a crecer su negocio y se construya a futuro un corral más granD..
texts.en:
This group is called Rositas del Ocho because they come from from the neighborhood "Ocho" and roses are the ladies' favorite plant. They're located in Ixtlahuaca D. Rayón Mexico. It's a place where people go to reach their objectives by making use of the opportunities offered to them. This group consists of 11 members. 

One of the members is Epifanía S. Domínguez. She's 48-years-old and she only studied through elementary school. She says that she was unfortunately not able to continue studying because of the bad economy that her parents experienced at the time and they had to count on the whole family. She raises hogs. She's married and has a 20-year-old son who continues to study. Each day she looks for a way to help her husband and cover her basic expenses. Epifanía sells her livestock in Ixtlahuaca. She began this business 7 years ago hoping that it would be an additional source of income that would help her family's finances. She's liked raising her animals because she knows that the income helps her son stay in school. 

At this moment she feels very happy because she has the opportunity to buy supplies to continue fattening her hogs and sell them for a higher price. She also hopes that with the loan she will begin to grow her business and eventually build a bigger corral.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase several dozen shirts and pants for resale.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “Kantu de San Jeronimo” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal esta en el sexro ciclo aproximadamente 2 años de trabajo y la junta directiva está conformada por el señor David que es el presidente, la señora Maribel que es la secretaria, el señor Fausto que es tesorero y la señora Silvia que es la fiscal.    

Algunos de nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de celulares, venta de comestibles y otros socios brindas servicios como por ejemplo; arreglo de carros, fabricación de muebles metálicos, enseñanza, transporte de pasajeros y guía de turismo. 
     
La socia Maribel tiene 34 años y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus dos hijos y su esposo y después se dedica exclusivamente a sus negocios. Maribel tiene una cabina de internet y un locutorio en su domicilio, ella también se dedica a la venta de celulares, a brinda servicio de llamadas y a la venta de productos nutricionales. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Mónica requiere el préstamo para hacer  mantenimiento de la cabina de internet. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Kantu de San Jeronimo communal bank and live in Cuzco. The communal bank is in its 6th cycle, approximately 2 years of work, and the board of directors is composed of David, the President, Maribel,  the Secretary, Fausto, the treasurer, and Silvia the auditor. 

Some of the members alternate their various activities at home with the sale of cellular phones and food, while other members offer services, for example, car repair, furniture making, teaching, transportation and tourism guides.

Maribel is 34 years old, and wakes up very early to tend to her two children and her husband. After that she is dedicated solely to her business. Maribel has an internet stand and phone booth in her home. She also sells cellular phones, offers a calling service, and sells food. She has been working at this business for several years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Maribel needs a loan to maintain her internet stand.
     
The members value and appreciate the loans received through this service, and are also committed to making their payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain the internet stand.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las trabajadoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita en fecha 18 de mayo de 2009,gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lourdes G.,  quien se contactó con la asesora y actualmente se encuentran dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
La presidenta del grupo es justamente la Sra.  Lourdes Giménez, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es la encargada de dirigir al grupo de manera a que todas cumplan a cabalidad como integrantes del comité, tanto para el pago como así también en cuanto a la disciplina que debe regir dentro del mismo. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sus mercaderías como remeras, shorts, blusas, vestidos, cosméticos.
texts.en:
This great group of women is called "Las Trabajadoras" which translates to "The Workers". The group was formed in the town of Ita on May 18, 2009 thanks to the current Director General Ms. Lourdes G. who contacted the consultant. The group is currently in the program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. The group is made up of 21 women who have worked very comfortably and are already in their 4th loan cycle, jointly and severally.
The president of the group is justly Ms. Lourdes G., who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for 2 years. She is married and has two children. She is responsible for leading the group so that everyone complies fully as members of the committee both in making payments as well as the discipline that should govern the committee.
She is requesting a loan to purchase their merchandise such as T-shirts, shorts, blouses, dresses and cosmetics.

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts and cosmetics.

loans.name: G.s. El Rosario Group

texts.es: El señor Manuel de Jesús tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad de 20 y 23 años de edad. El señor es propietario de un negocio de venta de medicina natural, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante. El señor ya tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó como una necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos debido a la falta de empleo. El señor solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de medicamentos naturales para surtir el negocio y poder vender más al ofertar más variedad de productos.  Otro integrante del grupo es Don Herman Francisco, el cual tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos. El señor se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y al destace de cerdo, actividad que realiza desde su casa de habitación. Aduce el señor, que algo que afecta actualmente es la falta de financiamiento para las pequeñas empresas. Cabe señalarse, el señor inicio este negocio debido a la falta de empleo, por lo que se vio obligado a establecer su propio negocio para sobrevivir. El desea invertir este crédito en la compra de insumos para elaborar los nacatamales ya que los precios de estos cada día están más caros, afectando de esta manera el precio de los productos.  La señora Lucia Del Rosario también pertenece al grupo, la cual  tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. La señora se dedica al destace de cerdos y a la elaboración de nacatamales, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante y también desde su casa de habitación. Ella ya tiene 5 años de estarse dedicando a este negocio, el cual surgió en la búsqueda de ingresos para la familia, ya que el ingreso de su esposo no llenaba las necesidades de la familia. Doña María pertenece al grupo El Rosario, la cual  tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tacos, enchiladas y fritangas en general, además de esto también elabora almuerzos típicos y comidas por encargos. Ella es muy reconocida en su municipio. Otra integrante del grupo es doña Alba Maritza la cual tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad la cual está estudiando en primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, cuenta con clientela ya establecida ya que tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. En principio ella decidió poner el negocio debido a la falta de empleo, lo cual la obligo a buscar una alternativa para mantener a su hija. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería nueva para aprovechar las ventas de la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel de Jesús is 46 years old, is married and has two grown children of 20 and 23 years of age.  He is the owner of a business selling natural remedies, which he distributes as a street vendor.  He has been doing this for 10 years and started the business because lack of employment.  He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of natural remedies to be able to stock his business and increase his sales due to having more variety in his products.  
Another member of the group is Don Herman Francisco, who is 23 years old, single and has no children.  He makes a living selling nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetables in banana or corn leaves) and butchering pigs, which he does from his home.  He states that the lack of small business financing is having a negative effect.  He started this business because of a lack of work and his need to survive.  He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of supplies to make nacatamales, since the prices of these are higher every day and affect the price of his products.
Mrs. Lucia Del Rosario also belongs to the group, she is 24 years old, married and has two children of 8 and 10 years of age.  She makes a living butchering pigs and making nacatamales, which she sells as a street vendor and also from her home.  She has been in this business for 5 years, which started as a need for a source of income for her family, because her husband's income did not cover the costs of their basic needs.  
Doña María  belongs to the group El Rosario.  She is 50 years old, married and has two children of 13 and 25 years of age.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  She makes a living by making tacos, enchiladas and fritangas and also makes typical lunches and food for orders.  She is very well know in her area.
Another member of the group is Mrs. Alba Maritza, 31 years old, married and has a 7 year old daughter in elementary school.  She sells new clothing as a street vendor.  She has established customers because she has been in this business for 4 years.  At the beginning she decided to start this business because of the lack of employment which caused her to look for alternative ways to support her daughter.  She request this loan for the purchase of new merchandise to be able to take advantage of the sales during the Christmas season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia   está  casada,  tiene una pequeña Panadería  en el km 7_ Villa Fanny ,  el trabajo de la  misma es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda de su esposo  están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la panadería especial para harina de trigo.
texts.en:
Amalia is married and has a small bakery at Km. 7, Villa Fanny.  Her work is very gratifying because she has quite a few customers and income is quite satisfactory.

With her husband’s help they are getting ahead with will, work and dedication.  Today, she has become a successful micro businesswoman who is constantly making progress.

She is very committed to her responsibilities so deserves the proper support to continue growing.

She is asking for funds to buy raw materials for the bakery, especially wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Flores De Dolores Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Flores de Dolores. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Dolores Hidalgo, en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.Paulina M. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 44 años, estudió hasta el 6° año de primaria, es comerciante, tiene en total 4 hijos; 2 mujeres y 2 hombres. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de rebozos, negocio que inicio hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar rebozos. Ella vende sus rebozos en los municipios aledaños a su comunidad, menciona que el producto que vende es parte de la vestimenta tipica de la región donde vive y sus alrededores.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz porque tiene capital para poder invertir en su negocio. Quiere este crédito para comprar rebozos y tener surtido su negocio. Al momento de capturar la fotografía la señora Adela García se agacho, pero salen todas las integrantes.
texts.en:
This group is called Flores de Dolores (Dolores’s Flowers). It is located in the community of Dolores Hidalgo in the state of Mexico. There are 12 people in the group. 44-year old Paulina M. is one of them. She completed sixth grade of primary school, is a businesswoman, and has four children, two girls and two boys. 

Paulina earns her living buying and selling shawls, a job she’s been doing for eight years. She is seeking a loan to buy more shawls which she sells in the nearby towns. The shawls are part of the traditional dress worn by local women. 

Paulina is happy right now because she has the money to invest in her business. The loan will be used to buy more shawls so her store is well-stocked. At the moment of taking the photograph, Sra. Adela García bent down, but all the group members appear.

loans.use: to buy shawls

loans.name: Mariana Marina

texts.es:
La señora Mariana es de 45 añlos de edad, actualmente su estado civil es divorciada, tuvo 4 hijos de los cuales uno esta estudiando la escuela de nivel medio superior, ella tien una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, en el cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, inicio esta actividad a partir de la separacion con su esposo y esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos.
Mariana solicito unprestamo de dinero para la compra de mas productos para su tienda, con ese dinero que le prestaron pudo comprar arroz, frijol, chiles enlatados, azucar, sardina enlatada, sal, pasta para preparar sopa, huevos, jabon, leche, galletas entre otros productos de primera necesidad, con la adquisicion de mas mercancia ella garantiza tener mas ventas, mas ganacias y poder cubrir su credito en tiempo y forma.
Ella nos comparte de su vivencia , nos comenta que la principio fue muy dificil superar su separacion, principalmente por sus hijos, ademas los gastos de cada uno de ellos tendrian que ser suplidos or alguien, su pequeño negocio le ha permitido tener el, recurso necesario para comer y cubrir las necesidads prioritarias.
Uno de sus sueños y esperanzas que tenia Mariana es el de sacar a sus hijos adelante y esa esperanza ya la pudo cubrir, y demuestra una vez mas la gran virtud de las mujeres que son muy entregadas a sus sueños y anhelos.
Ella ahora desea mirar triunfar a sus hijos que puedan salir adelante y puedan ser personas dignas de si mismos, ella quisiera mejorar mas su negocio, hacer que sus ventas crescan y que nunca le falte mercancia para su tiendita.
Mariana al igual que muchos cree en los sueños, en la bondad y genorosidad de muchos, desd aqui quiere hacer llegar un mensaje para la mujeres, que luchen por sus sueños y que trabajen en sus ilusiones, agradece a fundaion relidad y a kiva por ser los medios para cumplir los sueños y esperanza de muchsa mujeres necesitadas.
texts.en:
Mariana is 45 years old. She is divorced and has 4 children, of whom one is studying in high school. She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells items of basic necessity. She began this business when she separated from her husband and this has allowed her to provide for her 4 children.

Mariana requested a loan to buy more products for her store. With the money she was lent she was able to buy rice, beans, canned chiles, sugar, canned sardines, salt, pastas for soups, eggs, soap, milk, and cookies, among others. By getting more merchandise, she is sure to have more sales and more earnings and be able to pay back her loan on time.

She explained to us that the experience of separating from her husband was very difficult to overcome at first, especially for her children. Additionally, the expenses for each of them had to be paid by someone. Her small business has allowed her to have the necessary resources to eat and cover other priority expenses.

One of Mariana’s dreams and hopes was to help her children get ahead, and she is already able to meet this goal. She exemplifies that great virtue of women who work hard for their dreams and hopes.

She now hopes to see her children be successful, get ahead in life, and lead dignified lives. She would like to improve her business, grow her sales, and always have merchandise in her store. 

Mariana, like many who believe in dreams and in the goodness and generosity of people, would like to send a message to women—that they should fight for their dreams and work hard toward their goals. She is grateful to the Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for being the ways in which many women in need can achieve their dreams and hopes.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, canned chiles, sugar, canned sardines, salt, pastas for soups, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mónica Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica S. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive en la comunidad de Castilla Cruz que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Mónica se dedica al estilismo actividad que ejerce hace 13 años, tiene un local en su propia casa y también labora a domicilio, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin tener un horario fijo, hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  que vende en su propio local.

La Señora. Mónica tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano y trabaja en la elaboración de (cielos rasos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yanbal y materia prima para su gabinete. Su meta es  agrandar su negocio y poner unas cabinas telefónicas e Internet por su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Monica S. is a member of the communal bank named Primero de Enero (meaning First of January). She lives in the community of Castilla Cruz, belonging to the Del Valle district. This district is known for its beautiful scenery. The population is made up of merchants, livestock farmers, and agriculturists.

Monica has been a stylist for the past 13 years. She has her business set up in her house. She works form Monday to Saturday without a fixed work schedule. For the past 14 years she has also sold cosmetics from her own stand.

Monica is 35 years old, married, and she is the mother of 2 children, aged 16 and 3. Her eldest daughter attends high school in the city. Her husband is an artisan and he installs ceilings.   With their combined work they have managed to build their own house. 

She is on her second loan and the funds from this loan will be used to invest in the purchase of Yanbal brand products and products for her business. Her goal is to increase her business and to set up other public telephone services and internet access in her area.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Proceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin,  Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 53 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella. 

Carmela, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulatoria de costalillos por las diferentes calles de la ciudad. Ahora, con mucho esfuerzo deseo de superación, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, donde todos los fines de semana, vende en un Centro Turistico – Villa San Gabriel. Lo inicio por ella misma y porque le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Hoy en día se siente muy contenta y tranquila, con el trabajo y negocioque realiza. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así de esta satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Se siente muy feliz con lo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank 'Los Proceres' in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martin. She is 53 years old, single and has one son who is her dependent.

Carmela used to sell bags throughout the streets of the city. With a lot of hard work and desire to progress she now sells sweets/snacks in the tourist center Villa San Gabriel on the weekends. She started this on her own because she likes to be in contact with people. It allows her to generate income and to grow as a human being and a woman. She is very satisfied and at ease with her work and the business she has.

She will buy sweets like chocolates, lollipops, gum, candies of different flavors and brands with the loan of 1.000 Nuevos Soles to better serve and satisfy her costumers.

 Mrs. Carmela is happy with what she is doing and believes that her hard work is valuable since it helps her to realize her dreams and goals in life. She appreciates the assistance given by 'Movimiento Manuela Ramos' to her and other women who wish to prosper.

loans.use: To buy sweets/snacks to increase her stock at hand

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya Hambarcumyan is from the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married, and is the proud mother of five children—three daughters (four, six and ten years old) and two sons (15 and 16 years old). Ofelya has a medical condition but is still able to raise her children and work on the family farm. For the past 16 years she has been raising cattle and growing vegetables. She would like a loan to purchase seed potatoes, fuel, and fertilizer. According to her business plan, she expects the family income to increase by 20 percent. She enjoys living in Vahramaberd, as she has good relationships with all of its residents. Ofelya’s wish is for all of her children to receive a college education.

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes, fuel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria was born in 1952 and is now widowed. She has lived in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital, for the last 30 years. She received no education and raised four children, who have all received an education.

This is Maria's fifth loan through ALIDe, and she has a strong credit history. She hopes to purchase more ingredients to make doughnuts and chips, which has been her business for 25 years. Maria hopes to build her own home for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchasing wheat and beans to make doughnuts and chips

loans.name: Mikailu M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Faith in Christ School. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 6,300,000 SLL in order to solve their financial problems or invest in a business. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Mikailu M. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Rogbin village and he is 37 years old. Mikailu has been in the teaching profession for more than eight years. Mikailu has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 SLL from Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Gannina Del Rosio

texts.es: Gannina tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en la casa de sus suegros en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Desde hace 2 años, brinda el servicio de internet a sus vecinos. Cuenta con unas cabinas con computadoras las cuales están ubicadas en su domicilio. Gannina es muy conocida en su localidad y cuenta con una clienta ya establecida. Desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de dos más computadores. También desea utilizar una parte de su préstamo para comprar útiles escolares los cuales pretende vender a sus clientes ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, Gannina podrá incrementar sus ganancias y apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Es muy trabajadora y responsable y posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana.
texts.en:
Gannina is 29 years old.  She is married, has a son, and lives with her family at her in-laws’ house in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone with lots of commerce.  It’s located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour from Chiclayo.  For the past two years she’s been providing Internet service to her neighbors.  She has some computers in her home.

Gannina is very well known in her area, has established customers, and would like to buy two computers so that she can grow her business.  She also wants to use part of the money from this loan to buy school supplies to resell to her customers, now that the school year has begun in Peru.  She has seen fit to request this loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  This investment will allow Gannina to increase her income and help her husband with the financial support of the family.  She is hard working and responsible and has very good personal and professional references in her community.

loans.use: to buy some new computers for her Internet Cafe

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
Erkin is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His older two children attend college and the younger one is a student. 

Erkin manages a shoe repair business in his town. He started his business in 2000 in a rented booth at a trading center. He used to rent his booth with another shoe repairer but his business became quite successful, which allowed him to rent his booth on his own. Erkin repairs one pair of shoes at a price of 1,000-4,000 MNT and gains a net profit of 50%. He is very good at attracting customers with his polite communication skills. His business is developing and improving day by day. Erkin is planning to have new and advanced equipment in the near future. He is an honest man who says, "All I want is to get my children educated." Erkin is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy his rented booth and to purchase some materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy his rented booth and to purchase some materials for his business.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette Alejandro is 48 years old. She is married with three children. To earn a living, she manages a general store. Janette has had this business for almost eight years now.

Janette is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy products like canned goods, soft drinks and sandwich spreads. Each month, Janette earns 4,000 PHP for these activities, which is very helpful in supporting the educational needs of her children.

In the future, Janette hopes that her general store will become a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products like canned goods, soft drinks and sandwich spreads

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Esperanza works hard to support her family.

She has a food production sales business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store.  Esperanza is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mr. Chuon is a 31-year-old, married man and is blessed with two children who are teenagers. He is a domestic construction foreman in the mobile, Kompong Chhnang Province. His wife sells a few produce items in her small store in front of their home. Mr. Chuon is also very skilled at taking beautiful pictures but he lacks the capital to buy a modern camera to provide photographic services. This is the reason Mr. Chuon has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: to buy a modern camera to provide photographic services

loans.name: Canquixaja Group

texts.es: El señor Benito Ricardo es casado, tiene 54 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. contar con estudios escolares, tiene 6 hijos 4 D. ellos estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropa, inició este negocio siendo vendedor ambulante y lleva 20 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a la crianza D. animales domésticos. DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. más mercaderías: suéteres, bufandas, gorras, playeras, camisetas, etc. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en: Benito Ricardo is 54 years old, he is married and he has 6 children, four of which go to school, but her himself did not have the chance to study. He engages in selling clothes: a street vendor, he has been engaged in this activity for 20 years, and he can count on his wife’s support, as she engages in breeding animals. He decided to create a group in order to ask for a loan that he will use to buy more products, such as sweaters, scarves, caps, T-shirts and jerseys. The other members of his group engage either in trading or in breeding animals.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, scarves, caps, T-shirts and jerseys.

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija is a 42 year old married mother of three children. She sells vegetables and fruits in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last three years.
 
Adija has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family. Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Inés Virginia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  16, 13, 9 y 8 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar desde hace varios años trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta.  Ella realizar los créditos con la finalidad de que su esposo y su papá puedan sacar adelante un negocio de fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), allí trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00, nos cuenta que una vez que han elaborado una gran cantidad de ladrillos hasta su fabrica llegan los comerciantes quienes les compran y estos los leven a otros lugares para su venta.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua, palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ayuda a su papá y a su esposo al mismo tiempo.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su trabajo y que la fabrica siga mejorando
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.


We met Inés, 32, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 16, 13, 9 and 8 years of age.  The two oldest are in secondary school and the younger ones go to elementary school.  Her husband’s an artisan.


Our friend is a very tenacious woman who, in order that her children not lack for anything and to help her husband meet household expenses, has been working in a factory in the city of Manta for several years.  She is negotiating these loans in hopes of her husband and father being able to make a brick manufacturing business (materials used to build houses) successful.  They work there Monday through Saturday from 8am until 4pm.  She tell us that once a large number of bricks are manufactured merchants come by the factory to buy them and take them to other places to be sold.


This loan is to buy firewood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm which are the materials used to make bricks.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she can use the loans to help her father and her husband at the same time.  Her dream is to continue working at her job and that the factory continues improving.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm to make bricks.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man is a widow who has two children, both of whom are married.  Mrs. Man is now old and cannot earn as much as before.  Her son-in-law supports his wife (her daughter) and Mrs. Man with his work as a pot seller in the market.  He earns about $3 per day.  She would like to borrow in amount of $500 in order to support her son-in-law's business.

loans.use: to support her son-in-law's business as a cookware seller in the market

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro, age 47, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy sack bags (colorful bags usually used for shopping) and paper bags from wholesalers and sells them per piece with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy her bags due to her low selling prices. She earns a minimum of Philippine pesos (PHP) 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Socorro is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of bags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Socorro lives with her husband Abraham and their children in Malibay, Pasay City. Abraham is a construction worker. Like most Filipino parents, Socorro and Abraham believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Socorro hopes to have her house fully paid up as soon as possible because she dreams of being able to provide her children with a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of bags to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Amigos Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Amigos Triunfadores” es un grupo responsable conformado por 09 personas emprendedoras, la cual Elsa es una D. las socias activas.
Elsa tiene 43 años D. edad, ella es una madre trabajadora, con 02 hijos en etapa escolar,  tiene una bodega que cuando se inicio solo era una pequeña  tienda que solo ocupaba una parte D. su casa, al transcurrir el tiempo su negocio ha crecido y mejorado su bodega ya que  es completo y abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, es por ello que sus ventas son buenas y eso la ayuda para seguir mejorando, y seguir apoyando a sus pequeños  que solo dependen D. ella, ya que nos cuenta que es madre soltera y a tenido que sacar adelante sola a sus hijos . Con el  préstamo lo seguira invirtiendo en su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, leche, frutas, fideos, entre otros. El deseo D. Elsa es D. seguir creciendo en su negocio y así generar mas ingresos para  brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos.  El grupo “Amigos Triunfadores” están muy agradecidos ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The “Amigos Triunfadores” Communal Bank is a group of 9 responsible and enterprising people. Elsa is one of the active members.
She is a 43-year-old hard-working mother of two school-aged children. She has a grocery store which started off as just a small store in part of her house. With the passing of time, her business has grown and improved. Her store is now complete and she supplies her customers with all kinds of basic staples. For this reason, her sales are good. This helps her to continue improving and supporting her little ones, who depend on her. She tells us that she is a single mother and she has had to support her children on her own. With this loan she will continue to invest in her business, buying rice, sugar, milk, pasta, and other items. Elsa wants her business to continue growing and generate more income so that she can offer her children the best. The "Amigos Triunfadores" group is very grateful that you are making their progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, pasta and rice.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is 47 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Luna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling "nipa" (palm fronds used as building material) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for "nipa" mat making.

Ma. Luna has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying & selling "nipa" for 10 years and also earns an income from sari-sari (variety) store.

Ma. Luna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for "nipa" mat making.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, vive con su hijo de 12 años y su esposo,  poseen casa propia, desde hace 13 años María aprendió el oficio de la sastrería, este surgió por iniciativa propia y por el momento ya cuenta con experiencia.
Ella necesita comprar materia prima que es la tela de diferentes marcas y colores, botones de diferentes medidas, broches y ciper, esta inversión le permitirá tener surtido el taller de todos los materiales necesarios para la confección de ropa. 
Su aspiración es que el taller continúe brindando servicio, ya que es un trabajo que a ella le agrada y por lo mismo se esmera para mantenerlo.
texts.en:
María lives with her 12-year-old son and her husband.  They own their house.  María learned tailoring 13 years ago.  The business arose from her own initiative and to date she’s gained experience in it.

She needs to buy raw materials which are fabric in various colors and brands, different sizes of buttons, clasps and zippers.  This investment will make it possible for her to have a good assortment on hand in the shop of all materials needed to make clothes.

Her goal is that the shop continues providing service since it’s work that she enjoys which is why she works so hard to keep it going.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and clasps for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Re

texts.en:
Re, 48 years old, is a fish seller earns $6 per day. Her husband is a fisher and earns $4 per day. They reside with one child and he is working as a construction worker earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $7 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a boat and fishing equipment for fishing. This family did not want to change their career because they have been doing it for long time and can make a good income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing equipment

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mr. Saom, 48, is a resident of the Ornlong long Veng district of Siem Reap province. He is married with nine children. One of them has started a new family and lives away. 

Mr. Saom works independently as a construction supervisor. He has about ten workers who work under his control. He usually earns about $5 USD per day through this business. Due to the lack of construction supplies, Mr. Saom has met many difficulties in running this business smoothly. With his first loan from HKL and Kiva, He will use to buy some construction materials such as a plane machine, an alternator, and other needed tools for construction work. 

This loan will help him produce productive results and cut down the time or effort at the work place. He is grateful to all Kiva’s lenders who generously help his family in need.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as a plane machine, an alternator, and other needed tools.

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Myagmarjav is 31 years old and lives with his his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sews at home, his elder son studies at school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

He was a herder in a remote area until 2009. Then he sold all of his livestock and moved to the center of the province. In the 2009, he built his own home and bought a car to run a taxi service. 

He needs to repair his car and at the same time his wife needs raw materials to expand her business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I was scared to move at first, but now it is not scary at all. I see opportunities." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair his car and to buy a sewing materials for his wife.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the taxi and sewing materials for his wife.

loans.name: Imamverdi

texts.en:
Imamverdi is a 47 years old man who's bred cattle for the last seven years.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  

Imamverdi is married with two children. His wife and children help run the business.  He usually buys cattle, raise and fatten them and then sells them in the livestock bazaar.  His monthly income is about 250 AZN. 

He applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase one milk cow and two cattle.  Imamverdi has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and two cattle.

loans.name: Purity Masika

texts.en: Purity is a 25 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 and 5. She describes herself as wise and social. She operates a restaurant where she sells food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and her primary customers are students and teachers. She says her biggest business challenge is collecting debts owed by clients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to open a saloon. Her business goal is to run a hotel and own more restaurants within 5 years.

loans.use: to open a saloon

loans.name: Demin Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEMIN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, qui ne cesse d’augmenter.Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
 SALI, en blanc, debout au milieu fait le commerce de poisons (fumés et frais) il ya environ 6. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  5 caisses de poissons fumés et 4 paniers de poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Demin group are married women, who average 42 years of age with an average of five children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a district of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their fifth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their ever-growing customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Sali, dressed in white and standing in the middle of the photo, has been buying and selling fish for around six years. With her loan she is planning to buy five crates of smoked fish and four baskets of fresh fish. She gets her supplies in Sikasso town's Grand Market. She resells them at a fixed place in the market in Kamalen Sirakoro and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 47,500FCFA, part of which will be used for daily household expenses, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has a small shop from which she sells food. She has been engaged in this business for three years, during which favorable conditions have allowed her to expand it.

This loan of 2000 USD will allow Anahit to increase sales and develop her business. She hopes to earn more income and insure a sustainable future for her son.

loans.use: to purchase food for her shop.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling foodstuffs in Bor, South Sudan, for five years.

Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and salt. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
 
Apolinar has a junk shop that sells recycled materials like bottles, plastics and metals. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics to sell.
