Apolinar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Apolinar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Felix Ruperto

texts.es:
Felix Ruperto tiene 35 años de estado civil Soltero vive solo no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Felix Ruperto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Guaranda y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los Cantones de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir aumentando la cantidad de producción del maíz sobre todo.

En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Felix Rupert is 35 years old, single with no children, and lives alone. He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

The communal bank is called Ciudadela Los Ángeles, and is located in the area of Los Ángeles, belonging to the Ventanas Canton and this area is devoted to agricultural work of short-cycle growing of corn and rice.

Felix Ruperto works in agriculture growing corn and rice. He buys his products in Guaranda and he sells in the market there and in the markets of the surrounding cantons.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizers for the growing of corn and rice. The loan will help him increase his income for the use of his family and to invest. His dream is to continue increasing his corn production above all.

In his free time he very much enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en: Wafa is a 45 year old maried woman , who has 4 family members, from Ashrafia Amman Jordan . She is requesting a loan to buy home products especially for the kitchen (such as dishes, cups etc.) to sell . She would like expand her existing project and also increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for home products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on his farm.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
I make and sell tortillas, and I have several years experience in this business, which has created enough income to help my family in their daily expenses. Now the demand has increased and some of them have businesses where they sell food and contract me to make tortillas for them to use, as do my neighbors for family dinners and special events. I need capital to buy materials for the tortillas and to double my current earnings because I have two children who will be starting university and the costs continue to grow. I know that I can continue to support them economically and to achieve a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este rubro que me ha generado ganancias para ayudar a mi familia en los gastos. Ahora la demanda de mis clientes ha crecido ya que algunos de ellos han puesto negocios de comidas y me encargan las tortillas para acompañar sus comidas, asi como mis vecinos en sus tiempos de comida familiar y eventos. Necesito capital para comprar material para las tortillas y doblar mis ingresos ya que tengo dos hijos que inician sus estudios universitarios y los gastos se incrementaron. Se que puedo seguirles apoyando economicamente y lograr mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy corn-flour, firewood, water and other items.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: Asifa lives in District 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and she is widow. Her husband died  5 years after their wedding in an explosion in Kabul. She supports her family and her children. She needs money to buy new sewing machines because she has 3 students who  work with her. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for each one of them so that she can expand her business and help her children. She hopes that she can develop this business.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr Nut S. is 26. He lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with his father who is a taxi driver earning around 3 dollars per day. Mr Nut S. is an electrician and earns 5 dollars a day. He wants to purchase a motorcycle for his father to operate a business.  In the future, Mr Nut S. would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his father who want to operate a business

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es:
"I have a business selling footwear from a catalog in my home, and I would like to invest in the purchase of footwear, in order to have various models on hand, since my customers have asked asked me for them and I would like to increase my sales to have more income. I am requesting $1200 to buy footwear for my business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo un negocio de venta de calzado por catalogo en mi casa y me gustaría invertir en la compra de calzado para tener en existencia varios modelos, ya que mis clientes me lo han solicitado y quisiera que mis ventas aumentaran para poder tener más ingresos” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar calzado para mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in my business

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Born in 1942 in Djita, Mrs. Maman A. has eight (08) children. The preparation and sale of palm oil is her main business and job. Very dynamic, but lacking resources, she usually buys palm nuts on credit; she pays after selling her oil. This does not allow her to obtain a margin of revenue sufficiently large to meet her needs. In order to establish a commercial base, she is asking for a loan of $700 to pay cash for palm nuts for her business. This will allow her to secure her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1942 à Djita, Madame A. Maman est mère de huit (08) enfants. La préparation et le commerce d’huile de palme reste son activité principale et son gagne pain. Très dynamique mais ne disposant pas de moyens, elle a l’habitude de prendre des noix de palme à crédit ; elle paye après avoir vendu son huile. Cela ne lui permet pas de dégager une marge de revenu suffisante pour ses besoins. Pour avoir un fond de commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour désormais acheter au comptant les noix de palme pour son activité. Ceci lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts for the preparation of oil

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Mrs. Eunice A. is 35 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Benin City. She is a professional hairdresser. She worked with someone for 3 years to learn the business, and then started her own salon in 2000.

Mrs. A. requests this loan to buy more Weavons to sell. She has been a client of LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: Buy more Weavons to sell

loans.name: Napsiah

texts.en: Napsiah is a 37 years old woman with three children. She has a small shop from which sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc... She usually earns US$10 per day. Her husband, N., has no fixed income. Napsiah requests a IDR 700,000 loan to buy some goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy some goods for her shop

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Since she was very young Martha dedicated herself to the sale of food together with her parents before she was married and bit by bit she learned tricks of the business. After getting married she began her own business selling food. Together with what her husband earns, as a newspaper salesman, it is not enough to pay for the expenses of her and her two children. Martha has learned how to take advantage of the good flavor that her foods have, and because of this she has become known in her community. Nowadays Martha is requesting $475 USD that is arranged to be paid off over a term of 3 months and with this money Martha will be able to purchase more raw materials so that she can expand her business and be able to have more clients. With your help Martha will be able to further her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

DesD. muy joven Martha se dedicó a vender comidas junto con sus papás antes D. casarse y poco a poco aprendió los trucos D. este negocio. Después D. casarse comenzó su propio negocio D. ventas D. comidas. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo, como vendedor D. periódico no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos D. elL. y sus dos hijos. Martha a sabido aprovechar el buen sabor que tiene en sus comidas, por lo que a podido darse a conocer en su comunidad.

Actualmente Martha está solicitando un crédito D. US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 3 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar más materia prima para poder crecer su negocio y con esto poder tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase her business

loans.name: C. Nabuti A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Agnes N.. She has beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more hair chemicals. Agnes is 28 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from ages 2 to 6 who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Agnes hopes to be able to expand her business.

Agnes is joined in her small group by Sarah W., Annet N., Kevin N., and Nulu A.. Sarah W. has a restaurant and wants to purchase more furniture. Annet N. sells fruit and wants a loan to boost her business. Kevin N. sells used clothing and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Nulu A. also sells used clothes and is requesting a loan to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To expand salon business

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is a shoe salesman from the central Ukrainian city of Kahovka. He has a small space at one of the outdoor markets in Kahovka where he sells an attractive variety of men’s and women’s shoes. Oleg has been in business for about two years. He has about $2500 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $250 per month in net profit. Oleg is married and has a seventeen year old daughter. Like so many small entrepreneurs in Ukraine, Oleg is working hard to make a better life for his family.

Oleg has requested a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory to sell so that he can continue to operate his business successfully and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. is 47 years old, and she had opened a despensa (grocery store) a few years ago. Although the business did not do particularly well in that her sales and income were quite poor, it is worth mentioning that Manuela did not give up for several years and that she did her very best to allow the business to succeed. As a result, she began to look for other profitable business opportunities.

Five years ago, Manuela opened another store where she sells chicken and different types of drinks (e.g., cokes and beers). She is very excited because this is a very profitable market, and she is happy to report that "sales and income are increasing steadily."

Manuela’s family is comprised of her husband, Roberto, and her three sons. To increase the family’s income, Roberto works in a restaurant on the weekends as a waiter.

Manuela is seeking a loan to buy chicken and drinks.

loans.use: To continue to expand her business by purchasing additional chickens and drinks.

loans.name: Modesta Clemencia

texts.es:
Senora Modesta is 53 years old and has 7 children. She lives in the district of El Bosque, in the province of Trujillo. She sells meals from her home, a business she has had for 6 years. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for approximately 2 years. With her first loan, she purchased plates and other kitchen utensils.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in growing her business. Modesta would like to have a larger space where she could open a restaurant, increasing her income and improving the quality of life for her family.

La señora Modesta tiene 53 años D. edad, vive en el Distrito D. El Bosque - Provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad; estudió sólo la primaria , tiene 07 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. menús en su casa, por las tardes también venD. salchipollo en la casa D. la señora Emerenciana, este negocio lo tiene aproximadamente hace 06 años Con Manuela Ramos viene trabajando 02 años aproximadamente. Los S/.300. otorgado como primer préstamo, los invirtió comprando ollas, y otros utensilios D. cocina . La señora Modesta ingresa al Banco Comunal “Amor y Trabajo II ” Con el préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses. Lo invertirá en su negocio. Ella aspira tener un local amplio, donD. pueda surgir en su negocio D. comida, le gustaría poner un restaurante y así poder mejorar los ingresos y su condición D. vida.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES TO GROW HER FOOD BUSINESS.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
I. Jamil is a 53-year-old salesperson who sells door and window frames made of wood and cement. All of these materials are very popular for building new houses. Jamil lives in the small village of Saatli with his wife and three children.

He has permanent clients and his goods sell very quickly because of high demand. There are special conditions requiring that cement and wood be kept in dry and dark conditions. He is requesting a loan to make repairs and meet these conditions for his products, .

loans.use: To make repairs and improve the conditions of the building materials business

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mr. Chantha R. is a villager in Khnach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a firewood seller and his wife, Mrs. Ny Tol, is a housewife. They have one child who is too young too work or study. They live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mr. Chantha R. wants to startbreeding cows so he requests a loan to buy calves to start his new business. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy calves to start his new business.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Ёкубова Раъно девушка в возросте 26 лет замужем. Имеет высшее образование , после окончания университета она уже 3 года как работает кассиром в сотовой компании "Мобильные линии Таджикистана ". Раьно живёт в трёх комнатной квартире, со старым ремонтом. Она уже давно планирует провести капитальный ремонт своей квартиры. Но никак не может накопить денег для этого.Узнав что в Микроинвесте можно получить кредит для потребительских нужд, Раъно решила обратится для получения займа. Она вполне сможет погасить кредит из своей заработной платы. Раъно благодарна инвесторам КIVA ,за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Rano Y. is 26 years old and married. She has a bachelor's degree. After graduating from the university, she started working as a cashier at a telecommunications company "Mobile lines of Tajikistan," where she has been working for the past 3 years. Rano lives in an old apartment that had not been remodeled for a long time. She had already planned a major remodeling a while ago, but she couldn't save enough money to start. When Rano found out that she could obtain a loan from Microinvest for personal use, she decided to take advantage of those services. She is confident she can pay off the loan using her salary. Rano is very greatful to Kiva loaners for support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel an apartment

loans.name: Latifa's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Latifa is 28 years old and married with two children, who are six years old and just two months. Since 2007, she has owned a small salon and has also been a chips seller. She works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Latifa is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling coconuts, firewood, charcoal, chips, clothing, and bites.

loans.use: To expand her salon and chips business.

loans.name: Nadhira

texts.en:
Nadhira has owned a small shop in Zanzibar since 2007. She sells miscellaneous household items like detergent and snacks. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She will use her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more inventory for her shop to increase her profit.

Nadhira is 44 years old, married, and has five children, ages 9, 12, 14, 18 and 26.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto S. y vive en el Pasaje Santa Lucia 223 interior B, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y se casó a los 23 años. Actualmente tiene un hijo de 3 años.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de choco tejas, vende en su casa, en la puerta de una fábrica y le hacen pedidos de una empresa.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en materiales y moldes para las choco tejas.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cobertura de chocolate, pasas, nueces, pecanas y manjar.
Sandra sueña con tener una tienda muy grande.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto S.’ and lives at Pasaje Santa Lucia 223 interior B, Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Perú. She completed secondary school and married at 23 years of age. Today she has a 3 year old son. Her business consists of making and selling chocolate candies which she sells from her home, at the gate of a factory and a business orders directly from her. With her first loan for S/. 300 which was repaid in 4 payments, she invested in ingredients and molds for the chocolate candies. With this loan for S/. 500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy chocolate for melting, raisins, nuts, pecans, and caramel. Sandra dreams of having a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chocolate for melting, raisins, nuts, pecans, and caramel.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a trader. She sells foodstuffs at Ntsiman near Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is also a trader. She has received education through junior high school level. She has been trading since 2006. 

Gladys would use the money given her to buy more foodstuffs to sell and also make an oil palm plantation.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell and also make an oil palm plantation.

loans.name: Sruo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sruo A. is a group leader of five residents who all live in Por village in the Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store where she sells rice and other foods. Her husband, Mr. Long Sambo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. He faces a problem because he does not have enough rice seeds to plant in the field during the dry season. Thus, Mrs. Sruo A. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds. She hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

She is 51-years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is attending the local school and the others stay at home.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. started her business three years ago in the village where she lives with her family. Gladys is a food vendor and she prepares and serves what we call ‘obrayo’ (porridge) and "baflot" in a community school. Obrayo is prepared from dried maize; this maize is soaked in water for about three days before it is ground, but not too fine. This food (porridge) is just like any other porridge but with this one you feel the maize whilst enjoying it. Obrayo can be taking with bread or "baflot". It can be taken either as breakfast or lunch and it is purely carbohydrate food.

Gladys is married with three kids who are currently in school. Through her excellent food standards and moderate prices she has attracted many customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize, sugar, milk, flour, margarine, charcoal, etc. so that she can remain in business. Gladys belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress. And she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: For the purchase of maize, flour, margarine, milk etc.

loans.name: Jebran

texts.en: Jebran, a 48-year-old married man with three children, lives in Forn Al Chebak in Beirut, where he started a car repair shop 29 years ago. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools and equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Juana Renee

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Juana  es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Juana es Técnica de Enfermería y trabaja en el Hospital, también tiene un kiosco cerca al mercado Magdalena, donde todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos vende comida y bebidas. También en Semana Santa vende comida.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y bebidas.
El sueño de Juana es mejorar y surtir su kiosco.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Banco Comunal Guadalupe. Juana is married, 54 years old, and has three children. She works as a nurse technicion at the hospital. She also has a kiosk near the Magdalena market, where she sells food and drinks every day with the help of her children. She also sells food during Holy Week. Juana needs a loan for 1,000 soles. She will use the money to purchase sweets and drinks. Juana's dream is to improve and stock her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Loine

texts.en:
Loine F., age 37, is married and has four children. She has many years of experience selling fresh fish. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week.

She has has three previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Loine’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to maintain the good standards of her business.

loans.use: Purchase a new canoe and fishing equipment, such as goggles, spear and  a torch

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. has been a fish vendor in her village for almost one year.  Her goal is to improve and expand her business and to further support the daily needs of her family.  However due to lack of capital, she could not pursue her plans.  Because of this, she would like to request PHP 4,000.00 as additional capital for her vending business.  She is happy that through her vending, she is able to provide her family with food to eat three times a day and also to give her children their school allowance.  

Deliea is 46 years old and married to Nelson.  They have four children: Ivy, 22 years old, college undergraduate; Jonathan, 19 years old; Josua, 17, years old and Jaymar, 15 years old.  The three of them are in high school.  They live in Barangay Alibagu, Ilagan, Isabela.  Her family is trying to surpass the economic crisis they are encountering nowadays.  She hopes that her business will become successful someday.  She always prays that through all her sacrifices, God will give her a way to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Mrs. Alba S. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are currently studying. Her life as a widow is full of challenges, especially financially. 

Alba runs a sari-sari (convenience store). Her customers are the employees of different offices, neighbors, relatives, and friends. She started with minimal capital with the help of Paglaum MPC. Now she is seeking additional capital that will enable her to purchase goods such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store, and dreams that her children will graduate from college and have a good future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
L. Hồ Thị is 35 yeas old and lives in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has two school-age children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a restaurant. L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month.

In 2008, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services  so she could improve her living situation. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. She used the previous loan to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. L. is now requesting a second loan that she will use to expand her business.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Bulihon, Misamis Oriental. She is thirty-two years old and single. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business, selling leafy vegetables from her garden to the local community. Teresita wants to open up a small variety store, which is the main reason why she started with the program and services of HSPFI.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as working capital for her variety store. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement her income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru: Холмахмад Шерматов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холмахмад вместе семьей занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Holmahmad S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Holmahmad and his family are involved in animal husbandry. He feeds and sells livestock. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Lisvania Del Carmen

texts.es: Lisvania del Carmen P. E. tiene 26 años. Es una joven soltera. Lisvania es una joven emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. La humilde actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que su Mama era la que se dedicaba a este negocio, pero al ver la responsabilidad de su hija decide que ella se haga cargo del negocio. Además Lisvania está cursando el 4 año de su carrera, el pago de su universidad, lo realiza ella misma y también contribuye con los gastos de su hogar. Por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos de la universidad, vecinos y amistades. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cosméticos, colonia y alguna ropa interior. Ya que corresponden a diferentes casas comerciales. su mayor sueño es finalizar sus estudios y mantener esta fuente de ingreso para salir adelante con su familia y sus metas.
texts.en:
Lisvania del Carmen P. E. is a 26 year old single woman. She is a young entrepreneur who is eager to get ahead. Her small business involves selling cosmetics. She has been engaged in this activity for 6 years and her mother was also in the same line of business. Lisvania is studying for her four year degree, so she is paying for her university tuition as well as her household expenses. Most of her customers are classmates, neighbors and friends.

She will use her loan to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, colognes and some undergarments, which she obtains from different commercial vendors. Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and earn a good living so that her family can get ahead and reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudió secundaria ipero solo hasta 4to grado, vive en la Comunidad de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 01 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le lo utilizara como capital para la fabricación de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir cabuya (mateiral para elaborar sogas) de Desaguadero (distrito) para la fabricación de sogas, para venderlo en la feria de Juli e Ilave.
Su deseo es poner una panadería.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa is a a member of Community Bank "Chijuyo Copapujo," located in the central village of Chijuyo Copapujo of the key district, in the province of El Collao, in the Puno Department. She is 42 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She studied only until the 4th grade, and lives in the community of Chijuyo Copapujo. She works with the Manuela Ramos Movement, as she has been for almost a year. Her first loan was for $175, which she used for capital to create ropes. Now, she requests an additional loan of $175 which she wants to use to purchase cabuya, which is a natural fiber used to create rope, from the Desaguadero district for the production of ropes, to sell them in the fair of Juli and key. Her dream is to start a bakery. She likes the loan facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cabuya (a natural fiber for creating rope)

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja, Cristian (28 años) quien es chofer, y con sus hijos: Piero de 9, Marícelo de 4 y Jamir de 1 año de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) afuera de su casa, pues esta actividad le permite tener independencia económica y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Debido a que él es chofer y trabaja durante casi todo el día, Judith debe afrontar el cuidado de sus hijos, lo cual realiza por las mañanas, y su trabajo a partir de las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche. A Judith le gusta mucho su negocio porque siempre le gustó cocinar, lo único que no le gusta es tener que dejar a sus hijos solos dentro de la casa durante este tiempo, pues está muy ajetreada con la atención de sus clientes. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda en su misma casa donde pueda trabajar con mayor comodidad. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona muy estricta a la hora de cumplir con sus pagos, al igual que el resto de integrantes de su grupo, con el cual se siente muy contenta, porque todos son buenos amigos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de papa, litros de aceite y otros ingredientes para aumentar las porciones de salchipapa que vende.

loans.use: Compra de comestibles e ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia  es una persona extrovertida y muy atenta, tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica hace varios años a su empresa de transportes de motokar, donde tiene como socia a su hermana. La ruta de transporte de su agencia de motokar es dentro de la ciudad de Pucallpa, también tiene una bodega en su casa y trabaja junto a su mamá. Es madre soltera, tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad ,que lo apoya mucho. Ella pertenece hace tres años al Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en su bodega. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000 soles, piensa invertir una parte en su bodega comprando productos como leche, azúcar, arroz, etc. y otra parte invertirá en el arreglo de su local donde funciona su empresa de motokar. Su meta es tener una tienda de repuestos en general  para motos y motokar y así seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a very extroverted and thoughtful person. She is 44. For several years she has had a transportation by “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart) business in the city of Pucallpa. She also has a store in her house, and she works with her mother. She is a single mother with one child who is now grown. She gives him lots of support. She has belonged to the Guadalupe Communal Bank for three years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she invested in her store. She plans to use part of this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy products like milk, sugar, and rice, etc. for her store. She will use the other part to fix up the location where she has her motocarro business. Her goal is to have a replacement parts store for motorcycles and motocarros. This way she will continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up her location and buy products like rice, eggs, noodles, sugar, and more for her store

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39 year old Tausi  M. from Mbeya. She is married and has three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 14. Since 2006, Tausi has made a living running a local restaurant. In Tanzania, these businesses usually consist of a rough wooden table and some long benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize) and plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat and a variety of sauces.

She works at her business for 9-12 hours a day, six days a week, earning about $60 from her work. She is applying for this loan to buy flour, sugar, beans and other supplies. In the future, she plans to open a new branch of her business at a second location. Tausi thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, beans and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo ayudando a sus padres en las diferentes tareas que se le encomendaba, en aquel entonces, era el cuidado de los animales y la selección de la cosecha. En la actualidad sigue realizando estas tareas, pero con mayor intensidad en el cultivo de granos como el maíz, cebada y trigo, los cuales vende en el principal mercado de abastos de una de las ciudades más cercana a la suya. Ernestina y su esposo desean adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para que su producción sea mayor. 

Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras, y así produzca una buena cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de abono y fertilizantes

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati L. is a milk seller in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She already owns two cows, and she is selling cow's milk door-to-door in the morning and evening. Mrs. Parbati lives in a growing neighborhood. In that area, the demand for cow's milk is increasing daily, because fresh cow's milk is very good for human health. She is requesting a loan of 15000 NPR to buy a young milk-giving cow to meet the increasing demand for cow's milk.

Mrs. Parbati lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Auchut, is a house painter. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7, and her daughter is studying in grade 5.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bayarhuu

texts.en:
Bayarhuu Shagparsuren is a 47-year-old married man, living with his wife and two children in the Zavkhan province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest son, Lhamsuren, is a college student, and his youngest, Banzragch, is in high school.

Bayarhuu operates a wood product-making business in his town as a partnership with a few of his friends. He mainly produces wood items which are used in ger construction and traditional ger furniture. His business is very popular and his customer base includes both residents of his province as well as two other adjoining provinces. Bayarhuu started his business in 1999, and he has made much progress over the years. He is a savvy businessman, and he is constantly looking for ways to improve his operations. For example, because many countryside people, who are his main customers, often lack sufficient cash to purchase his products, he instead trades with them; more specifically, he might trade his wood items for flour, which he would then sell in his town for a profit. Bayarhuu has used his business' success to build a workshop and to provide a quality life for his family. He says, "I want my children to be educated people and to have a good life. I am working hard to support them." He has many plans for the future, such as expanding his workshop and hiring two new assistants. By doing so, he will be able to expand his production capacity and to begin producing a wider variety of unique and stylish furniture. Bayarhuu is requesting a loan in the amount of 700,000 tugrug (approximately $500 USD) to purchase wood and materials for his business.

About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additonal wood

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en: Alaskar A. is 51 years old, married and has five children. His role as a father is the main one in his life, he says. Alaskar works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He has grown and sold seasonal fruits and vegetables for more than 20 years. Alaskar dreams that all of his children will be well educated and have a bright future – that is why he works from early morning until late at night.  Alaskar wants to borrow 1600 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer and necessary supplies for saving his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them will increase. This loan request is to make Alaskar's dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jamilyn

texts.en:
Jamilyn C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 21 years old. Jamilyn is single. To make a living, Jamilyn owns & operates a restaurant serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Jamilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jamilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jamilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jamilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jamilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for her restaurant

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena P. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 38 years old. Ma. Elena is separated and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Elena sells seafood, such as shrimp and anchovies, in the local community. Ma. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Ma. Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for the business. This will be Ma. Elena's 8th loan from PMPC and her second loan from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her family's daily expenses, especially her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor Tómala de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta en su casa con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 3 hijos.

Víctor empezó con un vehiculo muy viejo haciendo fletes, poco a poco tubo capital suficiente para comprar un auto nuevo.

Ahora Víctor es taxista ambulante, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la desconfianza de sus clientes al coger los taxistas ambulantes por la delincuencia que hay en las calles.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceite y amortiguadores para el taxi. En el futuro quiere una compañía de taxis.
texts.en:
Victor T. is 45 years old and lives in the greater urban area of Paraiso de Guayaquil. He lives in a house with his wife and their 3 children. They have all the basic services in the home. Victor began making deliveries with a very old car, but little by little he had enough capital to buy a new vehicle. Now Victor is an independent taxi-driver. He works from 6:00am to 8:00pm every day. One of the disadvantages that he has is the distrust of his customers to use independent taxis because of the delinquency that there is in the streets. With the loan he would like to buy oil and shock absorbers for the taxi. In the future he would like to own a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: oil, shock absorbers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita M. is from the village of Owaon. She is 62 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Arcelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Arcelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Arcelita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock. Arcelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plantain, grapefruit, oranges, bananas, corn, and other produce.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of four boys and two girls, all of whom attend school.  She has been selling coconut and cassava seasonally for over ten years. She also has a farm which she uses to sustain herself and her family, and she owns her home, which does not have water or electricity.

Mariam’s son was in an accident, and she had to pay his medical costs with her previous loan. With this new 30,000 KES loan, Mariam wants to purchase premature coconuts from farmers, which she will then sell to food vendors and individuals. Her greatest challenge is carrying coconuts, and she cites food, school fees, and business capital as her greatest expenses. She hopes to someday open a shop to support herself and her family more comfortably.

loans.use: Coconuts

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comite Mujeres Luchadoras esta integrada por 19 Señoras muy trabajadoras quienes se unierón para trbajar en forma solidaria e independiente en donD. el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espiritu emprendedor.

Las mismas residen en el Barrio Inmaculada D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, actualmente estan en el 6to. Ciclo y  quieren seguir progresando. 

La señora Catalina R. es una D. las integrantes y se dedica a la cria D. pollos para vender en el mercada. Su forma D. produccion es muy peculiar ya que ella compra los pollitos y los cria en un gallinero instalado en su casa. Una vez que los pollos tienen el peso deseado por mercado ella los venD. en varios negocios.

Solicita un credito para la compra D. balanceados que son para la alimentacion D. su pollos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras group consists of 19 very hard-working women who came together to help their businesses. The key to their success is their enterprising spirit. The members resiD. in the Barrio Inmaculada in the city of Caaguazú, and with their sixth loan they want to keep progressing. Catalina R. is one of the members, and she makes a living raising chickens to sell at the market. Her method is unique since she purchases the chicks and then raises them in a coop set up in her home. Once the chickens reach their desired market weight she sells them to various businesses. She is requesting the loan to purchase feed for her chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken feed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice W. is a 35-year-old lady trading in baby clothing and ladies clothes. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Her business is located within Nairobi, along a busy road. Her main customers include local residents, visitors and tourists. She has one employee and two school-going children.

She had previously borrowed 20,000 Kenyan shillings and successfully repaid it. She is now borrowing KES 40,000 to increase her stock of baby clothes. Her main business challenge is the harassment from the local authorities and competition from an open-air market within the neighborhood. She sees herself in five years time as a prominent business lady employing people in her company.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to address increasing demand as a result of a baby boom

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es: Rosa Cristina T. D. Q. D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado D. una empresa privada y quien también trabaja como sastre en sus tiempos libres, D. esta forma el le ayuda a Rosa con el trabajo del negocio que ella posee; así mismo vive junto a su único hijo menor D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Rosa posee un taller D. corte y confección, en donD. se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. batas y camisones para niños, ponchos para personas adultas, ropa para damas y caballeros y así mismo copra y venD. ropa interior. Esta la comercializa, visitando diferentes oficinas, en donD. las ofrece a los empleados del lugar, los cuales incluso le hacen pedidos previos, lo cual es muy bueno para Rosa, ya que elabora un número D. prendas D. vestir las cuales son ganancias seguras, así mismo comercializa sus productos en su casa D. habitación en donD. venD. con sus amigos y vecinos. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: ropa interior, telas, hilos, botones y otros elementos más los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración D. la ropa que comercializa, lo que le permita contar con mayores ventas y D. esta forma mejorar su negocio y la estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Cristina T. D. Q. is 57 years old. She resides in the town of Santa Tecla, loacted in the departament of La Libertad. She lives with her husband who works for a private company and who also works as a tailor in his free time. In this way, he helps Rosa with work in her business. She also lives with her only son, who is a minor and a student. Rosa has a cutting an tailoring workshop where she makes and sells robes and pajamas for children, ponchos for adults, and clothing for men and women. She also buys and sells underwear. She sells these, visiting different offices where she offers them to employees who even order ahead of time. This is very good for Rose, since she makes several articles of clothing which are guaranteed sales. She also sells her products from her home to friends and neighbors. Rosa is asking for a loan with which she can buy underwear, fabric, thread, buttons and other elements which are necessary to make the clothing she sells. This allows her to have more sales and in this way improve her business and the stability of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase underwear, fabric, buttons and needles.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is married with five children. She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for four years and has three employees. In addition, she earns a living from her rental houses. She uses her income to pay school fees for her children and also to pay wages to her employees. She has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 through a group in Faulu Kenya to buy sugar, mobile phone credit cards, and maize flour. She hopes to own a mini-supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, mobile phone credit cards, and maize flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter J. is currently in the business of selling earrings and necklaces and is requesting a loan to stock more necklaces to sell.  Peter is 37 years old and is married to a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a beauty shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more necklaces to sell

loans.name: Enrique Walter

texts.es:
Enrique Walter C. M. tiene 62 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos.
 
Enrique es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuyá. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuyá para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para sacar a la familia adelante. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales en el Recinto.
texts.en:
Enrique Walter C. M. is 62 years old. His is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado parish. He has no children. Enrique is a member of the communal bank "Fronteras Unidas," which is located 15 minutes from Estero Salado parish and 2 hours from the agency in Chillanes. This communal bank has 19 members who work in agriculture. Enrique is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and passion fruit. He makes his purchases every month in Matilde Esther, and he also makes his sales there as well. He requests a loan to purchase cocoa and passion fruit to plant to expand his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have money to improve his family's standard of living. The challenge that he faces in this harvest time is that the access roads get damaged during the rains. He enjoys participating in the patron saint day festivities in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cocoa and passion fruit to plant to increase his business

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
Aura  María B. Sánchez, es una mujer de 68 años que vive en Cartagena en el barrio los Corales, ella se dedica a las confecciones desde que inició su curso de bordados y gradualmente ha ido agregándole nuevas técnicas, que le han permitido mejorar cada día su talento y nuevas formas de generar mas ingresos aprovechando su cautiva clientela, a quien le vende productos cosméticos, de decoración etc. a través de su guía especializada.

Aura una vez emprendió su negocio ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha obtenido  6 créditos y ha mejorado su capacidad productiva, pues antes confeccionaba a las personas, pero ellas le llevaban  su tela y otros materiales, es decir trabajaba  sobre medidas; Hoy gracias a su crecimiento puede confeccionar comprando materia primas e insumos y proponiendo diseños que ella crea de acuerdo a la moda. Con su credikiva comprará materiales para confeccionar muñecos y adornos navideños en una gran proporción, pues ya tiene pedidos de pequeñas misceláneas y con el resto comprará productos de su revista, que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes.

Su negocio ha cambiado su vida, porque ahora es más independiente, con ello ha logrado aportar a su hogar y a la manutención de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un almacén propio ubicado en su propia casa, donde pueda exhibir sus productos traídos del exterior y trabajar con diseños infantiles.
texts.en:
Aura María B. Sánchez is a 68 year old woman who lives in the Corales neighborhood of Cartagena. She's been manufacturing since she began embroidering and has gradually been adding new techniques. This has allowed her to improve her talent each day. It has also given her new ways to earn income. She has charming customers, to whom she sells cosmetics, decorative items, etc; through her specialized guidance. As soon as Aura started her business, she began working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where she has received six previous loans that have allowed her to improve her production capabilities. She used to do work on request for various people who would deliver their fabrics and materials to her. Today, thanks to her growth, she can buy her own supplies and materials and make whatever she thinks is in style. She will use some of the money from this Kiva loan to buy bulk supplies to make dolls and Christmas ornaments. She already has requests for some miscellaneous items. She will use the rest of the money to buy products from her catalog, as she already has some customer orders. Her business has changed her life because it's made her more independent. It has allowed her to contribute to her household and support her children. Her dream is to have a store out of her home, where she can show the products she has for resale and work with children's designs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa I. is 40 and married with six children whose ages range from 6 to 22 years old. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Leafa has many years of experience in this business. Leafa needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or $250 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2007, Leafa joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leafa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de colaborar con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar hizo que empezara a buscar el modo de agenciarse de algunos ingresos, fue asi como empezó un negocio de venta de pan, ella adquiere pan de una panadería de la zona y lo vente todas las mañanas y las tardes a sus vecinos. El negocio le ha hecho conocida y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que siempre recurren a su vivienda a comprar el producto que ofrecen.

María Esther desea adquirir mas pan para aumentar su nivel de ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Esther es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poner su propia panaderia y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
María Esther is a mother who is 55 years of age. She lives with her husband and children in the District of Chepén, an agricultural area that experiences considerable commercial movement. This district is situated in the Province of Chepén, which is part of La Libertad region, and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

The need to support her family income motivated her to begin looking for ways to generate some income. As a result, she began a business selling bread acquired from a local bakery. She sells every morning and afternoon to her neighbors. Her business has become well-known and she currently has a group of loyal customers who always come by her home to buy the products she offers.

María Esther wants to acquire more bread to increase her sales and eventually her earnings. To accomplish this goal, she decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María Esther is a responsible and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to have her own bakery and provide her family with a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith C. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Bernadith owns and operates a specialized retail store, dealing and selling clothing and shoe products from a supplier in the local community. Bernadith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Bernadith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Bernadith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Ulises De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Ulises de Jesús Jiménez G. es un hombre muy trabajador que por falta de capital no ha podido arreglar el techo de madera de un cuarto que construyo hace tiempo con ahorros propios. En este momento el requiere de su apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto;  ya que en temporada de lluvia el agua se trasmina y cada día la madera se va deteriorando pero para que no siga con este problema el necesita de un préstamo para comprar el material.
texts.en:
Mr. Ulises de Jesús Jiménez G. is a very hard working man who for lack of funds hasn’t been able to repair the wood roof of a room he built some time ago with his own savings.

He needs help to complete his projects because during the rainy season water filters in and every day the wood deteriorates more.  In order to stop this process he needs a loan to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.use: To repair wood roof.

loans.name: Luzmarie

texts.en:
Luzmarie M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Golden Rosary, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   trisikad transport, food vending and livestock. Her husband Ricarido, who is 50 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 14 to 24 years old. Luzmarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzmarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to do some maintenance work in her food stall at the local school canteen and purchase goods to resell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Luzmarie M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Luzmarie is shown in the accompanying photo posing with the trisikad (bicycle with a sidecar for passengers) that is one of her sources of income in addition to her food vending and livestock raising activities.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF),is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her canteen

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two children. She studied until the fourth year of primary school.

She works as a traveling salesperson, selling lamb meat. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, and she invested the money in her business selling groceries, which is the business activity she was involved in at that time. 

She is now asking for 1,500 PEN, money that will allow her to increase the capital of her business selling lamb meat. 

Her dream is to have a butcher's shop. Her favorite aspect about the Communal Bank is the camaraderie between the bank members.

loans.use: Increase the capital of her business selling lamb meat

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira, a talented lady, supports her family by sewing for neighborhood customers. A resident of Kamoki, Pakistan, a city famous for its rice industry, she lives there in the area named Hajveri Muhallah in a two-room brick house with her family.

Sabira, the mother of two sons and three daughters, is married to M. I., who operates a laundry business that provides both washing and pressing services. He has been in business for over 10 years, and his shop is located in a nearby market. Their elder son helps his father in the business, while their elder daughter does sewing works and assists Sabira in filling orders on time. The remaining children are enrolled in school.

Sabira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy an iron and washing products such as surf and bleach and provide better services to his clients. Sabira is hopeful that this investment will be productive and earn him more income.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is Sabira's fourth loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in previous loan years and attended every meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sabira.

loans.use: To buy an iron & washing products for laundry business

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es: Yrene, D. 32 años, convive, con Orlando, que también tiene 32 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Luis, D. 10, Joel, D. 6 y Sole, D. 4 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en L. comunidad D. Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Hace 5 años que viene dedicándose al noble oficio D. L. agricultura, pues todas las mañanas hasta que anochece, se dedica al cuidado D. sus  plantaciones D. café y plátanos, los que constantemente los cuida, cultiva. Lo que más le gusta a elL., es poder verlos crecer y desarrollarse; pero las constantes plagas y hierbas que azotan sus plantaciones, le desagradan. Pero Irene no se amilana por ello, según afirma, “son dificultades que tienen que pasar”, ya que su esfuerzo es recompensado en cada venta que hace a los compradores que visitan constantemente su zona. Por ello más adelante tienen planes D. mejorar sus sembríos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está segura que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo podrá salir adelante junto a su banco comunal. D. adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar una mochiL. fumigadora y bolsas negras para embolsar las plantas D. café para L. producción D. su vivero.
texts.en: Yrene, age 32, lives together with Orlando, who is also 32. Together they have 3 children: Luis, age 10; Joel, age 6; and Sole, age 4. As a family unit, they live in their own house, located in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar (in Peru's central rain forest). For the past five years, she has dedicated herself to the noble profession of agriculture. Every morning until night falls, she works taking care of her coffee and banana plantations, constantly cultivating and taking care of them. What she likes most is seeing how her crops grow and develop, but she dislikes the pests and weeds that constantly plague her plantations. Yet Yrene is not discouraged by this; according to her, "they are difficulties that have to be gone through," since her efforts are repaid in every sale she makes to the buyers who regularly visit the zone. For this reason, she has plans for the future to improve her crops. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is sure that with great effort and work she will be able to get ahead, together with her communal bank. After acquiring the loan she is requesting, she plans to buy a fumigating backpack unit and black bags to cover her coffee plants, to improve the production of her plant nursery.

loans.use: Buying a fumigating backpack unit and black bags

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal hace 10 años y le gustan las reuniones y las charlas. Ella tiene 51años, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció,  pero fruto de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos, todos mayores y uno de ellos vive con ella. La menor de sus hijas vive  en Guayaquil y aun esta también a su cargo ya que es soltera.
 
Es maestra en una escuela de la localidad, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta el cual lo realiza todos los días ya que en su lugar de trabajo también aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeros de trabajo. Además tiene en su casa un taller de ebanistería en el que atiende su hijo el cual trabaja con la ayuda de dos operarios, trabajan en esto a base de pedidos de clientes y de almacenes que les solicitan sus obras. Compra sus mercaderías en Guayaquil y lo que es materia prima en Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, madera y otros productos para fabricar los muebles. Su sueño es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'La Unión Hace La Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make.  They are well known around country.

Rosa has been a member of the community bank for 10 years.  She likes the meetings and the talks.  She is 51 years old.  Several years ago her beloved husband died.  She has four children from that relationship.  Her children are now all grown up but one still lives with her.  Her youngest daughter lives in Guayaquil and is still in her care as she is not married.

Rosa is a teacher in a local school.  She also has a business selling all kinds of clothes and shoes.  She sells her goods door to door and works every day since she also takes advantage of being in her work place to sell to her work colleagues.  In her home, Rosa also has a cabinet making workshop in which her son works with the help of two other workers.  They work on customer orders and also for stores who request their work.  They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil and raw materials in Portoviejo.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, wood and other products for making furniture.  Rosa's dream is to fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, wood and other products for making furniture

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en: Mamoun is a young man from Tulkarem city. Mamoun works in a sewing workshop in the morning and fixes electrical machines. Mamoun is married and a father. He was able to buy an apartment after years of savings. Now he started putting final touches on the house, such as painting walls, installing washbowls and sinks. In order to pay for the installations and painting, Mamoun came to FATEN and took a loan to cover the cost. Mamoun wants to finish fixing the house to be able to move in next year. Mamoun appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: To put the final touches on his house such as painting and installing washbowls

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre y hermana en  uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas: por un lado cuanta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino, las cuales cría en diversos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El usualmente comercializa sus ovejas a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general y también vende la leche que producen sus vacas. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento para realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio. De modo que pueda percibir mayores ingresos y pueda seguir ayudando a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, single, and lives with her husband and sister in one of the villages that make up the District of Las Lomas, an agricultural district that is part of the region of Piura. This community is located more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

He works in different farming activities. José raises a few heads of cattle and sheep that he keeps in different pens located near his home. He usually sells the sheep to local merchants and to the general public as well as the milk produced by his cows. In addition, he works as a laborer on farms in the area. The income he earns from these activities is used to help move his family forward.

José wants to acquire more animals and feed so that he can make some improvements to his business. This will allow him to earn more income and continue helping his family. To accomplish this goal, he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Mrs. Kann T. is married and lives in Trapeang Chhuk village, which is located in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she supports her family by growing rice. She also runs a business on the side selling floor mats. Her husband, Mr. Bun Thoeun Ya, works in construction in Phnom Penh city, which is quite far from their home. In order to see her husband more often, she has applied for a loan to buy a new motorbike. She and her husband have three children, two of whom attend the local public school. Their youngest child is not yet old enough to go to school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Yolanda Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.
