It was founded in 1942, and it is the largest ice cream company that has a presence in the entire country. Sofía Inés Amplié C. started selling ice cream and food to businesses near her house. They closed, so she set up a bakery. She makes doughnuts and pastries. Lidia Dávila sells chocolate bananas, ice cream, cheese slices, and enchiladas on the week ends. She sells at the church.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Eskimo products

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio ABEL pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero.

El socio estudia la carrera profesional Turismo en el Instituto Superior “ESITUR”. El actualmente es practicante en un agencia de viajes como counter, brinda información a los turistas acerca de los paquetes de viajes como de Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Vilcabamba, etc. 

El socio requiere el préstamo para sus estudios y para comprar un equipo de viaje pues es necesario para sus prácticas como guía de turismo. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ABEL, 25, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; he is from the city of Cusco and is single. He is a student at the "ESITUR" Superior Institute, majoring in Tourism. He is currently working as an intern at the counter in a travel agency. He offers tourist information on package tours to Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Vilcabamba, etc. He needs financing to pay for his studies and to buy camping equipment that is required for his field assignments as a tourist guide. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses and to buy camping equipment.

loans.name: Salome

texts.pt:
Salomé nasceu em Gaza tem 44 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de 2 filhas com idades compreendidas entre os 23 aos 25 anos, nenhuma das duas encontra se a estudar, pois trabalham todas juntas. Para alêm das suas filhas responsabiliza se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Salomé estudou ate a 4ª classe porque onde frequentava só terminava naquele nível de escolaridade, então seu professor leva a ela alegando que ia arranjar uma vaga numa outra Escola e este abusa dela (estupro) e a engravida. Salomé fica desesperada com a situação e a sua mãe manda lhe embora de casa. Sai de Gaza para vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Swazilândia com sua amiga a procura de emprego. Chegado a Namaacha começa a trabalhar no Governo do Distrito como servente, mas devido à doença do século (SIDA) ela teve que abandonar o emprego porque a descriminavam no seu sector de trabalho. Os anos foram passando Salomé começa a trabalhar com plantas de varias espécies tais como, (azaléias, antores e catos), pois são fáceis de multiplicar e ela tem muito jeito para jardinagem e cultiva um lindo jardim em sua casa. Hoje é uma das mais famosas da região, vendendo flores ate para pessoas da capital Maputo ganhando por mês aproximadamente 8.000.00MT porque para além de vender ela tem contratos de jardinagem com proprietários de quintas na vila e na cidade de Maputo. Por mês consegue poupar uma média de 2.000.00MT.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Salome na Hluvuku e Kiva. O primeiro de  15.000.00MT foi usado para comprar plantas e pesticidas para melhorar a sua coleção de flores,este segundo de 10.000.00MT será usado para aumentar as plantas e a multiplicação das outras. Esta confiante que vai melhorar muito no seu negócio e deste modo reembolsar sem nenhum problema, pois conta com ajuda das suas duas filhas.
texts.en:
Salome was born in Gaza she is 44 years old and is single, she has 2 daughters who are 23 and 25 years old, neither of them are studying, because they work together. Besides her daughters Salome supports her grandchildren who live with her. Salome studied until the 4th grade because at her school that was the last grade available, then her teacher took her saying they were going to get a space available at another school and he abused of her (raped her) and she got pregnant. Salome was desperate with the situation and her mother sends her away. She left Gaza to live in Namaacha at the frontier with Swazilandia with a friend to try to get a job. When she arrived to Namaacha she started working at the Government District as a maid, but due to the illness of the century (AIDS) she had to leave the job because she was discriminated at her work place. With time Salomen started working with plants several species like (azaleas, antores and catos), because they are easy to multiply and she has a very good hand for gardening, she has a beautiful garden. Today she is one of the most famous gardeners in the region, she sells flowers even for people in the capital and is able to get an income of 2.000MT. This is the second loan for Salome from Hluvuku and Kiva. The first one of 15.000MT was used to buy plants and pesticides to improve her flower collection, this second loan for 10.000MT is to increase the plants and produce more. She is confident she will improve a lot her business and this way she will pay without any problem because she counts with her daughters help.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sales of plants and flowers and gardening

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A. is from the village of Sinonoc,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Julieta is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noneluna

texts.en: Noneluna L. is from the village of Sulangon. She is 37 years old. Noneluna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Noneluna owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Noneluna has been engaged in her business for over 9 years with approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP from these activities. In 2009, Noneluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noneluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Noneluna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noneluna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth R.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has eight children (some are adults and some are students). She is from the village of Miputak. Janeth has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Janeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
LA SRA DONATILA, INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" FORMADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS, HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO, EN RECONOCIMIENTO A SU DEDICACIÓN, RESPONSABILIDAD,PUNTUALIDAD Y TRABAJO CON EL GRUPO.
LA SRA. DONATILA TIENE 44 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA HACE 20 AÑOS A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS QUE TRAE D. PROVINCIA Y  OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS COMO TAMBIÉN A BASE D. UNA LISTA D. PEDIDOS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA HA PODIDO EDUCAR A SUS HIJOS Y APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO. APOYARÁ PROXIMAMENTE A SU HIJO MENOR CON LOS GASTOS PARA INGRESAR A UNA UNIVERSIDAD.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO EN UN FUTURO CERCANO ESTUDIAR UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL.
texts.en:
Donatila is a member of the Siempre Adelante group, which is comprised of eight residents of the Comas district. She was elected president of the group by her colleagues in recognition of her dedication, responsibility, punctuality, and work with the group. Donatila is 44 and has two children. She has been selling food products for 20 years. She gets them in Provincia, and she offers them to her relatives and friends. She also sells by orders. By this work she has been able to educate her children and help her husband economically. Soon she will support her youngest child with the costs of enrolling in a university. It would really please him to study for a professional career in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Mrs. Candelaria S., 62 years of age, is married and a resident of P5 Silangit, Tangub City. She has been selling snacks for two years already. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month, which is so helpful in supporting them and meeting their daily needs. She is not depending solely on the income of her husband, who is a carpenter earning an average of 2,400 PHP a week only. With her good credit record and capacity to pay, she has been given the privilege of availing a loan of 8,000 PHP for her second loan cycle. She proposes to purchase a manual rice grinder and use the additional capital for the purchase of ingredients for her snack business. The additional income resulting from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs and for loan repayments and savings for their future use. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a manual rice grinder and as additional capital for her snack vending activity

loans.name: Romely

texts.en:
Romely S. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Romely is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Romely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Romely has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Romely is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Romely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josphine Jemutai

texts.en:
Josphine Jemutai S. is a 39-year old mother of four, married to a man named Mathew Rugut. 

Josphine has been a farmer in Lemoru, Eldoret for the last four years. She plants mainly maize, both for home consumption and for resale. Most of her clients are her neighbors. Josphine was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be Josphine's first loan from KADET and she plans to use the entire loan for the current season’s maize planting.

Josphine's goal is to expand her farm, educate her children to higher levels, and to buy a tractor that will make her digging work easier every planting season.

loans.use: For maize farming.

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie G. is a 43 year-old widow who supports her family by running a general store business. She lives in Balo Aguisan Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, and has 5 school-aged children, between 8 & 22 years old.
 
She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Lynie is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can have additional capital for her general store. This will be her 20th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lynie  aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
M. Ronald appears on the left in the photo; the person on the right is a credit officer.

Ronald is the 44-year-old married father of five children. All his children are in school, though he subsists on a lowly source of income which is selling phone accessories. He has been doing this business for the last eleven years in Nazigo, Kayunga.

With this experience, Ronald has managed to weather the financial storms that have afflicted his business over this period of time. In a month, he reveals he makes profits amounting to 90,000 shillings.

Ronald’s future plan is to go wholesale. He wants the assistance of this loan to help him buy new phone accessories like batteries and chargers.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories like batteries and chargers

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en: Leslie C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 38 years old. Leslie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leslie runs a small sari-sari (variety) store and grows and sells seaweed. Leslie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Leslie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leslie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leslie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her store and to expand her seaweed business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Leslie from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent new plots of land.

loans.name: Willian Alexis

texts.es:
el sr. Willian Alexis G. D. se dedica al comercio cuenta con mas de 1 año de experiencia,  
se caracteriza por ser un joven muy dinamico y emprendedor, esta casado y por los momentos no tiene hijos.
mientras tanto se esta preparando para cuando sea el tiempo de tener hijos, su 
negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de mayor influencia comercial sus ventas las realiza al por mayor 
y al detalle, sus productos los compra en la vecina republica de Nicaragua ya que es barato y le queda mas cerca
ya que el vive en el Municipo de Las Trojes y queda fronterizo con Nicaragua. 
El Sr. Willian G. utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia lo que le permitira vender mas producto.
ahora no tendra la necesidad de estar viajando mas seguido a Nicaragua,  con esto ahorrara gastos en la adquisicion de productos y tener mejores porcentajes de utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Willian Alexis G. D. has over a year of experience in the trade business. He is a very dynamic and enterprising young man. He is married and does not have children as of now. While he prepares for the time to come when he does have children, his business is located in a strategic place to greater commercially influence his sales in wholesale and retail. He buys his products in the neighboring republic of Nicaragua. It is cheap and closer since he lives in the Municipalities of the Trojan and it is on the border with Nicaragua. Mr. Willian G. D. will use the credit to buy more merchandise, allowing him to sell more products. Now he will not have to travel as often to Nicaragua. With this acquisition of products, he will save money and have better profit percentages as a result.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots, pans, pitchers, jugs, kettles and rubber sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up on cereals for resale

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
Miguel Eduardo A. T. tiene 33 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Jeferson (1). 

Miguel  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuya para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción del negocio. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta criar chanchos.
texts.en:
Miguel Eduardo A. T. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the village of San Jose Estero Salado. Has a son named Jefferson. Michael is a member of the rural bank "Fronteras Unidas" which is located fifteen minutes from the village Estero Salado and two hours from Chillanes. This communal bank has 19 members and most are farmers. Miguel is a farmer who cultivates cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases and sales in Esther Matilda every month. He is taking out a loan to buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and to grow his business. Miguel thinks that the loan is an opportunity for him to get ahead and he dreams of increasing production. At harvest time he faces challenges because the access roads get damaged by rain. He likes raising pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and grow his business.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is a hardworking farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 2½ and 6. His eldest child is attending school. 

Tonui has been farming for the last three years and has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a retail shop in the same area.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him educate his children and take them to a better school. He faces, however, the challenge of a lack of artificial-insemination services, which leads to less improved breeds.

In five years time, he hopes to have increased his farm. He also hopes that Juhudi will make bigger loans available in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal El Roble y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser puntual y ahorrar.
Erika es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Erika tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, tiene 9 maquinas, ella se encarga de la atención todos los días. Además Erika tiene un carro que realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Erika tiene proyectado vender artículos de librería en el mismo local.
Erika solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles.
Los sueños de Erika son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank and while being a member has learned how to be punctual and how to save. She has a live-in partner and two children. She has 9 Internet access booths installed in her home; she is open for business every day. In addition, Erika has a car that provides public transportation services in the city of Ayacucho. She intends to sell stationery items in her locale. She is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils and paper. Erica’s dream is to improve her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, paper.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
En el Carmen de Bolívar, municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Cartagena vive Sandra M., mujer propietaria de la “Sala de belleza y peluquería Sandra”, ubicada a 100 metros del mercado local de esta población; desde allí ofrece servicios de peluquería,   corte de cabellos para damas y también  vende   productos de bellezas.
 Sandra tiene 3 hijos de 5 a 11 años, y está solicitando su credikiva que es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque  comprará tintes para el cabello, shampoo, silicona y productos capilares en general; también invertirá en el arreglo de una carpa y una silla que requieren mantenimiento.  Con su primer crédito con esta organización, logró comprar  productos de belleza para utilizarlos en su trabajo y también para la venta;  pintó el salón de belleza donde funciona, compró un lava cabezas, una plancha un secador y varios cepillos.
Sus metas mas adelante es ampliar el salón, tener otra empleada para los fines de semana, hacer una especialización en cosmetología y masajes y  ofrecer una gran variedad  de productos que día a día hagan crecer su clientela para lograr sostenerse en el mercado con buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra M. lives in El Carmen de Bolívar, a town that is very close to the city of Cartagena. She owns “Sandra’s Beauty Salon and Barber Shop,” located about 100 meters from the town’s local market. She offers all kinds of hair care services, women’s haircuts. She also sells beauty products. Sandra has three children ranging from 5 to 11 years of age. She is asking for this Kiva loan, which is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to buy hair dyes, shampoo, silicone and various hair care products. She will also invest in a tent and a chair that require maintenance. She used her first loan from this organization to buy beauty products to use in her work and also to sell. She painted the beauty salon where she works, bought a hair washing sink, a hair straightening comb, a hair dryer and several brushes. Her future goal is to enlarge her salon and hire an employee for the weekends. She also wants to study a cosmetology and massage course and offer a wide variety of products that will lead to daily customer increase in order to thrive in the marketplace and earn good income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, shampoo, silicone and various hair care products; she will also invest in a tent and a chair that need maintenance.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta M. is from the village of Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Crisanta owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily fish, crabs and shrimp, for sale. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: José Nolberto

texts.es:
José Nolberto tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como limón, mango y maracuyá, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte), el brinda su servicio dentro del distrito en donde vive y en los caseríos de las zonas aledañas. Su servicio tiene bastante acogida de clientes debido a la rapidez y al bajo costo. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

José Nolberto se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su mototaxi, la cual ha venido sufriendo algunos daños producto del constante uso y del mal estado de las carreteras del lugar.

José es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose Nolberto is 36 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone that produces mainly fruits such as limes, mangos and passion fruit. He is a resident of the province of Lambayeque and is located an hour and forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He works transporting passengers and freight on a mototaxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to perform the work of transport). He provides service within the district where he lives and in the town in the surrounding areas. His service is well-received by his clients because of the speed and low cost. The income he receives from this activity is used to pay for his personal expenses and to help his parents with the support of the family finances. 

Jose Nolberto is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles that he plans to invest in repairing and maintaining his mototaxi , which has suffered some damage resulting from the constant use and the bad condition of the roads. 

Jose is hard-working and earnest. Previously, he has had loans from Epydme Alternativa and has been punctual and responsible in his payments.

loans.use: expenses for repair and maintainance of his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena K. is a married woman who lives in Tinago, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband, Nicaster K., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 21 and 24 years old. Lorena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped in uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and pay off all of her outstanding debts, while still sustaining her family's needs. Lorena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Massogblé

texts.fr: massogblé est une femme de 27 ans , elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle fait le lavage à sec. le nom de sa boutique est "ETS HOLLY WOOD". actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est élevée,elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter les produits nécessaires à son activité de lavage.
texts.en: Massogblé is a  27-year old woman; she is married and has one child. She has started her own  dry cleaning business. The name of her store is “Hollywood, Inc.” At present, customer demand is high. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase the materials needed for her business.

loans.use: Purchasing materials needed for the dry cleaning business

loans.name: Aleman Florida Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Alemán Florida” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de ropa de segunda mano, compra venta de ovejas, venta de coca, tienda de barrio, venta de arena, viaje a provincia llevando fruta, venta de fruta, venta de cordero. Esta banca comunal esta dirigida por una mesa directiva entusiasta que pueso a su banco comunal el nombre de la zona en la que viven. 

La señora Francisca cumple el rol de tesorera de la banca comunal, esta casada, tuvo un hijo, quien ahora ya tiene su propio hogar.  Indica que forma parte del B.C. “Aleman Florida” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud.  La señora Francisca tiene como negocio la venta de ropa de segunda mano, en la zona 12 de Octubre, todos los días en la tarde.  Inició este negocio hace 4 años viendo a otros negociantes y como hacen el negocio de compra – venta.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Alemán Florida” community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office.  It is a new group which has formed to receive loan services, training and health services.  It has eight female members.  The women's businesses are varied: selling used clothes, buying and selling sheep, selling coca, neighborhood store, selling sand, travelling out of town to sell fruit, selling fruit and selling lamb.  This community bank is led by an enthusiastic executive committee which has given the bank the name of the district where they all live.

Francisca is the bank's treasurer.  She is married and has one child who now has their own home.  She tells us that she joined the “Alemán Florida” community bank after being invited to do so by the Pro Mujer promoters who came to her district to let people know about their loan services, training and health services.  Francisca's business is selling used clothes in the 12 de Octubre district every afternoon.  She started this business 4 years ago as she watched other traders and saw how they carried out their buying and selling businesses.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that it was the training sessions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou O. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 32 years old. Marilou is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a retail business running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food to the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to be able to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lady, ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, pero uno de ellos falleció hace algunos años lo cual le llena de tristeza a nuestra amiga. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, en la actualidad con ella vive un nieto el cual tiene 10 años que está en escuela y es como su hijo. Su marido es jubilado.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida,  prepara almuezas pero solo bajo pedido y para entregar, con esto ella no desperdicia nada ya que prepara lo necesario para la venta del día, esto lo realiza de lunes a sábado, también prepara comida y bocadillos para eventos y fiestas, trabaja con la ayuda de una señora a la cual ella le paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
At the Rocafuente community, the members of the community bank La Union Hace la Fuerza (United We Stand) meet every fifteen days.  This area is known for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are famous in the whole country.

At this place we find Mrs. Lady, she is 66 years old, is married and has five children, one of whom passed away some years ago which has filled her with sadness.  All her children are grown and currently a grandchild lives with her who is 10 years old and is in school.  He is like a son to her.  Her husband is retired.

She dedicates her time to preparing and selling meals.  She makes lunches on order and for delivery.  Since she makes only what she will sell during the day, she does not have any waste.  She sells from Monday through Saturday. She also makes meals and sandwiches for events and parties.  She works with the help of a lady whom she pays weekly.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for the making of her food.  Her dream is to own a great restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase rice, fish and general supplies.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: K. Gorreti has a retail shop in Bwizi trading centre. She is 32 years old and married with 6 children. In her shop, she sells items including flour, soft drinks, sugar, and rice. On average, she is able to make 30,000/= weekly profit and since she is a determined lady, she believes this will increase. Her dream is to have a stable and growing business and improve her family's standard of living. Gorreti needs a loan to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Jorge Benjamin

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en uno de los caserios que conforman el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente limón y  maracuyá, se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi  (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) el cuenta con una clientela estable y brinda su servicio entre su localidad y el pueblo central de Olmos. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con sus gastos económicos.

Jorge desea realizar algunas reparaciones en su unidad móvil para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento ya que su vehículo ha empezado a experimentar algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old, single, and lives at the home of his parents located in one of the villages that make up the District of Olmos, an agricultural area known for producing mainly lemons and passion fruit. This area lies in the Province of Lambayque and is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jorge provides transportation services with a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a cabin for transporting cargo and passengers). He has a stable customer base and offers his services within his town and the central village of Olmos. The income he generates is used to meet his personal expenses and support his family with their expenses.

Jorge needs to repair his vehicle so that it functions properly. It has started to experience a few mechanical failures due to excessive use and the poor conditions of the local roads. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn O. owns and manages a small rice field. She has been growing rice for 10 years already. She has two children. Her eldest child is 8 years old. It is her desire to continue to earn her livelihood and be able to support the needs of her children.

Receiving a loan from CEVI will help her buy seeds and fertilizers. In doing this, she will be able to increase her harvest. 

Analyn is 29 years old and she continues to do her best to improve the economic living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba G. is a petty trader from Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. For the past five years, she has been selling an assortment of products. She is mobile – she carries her goods from village to village. Aba is married to a farmer and they have five children. The income she earns is used to pay for their children’s school fees and for household expenses. 

With a loan, Aba hopes to grow her business and set up her own stall some day. The picture shows Aba on her normal rounds with a few clothes, Pampers and a bag.

loans.use: To grow her business and set up her own store some day

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es agricultor lleva años en esta actividad el cual le brinda muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas y personales, sus cosechas lo lleva  a las distintas ferias que se realizan en el Valle Sagrado y los mercados de Cusco como el mercado de Huancaro, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en esta actividad.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and departament of Cuzco.

The member is Alejandro. He is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. He has 2 children. He is a farmer and has been for years. This brings him a lot of economic and personal satisfaction. His harvests bring him to various fairs in the Valle Sagrado and to the markets of Cuzco, such as the market of Huancaro. He works together with his wife, and they have done this activity for years.  

The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his plot of land. 

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his plot of land.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and none of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication. 

She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for a few months and she works seven days a week. She sells her products from home.  Her main business challenges are transportation and the rainy season.

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. Her goal is to become a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Elvira is widowed and has six adult children. Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling beverages, junk food, chocolate & milk powder drinks, biscuits & breads in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2005, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 16,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk food. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 32 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three adult children. Mary Grace owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for her general store. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: 13 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Thi N. Thị (69) is a 61 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thi is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 13 Đông Vệ (08.01.13 Đông Vệ).

Thi is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Thi owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Thi has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Tâm (70) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

2.  N. Thị Hương (71) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 47 years old and runs a school in her community. She is a good administrator and runs her school very well. She believes in a good quality education and that's why she works very hard in making her school better. 

She is married by status and her husband operates a business selling paint boxes. Farzana has four children. Her eldest son works in a police department while others are young and getting their education. 

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her school. With the loan, she will buy furniture which will help her provide better sitting arrangements for the students of her school. 

She has been running this school for past 10 years and hopes that by providing better facilities to her students she will be able to gain much respect and earn a good profit. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Farzana.

loans.use: to buy furniture for a school

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling  fish. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF and dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Sorry For Me I I Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sorry For Me II” Group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Idrissa is the leader of this group. Idrissa is 40 years old and married with seven children – four in primary school and three in secondary school. Idrissa is a local dealer in gold. He also sells rice and palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil). With his share of this loan, Idrissa is going to buy gold, rice and palm oil to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy gold, rice and palm oil to add to his business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years. Zenaida earns additional  income from boarding house rentals and from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall.  Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall

loans.name: Adriana Ximena

texts.es:
La Señorita. Adriana es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

La Señorita. Adriana tiene 18 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al negocio de venta de helados, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a estudiar, se encuentra cursando el último año del colegio y cuando no está estudiando se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Miss Adriana is a member of the “Sentimiento” (Feelings) Community Bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is a place that is visited a lot, thanks to its good food, beautiful architecture, business people, farm animals and agriculture. The area’s best feature is the warm and friendly people. 
Miss Adriana is eighteen years old. She lives with her parents, who work selling ice cream. They rent their house. 
This member is still in school. She is in her last year of high school. When she isn’t studying she sells cosmetics and clothes. She has been doing this business for the past two years. She sells to her friends and acquaintances.
This is her first loan with the community bank. She is going to use the loan to buy cosmetics in order to grow her business.
Her goal is to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Robert Ngugi

texts.en:
Robert is a married man with four children aged between 18 and 26. He runs a tailoring services business in Nairobi specializing in making men's suits.  He has been in this business for 23 years now and says his major challenge is financial constraints.
Robert is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy materials to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and open a shop specializing in selling materials for making clothes. He also hopes to take good care of his family and provide for all their needs. He describes himself as aggressive, determined and God-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is 31 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Mastula has a small retail shop business that sells spare parts. She has had this business for 7 years.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Mastula hopes to expand her business. Mastula is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Fátima Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Fátima del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada originaria de Niquinomo. Ella es docente y comerciante de prendas de oro, plata y bisutería desde hace 6 años donde vende aproximadamente 5,000 cordobas mensuales e invierte 4,000 cordobas mensuales.
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería como pulseras, anillos, cadenas, brazaletes…etc.
texts.en: Fátima del Carmen is a hard-working and driven woman originally from Niquinomo. She is an elementary school teacher and has been a dealer of gold, silver, and costume jewelry pieces for the past 6 years, bringing in roughly 5,000 Nicaraguan Córdobas [NIO] monthly, 4,000 [NIO] of which she puts back into her business. With this loan, she will buy additional merchandise such as bracelets, rings, and chains.

loans.use: to stock gold, silver, and costume jewelry pieces.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 51 years-old and married with 4 children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells Avon products in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying & selling Avon products for 4 years and also earns an income from sari-sari storing.

Ninfa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
A sus 36 años de edad, Mariluz es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, una tienda donde vende todo tipo de tarjetas, peluches, chocolates y detalles para todo tipo de ocasión. El oficio lo aprendió hace muchos años, pues se ha dedicado a vender en almacenes y afirma que las ventas son una pasión para ella por lo que hace 1 año decidió emprender un nuevo negocio.

Mariluz es una luchadora incansable que espera tener mas clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtidos y con gran variedad. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición, ya que en un futuro su almacén puede ser una legado para sus 2 hijos

Actualmente Mariluz necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas.
texts.en:
At 36 years of age, Mariluz is an entrepreneur who is dedicated to her business, a store where she sells all sorts of cards, plush toys, chocolates, and small items for any type of occasion. She learned this trade many years ago, since she had been selling in stores. She says that sales are a passion for her and for that reason one year ago she decided to start a new business.  

Mariluz is a tireless worker who hopes to have more clients and more economic possibilities to have her store stocked with a great variety of items. This entrepreneur considers her work to be a blessing because in the future her store can be a legacy to her two children. 

Currently Mariluz needs a loan to buy merchandise so that she can increase her commercial capability proportionally increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Milo

texts.en:
Milo is 48 and has two school-age children. They live happily in a village planting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. As a responsible father, he aimed to earn more income to satisfy the family's needs and to support the education of the children. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, he aimed to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income.

To accomplish this, he is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that this loan will help a lot to make his business grow and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to sell a larger variety of  food

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 42 years old, married, and has four siblings. 

To make a living, Ellen buys and sells banana products. Ellen has been in her business for two years and she earns 20,000 PHP per month from this work.

For almost a year, Ellen is been a member of GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fruits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and expand her buy and sell business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frenquentam a Escola e o outro é dificiente. Fez a 2º ano da Univercidade Pedagógica e não continuou por falta de tempo.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Marracuene  para o Distrito de Boane em missão de serviço, é professora ha mais de 25 anos leciona na EPC de Boane e tem um salário de 3.710.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.500.00mt e 12.500.00mt e foi para a obra da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa e construir um murro, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Antonieta was born in the district of Marracuene in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school, and 1 is disabled.  She finished studying through her second year at the teaching college and didn't continue due to the lack of time. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother, who lives with her. 

She left Marracuene for the district of Boane because of a military assignment.  She has been a teacher for more than 25 years and teaches at the EPC in Boane.  She makes 3,710 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of our institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials to continue working on her home (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).  Her first 2 loans were for 12,500 meticals each, and she also put these towards the work on her home.  

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future, she plans to finish the construction on her home and to build a wall, for which she is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to continue work on her home (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He’s the main income provider of the family. He has owned a laundry for the past 26 years. His work is specialized in ironing clothes, textiles, curtain etc, in addition to cleaning them using particular products. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. In that way, he will avoid having any financiA. problem with the school management and will allow his children to pursue their education properly.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la mecánica, tiene un laboratorio de bombas inyectoras desde hace varios años, lo que hace en forma conjunta con su padre el Sr.Francisco.
Su lugar de trabajo se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de la Ciudad de Itá, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, lo cual lo ayuda mucho, pues eso le genera muy buenos ingresos. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora que a su corta edad ya se encuentra manejando su propio negocio.
Nos comenta que su meta es seguir creciendo cada día mas, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de herramientas para utilizar dentro de su taller, pues son muy importantes para que siga trabajando.
texts.en: Hugo, 25, lives in the city of Itá.  He is a mechanic.  He’s had an injection pump lab for several years that he runs together with his father.  His workplace is located in a strategic spot in the city of Itá where he has a large number of customers which is great help to him because it generates good income.  He defines himself as a hardworking person who at his young age is already running his own business.  He comments that his goal is to continue growing more every day so is asking for a loan to buy work tools to use in his shop because they are very important in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Mulimani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulimani Group in Western Kenya! Phoebe is the facilitator of the Mulimani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Phoebe takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phoebe had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phoebe was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phoebe and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Phoebe will educate her children, save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mulimani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak is 30 years old, a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. 

She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Nyanluak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como compra y venta de ovejas y tambien cria cuyes,ella lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita le credito para comprar animales como cuyes y ovejas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana now has a business raising animals. She buys and sells sheep and guinea pigs. The animals are sold at different fairs that exist within the District of Anta. Through this business, Juana is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell animals. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy animals, such as guinea pigs and sheep.

Juana is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
This is Haydee, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Patocinio, a tinsmith, and she is mother to her five children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Haydee operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Haydee hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is a 30-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from one year to seven years. He describes himself to be a caring and loving man. He operates a retail stall where he sells metal items such as boxes, gutters, etc . He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy metal items. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and cater for his family's financial needs. Zakaria also farms, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy metal items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock and agriculture.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: I am a 33-year-old mother of four. I take care of 2 other orphared children.The loan will improve  My life because I will increase my income which will enable me to pay school fees for the 2 children in secondary school. I  loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $3 a day.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced and raises her 5-year-old daughter by herself. She has to work very hard to provide for all the needs of her family. Oksana runs a little store selling baked goods, candy, and sweets at the local market in Dniprorudnyi, Ukraine. Her store is well known in the town because it provides the best assortment of food items that can please any sweet-tooth.

Oksana is a focused hard worker. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Her motivation in life and in business is to be successful. Oksana has benefited greatly from the financial assistance she has received through Nadiya Ukraine, and she tells many people about the available lending services.

Oksana is hoping to get a loan for $1,200 to buy some new equipment for her store. She believes that upgrading her facilities will help guarantee sustainability for her business and provide a stable income for her family. We believe that flexibility, loyalty, and the ability to handle challenges are some of the characteristics demonstrated by this young entrepreneur that will help her repay this loan and will secure the future success of her business.

Оксана – розлучена. Вона самостійно виховує 5-річну донечку. Оксана змушена наполегливо працювати для того, щоб забезпечити потреби власної родини. Вона – власниця невеличкої крамнички з продажу випічки, цукерок та солодощів на місцевому ринку в м. Дніпрорудний. Її крамничка відома у місті, тому що саме в неї можна знайти найкращий асортимент товарів харчування, які будуть до смаку будь-якому солодкоїжці. Оксана – наполеглива та працьовита. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже більше 5 років. Вона прагне досягти успіху в роботі та житті. Фінансова підтримка, яку Оксана отримала від „Надії України”, дуже позитивно відбилася на розвитку її бізнесу. Оксана багатьом людям зараз розповідає про доступні кредитні послуги. Оксана сподівається отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове обладнання для своєї крамниці. Вона вважає, що модернізація приміщення гарантуватиме стабільність та прибуток для її бізнесу. Ми віримо, що гнучкість, вірність та здатність долати перешкоди – це самі ті якості Оксани, які допоможуть їй сплатити цю позику та забезпечать подальший успіх її бізнесу.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her store

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem V. is 47 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She makes mortars and pestles with her husband. They have 5 children,  three of whom are still students. They earn two USD per day. They need to purchase rocks, stones and other tools to expand their business and increase their profit.

More information from our field partner, CREDIT:

"Originally, this is a photo of her husband because V. Sem was unavailable when we visited. Another point,  this couple can generate around $2 each; two of their children typically earn $4/day from working at the garment factory, and one of whom is a mechanic who makes up to $3/day, while other two attend school. I’m writing to make more details about this family’s revenue. And the picture taken is at their house."

loans.use: To purchase rock, stones and other tools to expand her business

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: At age 25, married with two children, Mrs. Thon C. lives with her husband in Kompung Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, C. works on her plot of land raising pigs and growing vegetables, earning about US$ 6 each day. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi, earning around $5 a day. He has recently decided that he would like to have a car as a taxi instead, which he thinks would enable him to earn more than in his current business. With this aim in mind, the couple has applied for a loan to purchase a used car to use to operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a used car to operate a taxi

loans.name: Ablam Renaud

texts.fr:
Ablam Renaud D., age 30, currently resides in the village of Amégnran. He is married and the father of four, but he supports two more, which brings the number of his dependents to six. A painter by profession, he is a recognized artist in his area and is known for the quality of his work. His shop was wrecked, so he is forced to stay home due to a lack of funds. Yet he is more and more in demand and feels the need to fix up his shop, so that people can locate him when the time comes. He is requesting a loan of $1,000.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 30 ans, Monsieur D. Ablam Renaud réside actuellement dans le village d’Amégnran. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants mais il en supporte deux de plus ; ce qui porte le nombre des personnes à sa charge à six (06).
